comment: I bought this for the Nintendo Switch but what made me really love it was in flight entertainment.  It declutters your whole flight experience; less hassle with the trays, meals, people getting up to go to the bathroom, etc. It's small and light enough that I just leave it dangling by the audio cord (in flight or on the Switch.)The battery lasts longer than my bluetooth headphones plus it can charge while operating so battery life isn't an issue.

I'd say this is the best Bluetooth TX/RX model you can get right now.  Much more reliable than many others I have tried.  The model can both transmit and receive.  In reality people will use the receive mode most often (e.g. in an older car or older hifi that cannot receive bluetooth).  Or if you have a new iphone that you want to use with existing non-bluetooth headphones.  Transmit will most likely be used in aeroplanes (if you want to use your own bluetooth headphones rather than the ones provided by the airline) or perhaps if you have like a very old iPod without bluetooth that you would like to connect to a bluetooth speaker.Pairing is comparatively simple.  Note that the device clears its entire pairing history every time you flip the RX/TX (receive/transmit) switch to the other side.  Pairing the TX(transmit) mode is perhaps more difficult because you will typically be pairing with a BT headphone or speaker.  Once pairing is activated, the TaoTronics will pair with the "closest" BT device.  In reality I guess it just pairs with the strongest audio-capable BT signal it can find.  So if there are plenty of BT devices around it could in theory pair with the wrong device, but you'll know when you got it right.  I would recommend that you try to pair with your headphones in a space away from other BT noise to keep things simple.  For example, I once tried to pair the TaoTronics to my BT headphones without success... until I realized it kept pairing with my TV's soundbar in the room next door :)  Moving away solved the problem.  Of course, once paired, everything will work fine until you flip the RX/TX switch (which you're unlikely to do often).

I wanted a bluetooth transmitter for my non-bluetooth Samsung smart TV so I can use bluetooth earbuds. I already have a Sony bluetooth transmitter that has the over-the-ear headsets which work fine, just wanted the option for smaller, less outside sound inhibiting earphones so I can still hear what's going on around me if I want. The TT-BA-07 is small, light and easy to set up, once I figured out how to pair it to my LG earbuds. It recognizes my earbuds every time I turn the transmitter on, so I don't have to pair it every time. Con features: very short (6“)3.5 mm cord for using off the back of a TV audio jack. I purchased a longer cord to connect with the transmitter to the TV.  It also comes with a very short (12“) charging cable, so I purchased a longer compatible charging extension for it so I can keep it charged all the time rather than charge it every 10 hours. I am pleased with this small, but powerful device. I would recommend it.

This is little device is great! I live with my sister and her fiance and they live in the basement room directly under me, and unfortunately my stereo is on the other side of the room and I often want to fall asleep while listening to vinyl but can't. But this little beast really comes in clear. I do hear some machine sounding stuff here and there but honestly I don't mind. If you happen to be a snobbish audiophile or have a fear of spontaneously developing tinnitus don't buy this. You'll just leave a 1 star review because you can hear that background noise or it'll be the one thing that pushes you over the edge into that psychotic break that's been building up. Happy listening!Now when I get stoned at 4 in the morning and wanna listen to Behemoth I won't bother my family (like now for instance). Thanks Amazon!

This is an inexpensive little bluetooth receiver/transmitter that will allow you to turn a device without bluetooth into one with it.  I used it along with a little RCA switcher to connect several audio sources to a bluetooth speaker in my apartment.  It worked as described.  It's simple to use, though you will need to read the directions to figure out how to control it with its single button.  It is best used when paired up with a single device, because the controls don't allow for easy switching around.  When you turn it on by holding down the button, it just looks for the last thing it was paired with.  Which was fine for my purposes, but if you want to move between speakers like you could with a phone easily, I'd suggest something else.But this thing did what it promised and has done it very well, so I give it 5/5.
I was really surprised when it came that it was really small but worked great I personally use it with my AirPods and Nintendo switch lite so if your buying it for that I would recommend!

My wife and I don’t watch TV at home, aside from streaming things occasionally. But when we travel, she always  watches TV in the hotel room. I’m usually trying to read and get distracted by the noise.  Finally decided to pick these up and try them out... and they’re great! She can listen on her nice headphones “probably better quality audio than the TV speaker), and I don’t have to listen... and if I want to, i can pair my earphones to it, too (and they’re definitely better quality than a hotel tv.)The only complaint I have are that some hotel TVs don’t have audio-out jacks, some have digital-only ones so this won’t work, and some either don’t have USB jacks or the jacks don’t provide power.

This little device is the Best Buy I've ever bought in electronics. It plugged right into my TV I put it on transmitted and I can put on my Bluetooth earphones and listen to my TV to all hours of the night without disturbing anybody.. was really surprised me is that it also has a receiver mode so I can hook it to my Bluetooth speakers add easily transmit songs from my phone or any other MP3 or music device I have. It is a no-brainer by don't buy anything more expensive you don't need it. I was also very surprised how long the charge last on the rechargeable battery inside. When the device was totally dead it charged in a matter of less than 3 hours. My Bluetooth headphones took longer. My neighbors love it better than I do cuz they don't have to hear any loud music or TV at night.
This works like a charm on flights. Paired with both AirPods and Jabra 75t Elite. You won’t regret purchasing them.

I've wanted a device like this for an older TV (without built-in bluetooth) but I was afraid that there would be a lag between the picture and the sound. When I first started looking for devices like this a couple of years ago many of the reviews talked about this problem. I know there is an adjustment in the TV settings for this issue but I was hoping it would work without having to do any of that. This transmitter works perfecty. I did have just a little problem understanding how to pair the TaoTronics headphones I recently purchased with this transmitter, but once I understood the steps it was easy. I've successfully connected other headphones and I have and even connected this transmitter with the streamer for my hearing aids. Watching TV and hearing the sound through my hearing aids is great.I will be purchasing another one of these devices for a second older TV.

As a frequent flier I bought a pair of AirPods Pro hoping to finally leave my bulky Bose QC behind. I quickly realized that if I wanted to use my Nintendo Switch, the inflight entertainment system, etc I wouldn’t be able to since they require a wired connection.  This Bluetooth TX/RX helped solve that problem.  Paired it up with my AirPods Pro and now can leave the Bose behind.  I was a little worried that maybe there would be latency/sync issues.  In the videos I have played and the games I have tried on my switch it is imperceptible.  The device is super light weight and compact as well.  I attached some photos to show the scale.

Connected the transmitter the night I got it & it worked fine, second night it would not pair with my wireless headphones. Check to see if my headphones were working okay, & it connected to my cell with no problems. I tried again to pair with my headphones & still did not connect. Returning & trying a different brand. Will not buy this brand again.

I love this device. Had some volume issues at first, but don't know whether it was the fault of the device or me. Probably the latter.Once I got the transmitter to work with my Bluetooth headphones, it has become a great joy to use. I can plug the device into the audio output jack of any audio device, whether it is Bluetooth capable or not, and I'm good to go. Does your computer have Bluetooth? Is it on? Does it require you to use a user interface to look up devices you want to pair with? None of that matters if you use this little device. Pair it once with your Bluetooth headphones. Plug it into any device you want to hear audio from. Bam. You're done. Computer. Amazon Echo. Amazon Fire tablet. TV. Phone. If it has an audio output jack that will accommodate an included audio cable, then you're golden. Keep the transmitter in transmit mode, and it will remember your headphones every time you turn them both on.

I think this is a really good product. I was able to link this transmitter to my in ear monitors flawlessly. I used the transmitter plugged into headphones and linked it to my phone and it worked great, very easy to set up But,unfortunately I'm going to have to send it back.I am a drummer /keyboard player. I bought this transmitter to plug into the headphone out of my small stage drum mixer so that I could bluetooth the mix to my in ear monitors and eliminate the cord from in ears to mixer. The transmitter linked easily but when I hit a drum there was way to much latency.If I hit the kick there was a delay before I heard the sound. While listening to a song on my phone wouldn't expose this latency,trying to play an instrument with a delay isn't acceptable. I was bummed because I really wanted this to work for the stage.
This product works amazingly!  I bought this in a last-ditch attempt to "convert" my car radio into a BT-enabled set up.  I love my car radio; it has a lot of options I love, just not BT.Pros:

I bought my dad a 4K LG Smart TV for Christmas one year and a pair of Bluetooth headphones the following year so he could hear his tv from his desk at the back of the family room. The problem was that the tv did not have Bluetooth transmitting capability, so I purchased this little device to fix the problem. Low and behold, the only output on the tv for sound would not work for this device, but thankfully the cable box saved the day. Now he can listen to his football game from the back of the room without the rest of us in the house having to hear it as well!

I got two of these and personally measured their sound latency in receive mode when paired with a known-good aptX Low Latency transmitter - both are consistently around 200ms (aptX LL should be 30-50ish).  I have personally verified my transmitter is aptX LL compatible with two other separate aptX LL devices.  But these are not and it's highly misleading that they title says they are (my guess is it might work as a LL transmitter but I didn't test that because it's not why I bought these).  I'm returning mine.  Do not buy if you need a low latency receiver!(For what it's worth, I verified the TROND brand device with exactly the same shape and design IS an aptX LL compatible receiver and I'll be keeping that one).

This transmitter works great for me. I have Iphone 7 and since they eliminated the 3.5 jack (which is sucks) I need a bluetooth transmitter for my phone if I want to drive while listening to my music and charge my phone at the same time. it is really easy to instal. just plug it in to the AUX-IN jack on your car and plug the charger in. you would have to press and hold the on and off button for a while until the light turn blue so it can be connected with your phone. you just need to set up one time only and after that just press and hold the on off button and it will automatically connects to your phone. I carry this with me everywhere from speaker to car to headphone.

I bought this to send alerts from a Uniden radar detector to a Cardo headset in my motorcycle helmet.  The unit is very small, looks well made, and I thought it would work perfectly. Unfortunately, there were a couple of problems. First, I had a heck of a time getting the unit to pair with my headset. This is unusual as I have paired phones, GPS units, and a BMW motorcycle’s audio system to the Cardo without any problem. After finally getting it to link, I discovered that the unit would not transmit correctly if it is being externally powered. On battery only, I can hear the radar detector’s output perfectly. With power connected, the sound is distorted terribly if it’s audible at all. I would not recommend this device.UPDATE:  I determined that the problem with transmitting while connected to power was caused by a ground loop. Not the TaoTronics’ fault. If you are not using it in a vehicle, this will not likely be an issue. If it is, get a ground loop isolator. As far as pairing goes, I still find this unit more picky about pairing than others, but I did get it paired, and once done, the sound was very good. I should also mention that the seller of this item has contacted me every day since I posted the original review with suggestions and offers to help. If they are this conscientious with product support, then all good. Upgrading my review from 2 stars to 4.

I have a number of quality TaoTronics products and have enjoyed them without troubling problems to figure out or fix.  This is why I became so disappointed with this Bluetooth Transmitter device.My Transmitter worked for about a month or so and then started having difficulties pairing and now, it is completely not willing to pair and transmit with any enabled device.  In my case, this was the whole reason for the purchase.

Didn't work out of the box... wouldn't charge so item was completely useless. Tried charging for several hours (documentation said charge for 2) and still didn't work. Since the item has generally high rating I'll give it another shot once the refund is processed and will adjust rating if new one lives up to expectations.

Surprisingly small and compact but I purchased this to watch/listen wireless to movies and play video games and there is a noticeable latency between what's happening on screen and when you hear it. My experience is from 4-5 feet away (from transmitter to my headset). If I had to guess, the latency is between 0.25 and 0.5 seconds so, if you're watching a movie, the lip syncing will be off and can be distracting.Now with that being said, if you plan on using this to just listen, this is an exceptional product. Sound quality is good, it's small and durable, and it's easy to use.

The TaoTronics Bluetooth Transmitter TT-BA07 works great with my TaoTronics Bluetooth Headphones TT-BH20.  To get them to pair (connect)  I plugged my headphones in to the wall socket with my charge chord like I always do when I am ready to charge them.  Then I pressed the pair button (the triangle) and they flashed blue and red--pairing mode.  Then I turned on my transmitter by pressing and holding the on button for 5 seconds or less.  The transmitter flashed blue and red and then paired with my headphones immediately.  After that, I unplugged my headphones from the wall.  Then I found the 3.5 mm cable for the transmitter and put that on.  I plugged the transmitter into the 3.5 mm headphone jack at the back of my TV and was able to hear the sound instantly.  I also plugged the charging cable into the transmitter (the one that came in the box) and plugged it into the USB port at the back of my TV.  This will keep it charged.

UPDATE: April 23, 2020:  from 3 stars to 4 stars.Reason: TaoTronics offered me a free pair of TaoTronics TT-BH085 noise cancelling headphones and a $30 gift card after posting a 3 star review for customer satisfaction. After shipping the headphones, I was asked to either sweeten or delete this review. I chose to improve it to 4 stars for providing outstanding customer service. Those headphones, and these transmitters, are great, but not perfect.

Used this to make an older Samsung tv bluetooth compatible with a tower speaker across a room for grandparents.  Struggle a bit then read some reviews on amazon; and one suggested plugging it into the cable box; worked like a dream.  The whole room of people lit up on Thanksgiving when the sound started coming from across the room!  We used it in transmit mode on the cable box with the red and white plugs female ends on the box and the USB charging cable plugged in all the time so grandparents won't have to worry about dead batteries.  Shipping was well packed and came exactly when we expected.  Would buy again; one for us to use on airplanes, etc.

I recently bought a new car that doesn't have an AUX port.  I have a new car, but I still have all of my music on my iPod Classic which I always played through my old car's AUX port.  Now that I have only bluetooth in the car, I needed to find a way to transmit bluetooth from my old iPod.  I thought this unit would be just the thing, but I could not get it to connect as a transmitter to any of my bluetooth devices (not my car, not my Galaxy tablet, not my Samsung Note 8).  I sent it back.I want to add that the seller was terrific and tried to solve the problem with me.  I recommend the seller, and the product may work great as a receiver, but it didn't work at all as a transmitter for me.

There is a high pitched noise that comes out of the speakers when paired with this device. It is most definitely the device making the noise because it does not make the noise when the speakers are connected to my phone. We are very disappointed since this adapter had such good reviews.

In my role, I travel almost weekly. Sometimes the airlines selection is worth trying. I don't like being corded to the seat like a Borg, so I try to do as many wireless connections as possible. My tablet, phone, etc have bluetooth, but what do you do about the seatback screens?? You get this little jewel. The size and cable lengths make it the perfect companion for anyone traveling and wanting to use the available entertainment. For me, I carry a BT collar, so the TaoTronics piece fits right in that case. It pairs easily and I have paired it with that collar, a Bose QC and a Bose SoundLink (for work application). Sometimes you have to repair it when you move from one device to another, but it is no big deal as pairing is a snap. I tried it out for a few weeks and it performed so well, I got another one for the missus. She thoroughly enjoys hers and uses a Bose QC as well. It is truly a must have on cross country flights when you are using the airline's feeds and ports. I now only carry one pair of corded buds-and that is for actual calls. Otherwise, if I need a hit a port and go BT, this is THE WAY TO GO!! Charging is a snap, too. I have never run this down all the way, but I have only been on 5-6 hour flights and it takes less than an hour to bring this back to full.One downside is a bit of a noise if you try to charge it while using it on the plane. Think it is picking up on the noise on the plane's power feeds.
Update:8/18/18

I hate this thing so much.After spending hours trying to sync it with your earbuds it will suddenly start working flawlessly, convincing you that it was user error all along, only to stop working again a day later for no reason.

easy to understand instructions and using for the first time. Unfortunately there was so much static that I was unable to watch television shows and movies without continuous interruption. I will be returning and searching for a new product

It does exactly what you need it to do, so 4 stars there. Unfortunately there's no way to check the battery, so I get to be surprised as I drive home sometimes and it just stops working. Then if I plug it into my car, I get that great hissing as the battery is being charged while emitting sound. For this reason I occasionally bring it into my house to charge when I get home, but that's only if I remember. The killer is when you're unsure how much battery life it has before you go on a long drive and, well, just hope you didn't forget to charge it I guess.This would be a 5/5 product if there was any indicator on it of battery life. A small, LCD bar would have been perfect.

This device worked just as I needed it to. I have a surround sound system throughout the house with wired speakers and a TV in my kitchen which is where normally sit to watch the games and such. I needed to be able to connect my TV to the stereo/surround sound to get better sound while watching a games, in the kitchen hanging out with family and friends. This device made the connections easily and so far I can't see any delay. It may be because it a proximity of my device and the surround sound (less than 3ft),but it works great.
Love the ability to transmit and receive for the various applications I use it for.  Proved to be much more versatile and of a higher quality than some more expensive transmitters I've tried.

Was skeptical about purchasing a Bluetooth transmitter because I had heard they can be disappointing. Fortunately that wasn’t the case with the TaoTronics - it works great. My husband is quite the audiophile and is very difficult to please but he was very impressed with the sound quality when he used this with his iPod. Haven’t used it as a receiver yet but as a transmitter we’re very satisfied!

This little guy is awesome. My fiancé and I can’t do without it when we are traveling— we use it to connect two sets of Bluetooth headphones to the same device to watch movies or tv together. There’s a great video tutorial online for how to connect two devices that don’t have an interface to actually select the transmitter for pairing, which helped us a lot because it’s a little tricky. Once you connect the first time it’s almost automatic though. I’ve also used it to get Bluetooth audio in my car, and to transmit from a record player to a Bluetooth speaker. The uses are endless and this little box has become invaluable for us!

Be careful purchasing if you are wanting low latency for use with in-ear monitors.  This device says it uses aptX low latency - your receiver/headphones also need to be low latency as well.  (Even then, the latency will likely be ~40ms, which could be too much for some musicians.)Dropping this to one star because TaoTronics continually pesters me via amazon email because of my earlier review informing buyers of the low latency item.

This is a great product. I use it all the time to watch television late at night or when I'm doing something that makes a lot of noise such as dishes or vacuuming while I'm watching television. It is so easy to pair up with my Skullcandy speaker and my earphones the customer service was absolutely the best I have ever experienced purchasing an online product. Tori was very helpful in confirming what else I needed to get so that it works with Netflix and Amazon Prime videos. I highly recommend this product and mostly highly recommend purchasing it from this company.
I like everything about this marvelous product.

I needed something that transmits as well as having a backup receiver to my primary unit. I hook this up to my projector before I had to run a cord across the living room and people kept stepping on it. Plug this thing into the projector 3.5 headphone jack set to transmit and now I can utilize Bluetooth functionality without the cord Laying across the living room would highly recommend it if you're trying to get sound somewhere and don't want to run a lot of wires across the floor

Super handy device. I need to order a couple more for other uses. I have an analog stereo system I use for cassettes and LP use, but sometimes I want to stream music to it via my phone. This TaoTronics tx/rx unit is perfect for it.It comes with an RCA adapter so you can plug this into the L and R of any input on your receiver and bind the TT unit to your phone. Switch the TT unit to receive and you now have the ability to stream music from your phone.

Two weeks later it still works exactly as advertised in transmitting from amplifier to my bluetooth headphones.  The set-up and pairing was fairly easy (I'm not all that tech savvy; but I figured it out within minutes.)  The transmission works everywhere in my smallish apartment, even through 2 walls.

This item was purchased after discovery that Bluetooth does not support shared or linked connections for audio receive for 2 headsets.  The 4.1 transmitter plugged into audio output of my MS Surface Pro 4 and was able to pair with both Bluetooth headsets recently purchased to share watching movies on overseas flights and in Europe.  I had to turn volume on my tables to 100% and use the level control on each headset to suit each listener as I have hearing loss and my wife does not.  Also did not notice any delay or stuttering as noted by other reviewed on this device.Why does Microsoft not support this feature as there are thousands other that want do use multiple Bluetooth devices to receive sound via Bluetooth?

This is the second device from Tao Tronics. The first was the Model: TT-BA09. This worked fine for two days then it would not pair with my brand new Jabra headphones and would not power off. It was returned and I ordered this. Had a hard time getting it to pair with my Jaybird X3's. Finally did after multiple attempts and there was a constant static. This unit will be returned as well.The second unit was hooked up to a USB port on my computer where it apparently was introducing some sort of interference. Upon moving it to a regular USB power block it worked fine. Customer service response was promt.

UPDATE: received replacement and works perfect out of the box.... didn't fall apart on me... also no more static sound while charging via TV USB port... Thank You for fast responds... bumping to 5 stars.it works! but!

This device is great! I’ve used it in both tx and rx modes. It works with my BT headphones to watch late night tv without keeping others awake. So as long as your set has an analogue audio out jack this will work.  I usually use it with my old Bose radio/cd player on the aux input line so I can stream music to it from my iPad or iPhone. The battery life seems adequate, but have not tried to run it down, and you can use it while it’s being charged so not really an issue. I’m definitely thinking of getting another one soon.

So far this transmitter is awesome! I've only been using it for a few days, but it's finally made my Pixel 2 satisfying in the audio department. In fact, it's actually superseded having a traditional headphone jack! Something I never thought I'd ever say. It's super nice to just always have my earbuds connected to it and then the second I turn the transmitter on, to be able to listen to whatever is happening on my phone. It's extra convenient because now I can use my phone without worrying about expensive earbuds tangling on door handles or other objects that might be sticking out.The TX option is also super convenient when connecting two Bluetooth devices and works really well. Both actually stay connected at 15+ feet!

This is great little device, it will make your sound system Bluetooth . Now you can listen to your device via wireless. There is one thing you need to check for on your device. It must allow your device to send the sound out to non speaker type device. Some sound systems will ONLY go to speakers. Example: My TV (Samsung 32") will only allow sound to go to external speakers. This TV is not a top of the line it is for bedroom use only.So if you need Bluetooth and your system allows the sound out to non speaker devices, this will work for you.

I love this device.  It works greats for almost everything.  Here is a break down of all my uses.  I've plugged it into my 47" LG TV's 3.5mm Head phone jack and I've been able to connect through Bluetooth, Sony XB20 speakers for surround sound.  I have two XB20s and the only issue I've had is that I have to turn off the TV's built in speaker, otherwise I'll get an echo effect.  However, there is no lag between the audio and the video, everything sounds in sync.  When I don't want surround sound I can still pair it to my Jay Bird older model ear buds with full volume control and no sounds issues.  I have also plugged it into a PS4 Controller's 3.5mm connection and used it with the same ear buds while gaming. Battery life is awesome and charging time has given me no issues. The only down side I've experience is recently with the new purchase of Beat By Dre Ear Buds Powerbeats3.  These do not seem to work well at all with this device.  You can get a connection and receive sound, but I have no volume control what so ever, and the volume is very low.  I have to use my old ear buds for now if I want to watch TV using ear buds.  I have not tried any other Beats such as the solo, so I'm not sure to what extent those would work with this device, if at all. Still a 5 Star product in my opinion.

I bought this product specifically for three different reasons:(1) When I am on a Delta flight and there is in flight entertainment and I do not feel like using the GO-GO app on my phone to watch a movie because I want to try to go to sleep and I want to utilize my noise canceling headphones.  When I use my Bose noise canceling head-phones, as soon as I utilize the 3.5mm jack, the noise canceling feature is gone.  To circumvent this issue, I bought this contraption and it appears to work OK.

Small, simple, effective Bluetooth adapter.  It has helped my Tivoli Audio Model One speaker enter the digital age.  I own many quality Bluetooth speakers (Bose, Jawbone Jambox, UE Boom) but this Tivoli blows them all away thanks to this little adapter.

A very good product...I did have a problem the 1st time...It took 10mins to get it to work...once it worked I have used the transmitter to hook up to my Bluetooth headphones...also used it to my Bluetooth speaker(hooked up to Samsung tv 46'' 8000 series ...Onkyo tx sr606 receiver headphone jack)...I didn't have any Bluetooth equipment until I read about your product and took a chance...for less than $30.00 I was really impressed how well it transmitted to headphones and speaker...too bad that it can transmit to 2 devices at once...I have also bought a transmitter only device too... I  really like like this product...I would buy this product again...thanks
Very SATISFIED.  Exactly what I wanted.  I'm using it for Bluetooth TX, but it can be switched to RX and has a variety of adapters.

I bought this to use on my projector so I didn't have to run 3.5mm sound cable all the way to the front of the room where my sound bar is. It works great.  THe only issue is you can't charge it while using, otherwise you get a very high pitch sound that ruins the movie. To solve this, I use a separate usb power pack up on the projector to charge it.  The other downside, it you have to hold the button down for a few seconds to get it to connect after powering on. Overall a great buy.

I use this BT Transmitter to send the audio from our movie projector to a remote BT speaker approximately 12' away under the projector screen. Older BT transmitters sometimes had unavoidable lag issues which is acceptable for music only applications but for AV use (movies, TV shoes, etc..) you can not tolerate lag as the audio starts trailing the video and gives you the dreaded "lip sync" problem. Newer BT devices don't introduce lag and happily this BT transmitter is lag free for AV use. Now we don't have to worry about anyone tripping over the audio cable from the projector to the speaker in the dark... and no "lip sync" issues.Another plus is that the projector has a dedicated USB power port and this BT transmitter/receiver can be plugged in to power when running, so we could view endless movies and never worry about the BT transmitter/receiver running low on battery.

Unit works ok, but has a signal delay enough to see the lips move on tv before hearing the words. I originally bought this to play my guitar thru a pre-amp and into my blue tooth headphones.  Big delay in signal making it impossible to do. Went back to using my 900Mhz wireless headphones, no delay there.

Ok then I received the transmitter late yesterday and so far I love it and seems of good quality of make. It comes with all the instructions needed pluse a cable i did not know about a cable that could connect to my older home receiver cable has a left and right rca connectors for the auxiliary port on in the back which i am using now and very happy with its performance. I have not tried to the tx part connecting 2 Bluetooth devices which i did not need but will try anyway soon overall i am very happy

You need to stop selling this! I read that you could use with up to two Bluetooth device with it. After making three calls to TaoTronics support . Call number 1 they told me the manual is wrong and they have not updated it at this point. Weird because 100%  of the time you get the manual in the box with the project. Yes, I do know you can download it off the internet before you buy it. That pointless if the manual is wrong! Support is right it will only connect to one Bluetooth device.  After her talking to 10 mins and I could not get her to stop to ask questions she hung up on me. Call number 2 went almost the same way but this person told me that this "TaoTronics Bluetooth 5.0 Transmitter and Receiver, 2-in-1 Wireless 3.5mm Adapter (aptX Low Latency, 2 Devices Simultaneously, For TV/Home Sound System)" will only work on TV and that;s it.  Call number 3 I ask to talk to a manager and they told me there is no manager.I think my only problem I have is the ad needs to be truthful and tell you that this adapter only works with one Bluetooth device. NOT TWO!

I really was hopeful with this product because I love watching movies late night so this would be perfect foe my Bose QC35. First product arrived and it has static sound in it, thought it was just the audio connector so I made sure it was hooked on properly but still have static and worse when you turn the volume up! I figured it could be just a defective product and I really still want to have a bluetooth transmittee device- So i asked for a replacement- 2 day shipping later it arrived. I plugged the new one in; this time the volume is very low! the other piece of the headphone doesn’t recieve any feed so I tried it also on my Beats wireless just to be sure that wasn’t the Bose having the issues- same thing-only one speaker works- volume is minimal- as much as I hate not having a bluetooth transmitter I will have to return it because of 2 defective products I recieved from Taotronics- wished they would do a thorough quality control on their products so it do not create hassle to consumers
Great product. Connects very easily to my bluetooth headphones. Simple to use. Definitely recommend.
Bought it on a hunch, and will buy a second one for the wife!I haven't tried connecting more than one device at a time, but other than that, it works as advertised!

I originally bought this for use with my Nintendo Switch on a long flight across the country. Paired to my Sony over ear headphones (Sony MDRZX770BT - slightly older model, but supports AAC and apt-x), I had a great experience. I played my Switch the entire 6 hour flight out and 4 hour flight back, after only charging the TaoTronics device once before leaving on my trip. The battery life is superb, and so is the sound quality. I had no problems with latency at all. I also had no problems with volume despite being on a noisy plane (I wasn't even at max volume on my Switch).I wanted a device like this because I didn't want to plug anything into the USB-C port on the Switch. I felt it would get in the way if I wanted to hold/rest my Switch on the tray table on the plane. I also bought a USB-C audio transmitter that was more expensive just to see how I like it. I ended up returning it and keeping the TaoTronics. I had a different TaoTronics Bluetooth receiver a few years ago that I used in my car, and I had a good experience with that device too. So I figured I'd try them again; I was not disappointed. I also liked the versatility of the drive. Being able to use it as a transmitter and receiver, being able to use 3.5mm (1/8th inch, aka aux or headphone jack) and red/white composite cables made it a better value and nearly universally compatible with other devices or applications, while also being cheaper, compared to other devices (like Nintendo Switch specific Bluetooth audio devices).

This was very simple to install - nothing to it.  Connected right away, and was able to broadcast excellent quality sound to my headphones immediately. I used it for TV sound - just plugged it in and charged it up, connected to headphones, and boom - instant sound IN the headphones, no sound in the room.  Perfect.  Also, charge lasted okay - completely through a long evening of sitting and watching/listening.  The next night (didn't charge in between) it faded a bit after 3 hours, but that's to be expected - had to charge it right up then it worked fine.  Highly recommend it - good piece of equipment!

I love my old iPod Classic, but I was unable to use it with my Bluetooth headphones or speaker.  I Googled to see if a gadget such as this one existed, and sure enough, it does.  I took a chance and ordered it, despite the reviews saying that it was difficult to pair.  I got it, charged it up, and it easily paired with my headphones, as well as my Bose portable speaker.  It is very small and lightweight (you can see the size compared to the iPod in the photo).It comes with cables to connect it to a TV or cable box so you can get TV sound on Bluetooth speakers or headphones, but I have not tried it that way.  I bought this just to make my iPod Classic Bluetooth-compatible, and it does the job for that.  So I'm happy!

Every year I set up a projector and project Halloween and Christmas "holograms" across my lawn.But running 30 feet of heavy duty RCA cable and rock speakers when it gets dark, then rolling it back up around 11 PM and bringing in the speakers every night was such a pain.

I think my Tao Tronics Bluetooth transmitter died tonight. It has been a faithful, hard working, component for three and a half years! I used it at least eight hours everyday during that time period and it never failed to connect as needed. I never once unplugged it so you might say it was working for three and a half years non stop.Well done manufacturer! I’m ordering it’s replacement this instant.

I bought two of these, one to transmit and one to receive, so that I could send sound from a projector wirelessly to a speaker with a wall in-between (rear projection in a home window for a Halloween display).  It could not have been easier to set up.  Switch one to Rx and one to Tx, and they pair right away.  There is very little latency in the sound transmission, though I do notice some.  If I play a YouTube video using this setup, the sound is slightly out of sync, just enough to notice.  It was inconsequential to this purpose, and would not matter if you were using them to transmit music only.  But, if you are trying to use these for video, you might be wary of this issue.Aside from the slight lag in the sound transmission, these things are great.  Pairing is simple, the battery life seems exactly as advertised, they are small and attractive, no complaints.

My Samsung tv is not Bluetooth enabled. We wanted wireless speakers to connect to TV. Best Buy sales rep told me couldn't be done. However YouTube video showed me how. So I bought the TaoTronics Bluetooth 4.1 Transmitter and Receiver, 2-in-1 Wireless 3.5mm Adapter and my Wi-Fi/Bluetooth speakers. I couldn't get it to pair per instructions but that was because I have a cable box connected to TV. Plugged the tanker into the cable box and it paired quickly to the speakers.

I recently purchased a similar receiving device and it was a nightmare to pair. I tried for hours to find the right method and ended up returning it.This one paired within a minute. Plug in, turned it on into pairing mode, turned my headphones on into pairing mode and within a minute they were paired and ready to go. WOOT!
Bought this device to watch tv using Apple EarPods.Pros:
UPDATE: Got an email from Tao. "note our transmitter can't support the collecting sound from the mic."So if you are wanting to use it with a headset with a mic, it won't work.

This Taotronics bluetooth transmitter/receiver plugged into a Yamaha DGX 650 keyboard paired with a Taotronics headset easily. But then there were two problems rendering this product unusable. First problem - volume was very low even with Yamaha keyboard volume turned way up. The second problem, the latency from keyboard to headset made this transmitter useless. Impossible to play the keyboard with such a significant lag to the headphones. Hence the one star rating.I am upping this review from a one star rating for the items mentioned in the paragraph above to a four star rating due to the unsolicited customer service provided to me after I posted this review. Customer service contacted me and expressed their apologies for the the time wasted having to try this item out and then return it. They then sent me a set of headphones for my trouble and at my suggestion added a note to the product description that this device is "not recommended for streaming live music..... guitar, keyboard etc. "  To see this note - scroll down to "Product Description" notes. I was impressed with this effort by customer service to correct problems and satisfy customers.

I purchased this to hook to my projector I have mounted in my ceiling and connect to my stereo for movies. It worked great and connected to my Bluetooth device but I noticed when watching movies and the sound gets low on the movie during certain scenes...say when someone is whispering or the scene is very quiet this device quits sending the signal but will kick back on when the sound increases making it incredibly annoying when watching a movie. I thought I had a bad device but read in another review or two that it happens with other people as well. I think they mentioned it as some type of power saving feature which is the dumbest thing I have heard of because when I use mine it is plugged in and still does this. So don’t purchase this for movies. I am disappointed.

I like watching TV in bed for a short time before going to sleep, without disturbing my sleeping wife. I had a wireless TV headphone set that was beginning to give me problems. Since I have a Blue Tooth device on another TV in another house, I decided to go the Blue Tooth route. Unfortunately, that device is no longer available, so bought this one. I simply plugged it into the headphone jack on the TV and use it as a transmitter. I have never had need to try the receiver function, so I can't comment on that function. As a transmitter, it has a very good latency. i.e. lips are (usually) in sync with the sound. Although, rarely, there is a noticeable difference between lip movement and sound. In general, this is not a problem.I have two issues with this device. 1. I usually need to re-pair it with the headset. As a result, I re-pair it every time I use it.  This unit is very easy to pair and so is my headset, so no big problem; and,  2. This issue is more important to me. My other Blue Tooth transmitter will power down if it loses connection for about 5 minutes, so all I have to do is shut off my headset and go to sleep. This one will NOT power down, It just continues to run down the battery until I get out of bed and shut it off or let the battery run down.

EDIT: TaoTronics commented on my original review with instructions how to reset it and it worked! So the you can disregard the part of my original review that says it stopped working. I'm adding a 5th star.ORIGINAL REVIEW:

It’s very simple to use and in my experience has very reliable connectivity in receive or transmit modes. It’s has the expected sound quality of this kind of device. It’s well made and smaller than expected.My only issue with it is that on transmission mode the device automatically “sleeps” once the source audio is too low. Once sound passes a certain threshold it wakes up and audio quickly fades-in. This is quite annoying on Nintendo switch and AirPods because you have to crank the volume on the Switch up to max (to prevent the taotronics from sleep mode) and since AirPods have no volume control of their own it’s just max volume the whole time with no control. Flying around on Starlink or walking around in Zelda is particularly annoying because once music, shooting or action is done and all that is audible is wind, footsteps, or flying the device will sleep until something louder happens.

I initially had a problem pairing this 2 my headphones 4 my Zune. It's kinda difficult 2 tell that the item that U want 2 have paired, is indeed paired. At any rate, once paired, the neXt issue was the volume being X-tremely low w/ALL items already at maXimum level.I ultimately ended up disconnecting & charging up this device fully & made a new attempt afterwards & not only was I pleased but I was also X-cited 2 use my new transmitter. This li'l device works like a charm &, 2 me, is totally kool. As I mentioned b4, the only issue I have is the inability 2 tell what device is the transmitter is connecting 2 which, in this case, was my headphones.

I bought this product in preparation for my gf visiting me from far away, we ride on my bike across the East Coast and i bought this device to connect to two bluetooth headphones so we can listen to the same songs as we ride around. I tested it at home and yes it does connect two devices so i thought i was set. When we actually had to use it tho, it disconnected after 1-2 minutes. We reconnected it many times with the same result, disconnect after a min or two, and since this is it's only purpose, i rate this as complete garbage, do not waste your money on it.thanks for reading this far,
Update: The customer care is amazing and they have fully refunded for the amount. I have increased my rating after the nice gesture.Below is the previous review:
TaoTronics Bluetooth 5.0 Transmitter and Receiver: ★★Seller/MFG Customer Service: ★★★★★

sound is off a bit. could not be synchronized.  Revised on 8/11/2018Right after I wrote my review here, I was contacted by the seller. They did apologize for my discontent with the product. They fully explained how it works and now I understand better its performance. I also received a full refund for my purchase. Thanks for the amazing customer service. I will recommend this product 100 % if you use it as a Bluetooth transceiver / receiver for your music audio devises!!

I bought this transmitter to use with my TaoTronics sound bar (25-inches) since I figured using the same brand of speaker and transmitter would work better. NOT SO. The sound bar has a hard time picking up the transmitter. I have a projector with Roku set up. The transmitter is plugged into both for power and sound.How this generally goes, I turn on the projector which gives power to the transmitter. I hold down the transmitter button until it flashes blue and red. I turn on the sound bar. The blue light blinks. The red and blue transmitter light blinks. Blinking, blinking, blinking. 60 seconds later: still blinking--no connecting. 2 minutes later: still blinking--no connecting. 5 minutes... Turn the transmitter and the sound bar off and REPEAT. Unplug the transmitter and turn the sound bar off. REPEAT.

Purchased as a transmitter for my iPOD classic. Difficult to pair, actually had to pair using my iPhone (with phone bluetooth off), then switch to iPOD after finally got a connection with my earbuds. Once connection finally made, pairing was no longer an issue. The show stopping problem is that the unit cuts in and out when listening at low volumes, or when the music has a quiet passage. Will be working fine at louder levels, then when when the music has a quiet passage, the sound will cut out, then noticeably come back on (repeatedly) until the music gets to a louder passage. If your music is always loud with no quiet passages (or you listen at very high volume levels) this will likely work for you. If you listen at low volume levels and/or your music has any dynamic  range with very quiet passages, I would not recommend.

This thing is a very helpful little gadget to give your dumb TV or other device Bluetooth.Pretty easy to figure out and the instructions are enough to get you started. The adapter comes as a Bluetooth to 3.5mm aux, but it comes with an RCA Y-splitter to attach this to even older TVs with the white and red stereo plugs. Simply charge the adapter, plug the RCA or 3.5mm cable to an OUTPUT (labeled OUT), press and the power button for a few seconds to turn it on, and if it doesn't already go into pairing mode (red and blue flashing), tap the power button twice. Then go to your BT headphones and set that to pairing mode. Then just hope they pair. (Turn off your phone's BT to make sure that the only two devices in pairing mode will be the adapter and the headphones.) Give it about 30 seconds, then you SHOULD see the adapter go from flashing red and blue to a slow blue fade pulse to tell you that it's paired. Play something and see if it worked.

Update:The seller reached out via email and asked to verify my address so they could send me out a replacement. It arrived quickly and so far so good! Great customer service. Always nice when a company will stand behind their products. We've used it a few times so far and no problems. We will see if this one lasts longer.

I bought this to listen to music in my car without using an aux cord because the aux cord made it impossible to charge the phone and listen to music at the same time. I had a little trouble getting my iPhone to "find" the device even though both were turned on and in range. Once it connected the first time, it didn't have any issues connecting during subsequent drives. The sound quality is no different from when I have my phone plugged in with an aux cord. It's mildly annoying that you have to power on the device every time you crank the car; it would be cool if it just came one when the car cranks as long as it's plugged in. The only issue I've had is that sometimes my music app seems to have problems with this device. I use Spotify, and occasionally the music just stops and won't start again. It shows that it's playing but I can't hear it through the device. This never happened before I started using this device, but I don't know if the issue is with the device itself, with something in the Bluetooth settings, or with my iPhone. I have a fairly new iPhone and the Spotify app is the latest version. The problem comes and goes. For this price, I can deal with the fact that it's not perfect. I haven't used it as a transmitter, only as a receiver, so I can't speak to how well it works for that. For listening to music in a car that doesn't have built in bluetooth, I would buy this again.

I really wanted to like this TaoTronics Bluetooth 5.0 Transmitter and Receiver, and many things about it gave me reason to do so.It connects up easily, and its latency is quite low: when watching videos or movies where people are talking on camera, I didn't feel like I was watching a badly-dubbed movie.

I am using the TaoTronics Bluetooth TX-RX adapter to listen via wired headphones.  I've tried several bluetooth headsets (over ear, earbuds, etc.), which I use to drown out background noise while writing. I do this almost daily for many hours. I find it helpful not to lose my train of thought when I get up from a session if I have ambient sounds drowning out my noisy home. I also have a lot of experience in audio recording, which makes me a bit of a stickler for fidelity. In the past, I have been satisfied with cheaper headsets so long as they get the job done. The Cowin E7 was a reliable headset, excellent battery life and range, good sound isolation, but poor sound quality. I learned to live with the muddy and unbalanced sound due to its other strengths. The hinge broke recently, and my attempts to repair it failed. My many wired headsets hung pleadingly from the walls, so I figured, why not convert these beauties to bluetooth?In short, the TaoTronics adapter works in this application, with some pros and cons.

(Full disclosure: I've raised my rating from three to four stars, after TaoTronics gave me a gift certificate. They asked (but did not require) me to either raise this rating by one star or delete the review. I chose to raise the rating and be more informative about the company. Furthermore, to be honest, the problem I complained about before (see below) no longer bothers me as much as it first did. I now use these earphones for listening to news, talk shows or podcasts, so my original complaint is no longer an issue. And some other brands have these same issues.)FYI for people who might use these earphones for (e.g.) classical music: This device turns itself off if the volume of the content goes "too low". Turning up the volume from the source brings audio back, but at a higher volume than previously set, so one has to lower the volume, until it happens again.

And it doesn't pair very easily with Airpods.  My significant other and I wanted to both listen to TV with headphones. This unit looked like the ticket. It works fairly well with one BT headset, but once you connect two devices, the second one was in and out.  I reversing the order for the two BT headsets (the other was some Sony cans), with the Sony set connecting first, but then the Airpods wouldn't connect.Also, unpairs too easily.  And, to use them with my TCL TV, I need to unplug them from the back of the TV when I'm done, or it'll block the sound to the TV speakers or receiver. Which means I have to carefully unplug them after each use, and it's even harder trying to plug them into the back of the TV, to enjoy just a single-headset use.

If you had asked me to review this a month ago, well, I was ready to throw it out.  I had given up on using it...never had problems connecting to my bluetooth headset, and experiences no latency issues, however, sometimes sounds was in one ear, sometimes in the other, rarely in both at the same time.  Then I upgraded my home wifi.  The TV I was using this with was a streaming only TV - no cable hard wired in.  And it was a fairly lousy connection but I was generally able to watch TV.  With the addition of some Echo devices though and a desire to have more reliable and faster wifi, we installed a Google Nest mesh wifi.  I turned on my TV...and it was amazing how much better my streaming experience was!  I decided to give this gadget another try and WOW!  I'm blown away at how great it is.  Guess the crappy wifi was affecting sound streaming as well because now I love listening to my TV through my headset (TV isn't exactly IN my kitchen but I like having it on when I cook and it's a better listening/watching experience when I have the characters right there in my ears).  I've used this with two different bluetooth headsets and it pairs well with both and neither experience obvious latency.  One set is a cheaper pair and the other is also by TaoTronics, Sound Liberty 97.  The latter really only likes to be paired with one device so when I have used it with this after using them with another device it takes longer to pair, but that's on the ear buds, not this transmitter.  The range is very much what I expected it to be and fully meets my needs.  Really happy I gave this another try after upgrading my wifi.

Have owned for 3 months, still have never been able to use.  Read the (tiny) instruction booklet, checked YouTube, searched Google, even tried the “tech support” through Azn.  Want to use it on an airplane so I don’t have to mess with a headphone cable, but cannot pair.  Too late to return (kept hoping I could figure it out).  Save your money & buy something else.Update:  after much frustration, am finally able to use with my Sony WH-1000XM2 headphones on the plane.  I paired them using a SmartTv at home first:

This Bluetooth connector is excellent.  I have used it on many flights for both my Nintendo switch and the airline seatback movie player, and it is a great device to have.  I can connect my Bluetooth headphones easily, and the sound quality is great, with no latency.  Not having wires to manage when you or your seatmates get up to use the bathroom is really wonderful.  At home, I have used it to play switch games on the big screen while using my headphones, so as not to annoy my wife if she is in the same room.  The battery life is very very good.  I fly overseas once per year, with flight times of about 15 to 17 hours, and this device has made the whole trip on a full charge without ever dying.  Plus, it can be charged while you use it if you ever run into that need, which I've been able to do from the seatback USB ports some planes offer.  I have to say the range is pretty good too, we have a long distance from our living room to the bedroom, and it has not dropped out on me yet if I've paused my game and went to get something from the bedroom while keeping my headphones on.  I've used it sparingly as a receiver, with great results as well.  I'm about to buy a second one to leave in my car full time as a receiver to allow for Bluetooth connectivity there for my wife and me as well. I 100% recommend you stop shopping and buy this adapter.  You will be happy with it!

I have had this bluetooth transmitter and receiver unit in my arsenal for only three months.  I find myself using it constantly.  It can be used to transmit and receive bluetooth audio to and from virtually any device.  Pairing it in TX for transmission and RX for reception is very easy and straightforward.  I have discovered the control button can function as a play/pause button when receiving bluetooth audio.  This can be a great help if the transmitting device is close to or within range of this bad boy.  The short stubby audio patch cord which comes with this device can be easily swapped for a longer audio patch cord.  Same is true for the micro USB charging cord.  Attaching the RCA plug adapter to the audio patch cord allows to you transmit and receive via a pair of RCA jacks.  Traveling and storing this unit with your other equipment is as easy peasy as can be.  It can easily fit into your pocket, purse, or anywhere else.  If you plan to use this device with a pair of bluetooth headphones or headset, it can easily fit into your case with a headset or headphones.  The Bluetooth 5.0 technology, which this unit features, is state of the art, and is backwards compatible with earlier versions of Bluetooth.  This means that you don't necessarily need a Bluetooth 5.0 device to use with this unit.If you want to add Bluetooth flexibility in every sense of the word, you have found the perfect device to do just that.

Maybe I have a defective device given the other good reviews. However after 3 hours of charging for the 1st use, was very unstable to connect (Tx mode) from my non-bluetooth receiver (1/4” phono plug to 1/8” adapter to TT-BA07 with provided cable when using with Jaybird Vista BT earbuds.  Poor volume when finally connected and always a pain to connect. Even worse when trying to pair with AirPods Pro. Fully turned up maybe could hear something - and pairing took multiple attempts. Also checked the 1/4” to 1/8” adapter and receiver output settings with my 1/8” wired headphones that that worked fine. What a pain. Returned to Amazon (who was very helpful for the return).OK - so now the update - I was contacted by customer service about the issues I was having. No matter what I tried I could not get this to pair with the AirPods Pro with any volume. So they sent a replacement - TT-BA-09 Pro.  I would suggest resetting the TT-BA-09 pro twice (turn on in TX mode, then turn off. Switch to Rx mode turn on, then off, go back to Tx mode - on - off, Rx mode - on - off. Finally back to Tx mode.  Don’t know if this was unique to my unit that it needed to be a clean clean reset - but no concern to me - it worked!  Connected to AirPod Pro with very good volume.  Only request would be that the max volume could be a bit better with the AirPods Pro (doesn’t seem to be an issue with my Jaybird Vista’s).

I bought this little item about two years ago, as I had just purchased bluetooth headphones and wanted the option to connect to my TV without disturbing my sleeping husband.  It worked like a charm, but I didn't actually need to use it much.  Fast forward to 2020.  We are now  streaming TV shows and films on Amazon Prime and BritBox and because my husband has tinnitus, he needs a clearer audio signal and more volume than I do.  We each have a Bluetooth speaker, and although I found various hacks to connect a computer to two Bluetooth speakers at the same time, I could not get this to work for me.  Invariably, if I connected to one speaker, the other would cut out, and I could not use the computer speakers AND a Bluetooth speaker or any other combination.  It was one or the other, never both.I remembered this small item specifically stated in the instructions it will transmit to two devices simultaneously, and though the output for the Bluetooth speakers was dismal, I was able to connect both of our Bluetooth headsets with no problems.  This relatively tiny device solved the problem neatly, using the audio output on my computer and a USB port for power.  One warning; turn off the Bluetooth on any other device within range before you set things up.  If another Bluetooth signal is active, it will interfere with your initial set up.

The product description mentions AptX LL support. However, AptX LL is only supported when the device is in TX mode. In RX mode, only AAC or SBC works. If paired with another receiver, it seems to work only in SBC (there's no obvious way to verify which codec is in use since no forms of indicators are available) as the receiver does not support AAC in TX. Therefore if you plan to use a pair of these, you WILL suffer significant audio latency. If you plan to use this as a receiver with a relatively recent phone as a transmitter, latency won't be as bad, but it's still noticeable.

This is a tiny little device about the size of two matchbooks.  Much smaller than expected.  I suppose that’s a good thing, as when it hangs from the mini 4” line-out cable it puts very little stress on the jack.  That is very good.I wouldn’t mind there being more buttons, as I prefer dedicated buttons for each function over the trend of having one button that does everything using a variety of clicks and holds which I must memorize.  I needed to keep the booklet with it to know how to operate it.  It’s not too difficult, hold for 5 seconds to power on/off, then two clicks to pair with speaker.  Once unpaired from the phone, and only then, will it connect to the speaker, and it does so via holding them in close proximity.  I was concerned how I would do the pairing without a screen, but it wasn’t difficult and worked the first time.  It was actually my second attempt, but my first attempt I hadn’t successfully unpaired the speaker from my phone.  I had gone into Bluetooth settings on my phone and clicked disconnect, it said it was disconnected, but that didn’t do anything.  I had to turn the speaker off first and then click disconnect in my phone settings.  Then I turned this transceiver off.  Then I started over.  I turned it on again, saw the blue standby light, did the two taps and saw the red/blue blinking that indicates pairing mode, turned the now-unpaired speaker back on, and within seconds they were paired and working as desired.  The instructions say to hold the two items within 3’ of each other to pair them.

I don’t have anything to compare this to so these are my Bluetooth Transmitter Naive results. Connectivity is easy and signal is really strong. No signal drops even when walking to other rooms and around corners. I opted to connect via the headphone jack on the front of my Yamaha AV A-820. I had to buy an adapter at a local electronics store in order to get this to fit in the headphone jack.... the headphone jack on the Yamaha is larger than what this transmitter has. Maybe it came with one and I threw it out? Who knows, but it was only a few dollars.  I have 3 different headphones/ earbuds I use this with.. Bose Soundsports, Jaybird Vistas and Sony WH1000-XM3.  Sound is strong in all 3 with the Sony’s sounding the best (duh)  The volume is as loud as I will ever need it to be for oldier movies like Led Zepplin , The Song Remains the Same. There isn’t any noticeable lag time between the video and audio I am picking up from whatever I’m watching. I would definitely recommend buying this because it’s a lot less expensive than buying a new receiver with a built in Bluetooth Transmitter.

I ordered this to use with my blue tooth ear buds on my TV, since the TV is not blue tooth ready. I didn't know until I was setting this up that my TV did not have a 3.5mm headphone jack. Luckily this device came with a Red/White RCA to 3.5mm adapter, which saved the day. My blue tooth ear buds paired with this device immediately with no issues at all.The title mentioned one major draw back, and here it is. I was hoping that if I mute the TV I would still be able to hear it through the ear buds, but no such luck. The only way to kill the sound from the TV speakers, but still hear it through the ear buds is to turn the TV speakers off in the settings. Then when you don't want/need to use the ear buds, you have to go back into the TV settings and turn the speakers back on. Kind of a pain, but it is what it is.

I tried, I really tried, for 2-3 days, to connect this device to my wireless earbuds.  After a very nice phone call with a TAO technician, who suggested I do a reset for the earbuds, I contacted the earbud manufacturer.  The Tao technician was right, the earbuds had to be reset.  One would think that technicians who work for the earbud company would know how to instruct a user.  The literature with the earbuds was useless.  The videos they sent me too were useless.  The literature on that manufacturer's website was useless.  I searched youtube myself, and readily found the video that taught me how to fix the issue, and I achieved connectivity.  Now, the reason I gave this unit only 4 stars - for wasting too much of my precious time.  By the way, I've used this system for a few hours and have to say it was a pleasure - my earbuds worked well, I was able to redo pairing without issue, and no noticeable latency.

This product worked great for about 2 years--I set it and forgot about it, connected to the audio-out on my TV and it would reliably connect to my MPOW bluetooth headset. I found the latency to be minimal and the audio quality to be good (for TV at least--I'm not an audiophile).Then it stopped working, out of the blue. Took me a while futzing around, trying to get it to link, before I realized that it simply wouldn't connect. (The headset would connect with other devices.)

I wanted to have this product transmit from a stereo radio to my Jabra Active Elite 65 true wireless earbuds.  The connection was easy/flawless.  The only difficulty I ran into was "repairing" after taking a phone call.  When my earbuds were "listening" to the radio and a call came in from my paired iPhone7, the phone call took precident and I could answer.  When "hanging up" the phone, the stereo would not reconnect/send sound to the earbuds.  However, the indicator on the  TaoTronic device indicated it was still paired.  I would have to "turn off" the TaoTronics device, then  re-do the pairing process to get the stereo back.  TaoTronic's tech service worked with me on the issue (as did Jabra).  Unfortunately we never came up with a solution.  But, I will say TaoTronics was great to work with...very professional, responsive, and more than met my expectations as far as trying to help solve the issue.  I would not hesitate to buy from them, it is just that this product for my specific need did not work.  I think the use for TV to headset, iPhone tx back to a speaker or radio speaker would probably work flawlessly and with excellent sound transmission.

I don't understand how there are any good reviews for this product. As some of the other 1 star reviews state there is audio drop out during low level audio. All of my issues were in TX (transmit mode). I never tried the RC (receiver mode).I ordered this primarily to watch movies on a TV w/ BT headphones. Within the first 10 seconds of the first movie I watched this (audio drop out) occurred. Background dialogue completely cuts out. Any musical score that is going on totally cuts out. I mean It literally makes whatever you are watching unwatchable.

I bought this Bluetooth 5.0 + APTX transmitter/receiver to use as a BT transmitter on a TCL TV that didn't support Bluetooth natively. I successfully paired it in TX mode with two Bluetooth 5.0 +APTX headphones (https://ww2w2.amazon.com/gp/product/B07V4FGLWM). Nice. Yes, I can report that it really does support simultaneous pairing and yes, it really is low-latency. I found the lip-sync to be nearly perfect.While streaming audio, I turned off one of the two paired headphones, waited a minute, and then turned it back on again. It took a few seconds to reconnect but did so without needing to go through a pairing procedure again. So far, so good.
One star for the product and five stars for the service.1-STAR PRODUCT

I bought this because I have two other Taotronics receivers that worked well. I wanted to use this as a transmitter, but it is an epic fail. It is easy enough to pair but the sound sucks. It sounds like an old record with non stop snap, crackle and pops. I tried a different cord between this and my lossless player but to no avail. Perhaps I can use this as a receiver but that is not why I bought it. I say again, don't bother!Revised: Taotronics reached out via email and offered to replace or credit me for this flawed product. As stated above I have two other units that work perfectly. Acknowledging that a certain amount of manufactured units will suffer from defects it then comes down to companies making the effort to right the mistake. I raised my review to 5 stars because Taotronics did make it right without my even asking. This honestly puts Taotronics in the forefront of customer service and should give you confidence that should you happen upon a flawed unit you can be assured they will go above and beyond to make you a satisfied customer. In this world that's as good as it gets. This is better service than Amazon has ever given me and after 10+ years on Prime the very best I've encountered!
I have a large collection of headphones, earbuds, and IEMs, but all of them are wired.I wanted to watch and listen to youtube videos such as podcasts and lectures while doing chores around the house.

The device definitely works, it connects easily to a TV or whatever electronic device you're using. However, if you're looking for a seamless Bluetooth transfer experience, this unfortunately isn't it.I have the device paired to my wireless earbuds and it was connected to my TV via RCA.

This TaoTronics Bluetooth Transmitter and Receiver comes with a 3" long 3.5 mm audio cord, and a 3.5 mm-to-RCA cable adapter. The short 3.5 mm audio cord and overall lightweight design means that I can plug it all into any audio jack and then just let it dangle.  Not having to secure everything is super handy!I use the Transmitter (TX) mode when I work out. You can pair two Bluetooth receivers (headsets) at the same time! This is the reason I bought it. It lets me and my partner listen to the same podcast, exercise app, or music at the same time (it's basically a headphone splitter). Our favorite running app (Zombies, Run!) has a really immersive story line and intermittent zombie chases so we both need to hear the same story as it unfolds in order to react and start sprinting together. I can also use this solo when I have to use an older piece of exercise equipment at the gym (has audio jacks but no Bluetooth). No more wires while exercising!

I have the earlier version transmitter that I use to listen to tv at night. I leave it connected to my cable box powered by usb port.  I can have tv muted or even off and still here the volume because I have it connected to audio out of cable box.If I wake in the middle of night, I grap my earbud,turn it on and Im listening to whatever news network I left it on. The transmitter is always on and ready to go.

I purchased this to allow my older smart tv connect to my bluetooth capable receiver, not only to enable me to hear tv via my Bose speakers, but to allow me to use headphones for tv when needed (occasionally a neighbors tv is a bit loud. Well, REALLY loud). Attempt one failed as I did not at first realize my L/R audio input on the back of the tv was in actuality an output! Oops. This meant I needed to use the optical digital audio output to analog converter, which I fortunately already had on hand. Once I hooked it up to the optical audio jack via the converter, worked like a dream! No delay, good quality sound, quick pairing capability and best of all, my receiver remembers the taotronic so it pairs automatically now. The unit is very small so not unsightly, charges up quickly, and comes with everything you may need (except the aforementioned Prozar digital to analog converter). It's also nice that it can be used as a receiver as well should my needs change.

Let’s just get the cons out of the way because this device is awesome! I’m not too impressed with the volume controls. While I understand there is a limit as to how high my iPhone/iPad will play, I didn’t realize I’d have to turn up my speakers to such a high level to get decent sound. Having said that, once I adjusted everything I could change the volume on my iPhone/iPad with ease. Something else to consider that I haven’t experienced yet is that in the instructions, it says that when switching from transmitter to receiver mode, the device itself will lose the devices previously paired. I’ll have to check this out to verify. I’ll try it with an old CD player and see what happens. Anyway, on to the pros. Once paired, I was able to connect my iPhone to an older stereo and play decent quality music. I then connected to my sound bar and it worked like a dream. I noticed plenty of people asking this, and thus the answer is yes, you can charge this while using it. The light will turn from shining blue to purple. I’ve been delaying getting one of these, and now that I have one, I think I’m going to have to get a couple more.

This little device is pretty handy. It basically makes any sound source a Bluetooth stream, and that's a good thing!I bought it to bring my ZUNE HD (Yes, I have one) into the modern world, and because my PC Rig is a bit out of date and I listen to my massive MP3 Collection.

1. It looks like design for TV which usually have very strong AMP/audio level. I have a desktop AMP I usually use -36dB for my headphone but I need to have it set to +5dB in order to hear anything. Keep in mind that you will need a very strong audio output level (TV usually have).2. As a audio output device, the pairing process is very intuitive and after that, connecting still take quite some time.

This will NOT sync with the latest version of the "Letsfit Bluetooth Headphones".  They both claim bluetooth 5.0, but no go.  However, it WILL sync instantly and perfectly with the PREVIOUS version of this same headphones (which are bluetooth 4.1).  Ah, I love bluetooth!  And by "love" I mean "hate".The device works fine though, once you get headphones that will sync.  Volume control may or may not be an issue.  I'm sure it depends heavily on your TV and/or streaming device.  For me, the volume control on the headphones do nothing.  The TV volume control only works for the built-in TV speakers and does nothing for the headphones.  The only reason I have volume control with this unit at all is because I use a NVIDIA Shield Android TV streaming box for everything and I was able to get the audio settings correct so the Shield controls the volume (and that works perfectly).

BUY THIS ONE .....NOT the "Upgraded Version TaoTronics Portable Bluetooth Transmitter for TV, AptX Low Latency Wireless Audio Adapter for 3.5mm Stereo, Pairs Bluetooth Headphones/Speakers"THIS ONE IS MUCH BETTER AND ACTUALLY WORKS. So, spend the extra $10 to get this one with the 5.0 bluetooth version instead, it's well worth it. Sounds great, no connection issues.  I first mistakenly bought the cheaper one that doesn't have bluetooth 5.0 and immediately regretted it because it didn't work. So, I returned it and bought This unit and it works flawlessly!
I got this after my car radio screen broke and I bought a new phone that I couldn't pair without a code from the radio. I plugged this into my aux and now I'm handsfree again!Pros:

When I opened the box I thought I had ordered the wrong item.  I was replacing one that was 6 times larger and had an antenna, that had stopped connecting to my Bose speaker.  This one connects quickly, but the sound doesn’t start for about 15 seconds. Thought I had a problem until it happened every time.  As a hole it does what I need it to.  My hearing isn’t what it used to be so I hook  it to the headphone output from my surround sound system amp and send the signal to my Bose Bluetooth speaker by my sofa.  I can now watch and hear my TV without waking up the neighborhood / wife..

The device worked very well for about two weeks, sound quality was pure and I especially enjoyed its portability. But at the 2 - 2 1/2 weeks, it stopped working. I contacted Amazon and spoke with Andrea, she worked with me trying different commands and approaches but ultimately she concluded that the device was defective and a replacement would be sent. Amazon's service couldn't have been better.As a follow-up, The TaoTronics people have come out with a new model of TaoTronics Bluetooth Transmitter and so far, it's way better. I'm using it now as I type this, but time will tell.

These TaoTronics bluetooth transmitters are great! The sound quality is excellent, there is no sound difference between using the transmitter and using the AUX cable. I use mine almost every single day. I love that I can get in my car and not have to plug my phone into a cable to listen to music from my phone. What's also handy is that navigation voice also plays over the car stereo when I'm using any of the various navigation apps. The battery life is great. Easily lasts an entire 4.5 hour drive that I do now and then.I use it almost exclusively in receiver mode, but I have used it on the airplane in transmit mode so that I can use bluetooth headphones with the plane's built-in entertainment that only has the AUX cable headphone output.
Small and compact bluetooth transmitterI contacted TaoTronics support looking for a bluetooth transmitter and they recommended the TT-BA07.

****If you use it in Receiver mode (RX), it will automatically turn off (even when plugged in) if there is nothing paired to it.
