To reconnect, you will have to push the button to turn it back on each time.*****I bought this to make a regular speaker into a bluetooth speaker for my office. I read many of the reviews and even the seller told me it would stay on.  This is not true.  Credit to the seller for sending me a replacement, but they don't know their own product and this has caused me to waste a week going back and forth with them when I could have just found another solution. I did not want to have to walk across my office and turn this transmitter on each time I wanted to listen to music.  Completely defeats one of the main purposes of Bluetooth.

TaoTronics Bluetooth 5.0 Transmitter and Receiver, 2-in-1 Wireless 3.5mm Adapter (aptX Low Latency, 2 Devices Simultaneously, For TV/Home Sound System)This is exactly what I needed.  When I connect it to my Sandisk MP3 player and turn it on, it automatically pares with my "COWIN E8 [Upgraded] Active Noise Cancelling Headphones Bluetooth Headphones with Microphone Deep Bass Wireless Headphones Over Ear, Great Audio for Travel/Work/TV/Computer/Cellphone, Black".  Takes me 5 or 6 hours to mow my grass and this setup is great.

We have this connected to a stereo receiver and two sets of bluetooth noise cancellation headphones.  It works very well for 2 people to watch TV at the same time.  Pairing is pretty easy, even with two headphones.  Read the instructions; they are pretty straightforward.  I also hooked this up to a standalone mp3 player to see if I could listen to FM radio through bluetooth headphones and it does work: the cord on the headphone jack is long enough to act as the antenna.  This means you can use this in transmitter mode to listen to FM radio through a bluetooth headset using your cell phone's FM antenna (if it has one), a real plus when you want to exercise with a bluetooth headset and don't want to use data streaming your favorite FM station.  Cell phones will only enable FM radio if something is plugged into the headphone jack, which automatically disables bluetooth headsets.  Have not used it in receiver mode.

This review is for the TaoTronics Bluetooth 5.0 Transmitter and Receiver, 2-in-1 Wireless 3.5mm Adapter.  This item arrived promptly, was easy to set up and pair (in receive mode) with an older Bose sound device which otherwise had no Bluetooth connectivity. Flawlessly receives signal from Echo in adjacent room through one wall and bookcase. One button on/off. I haven't yet tested battery life nor have I set it for broadcast mode. It performs as expected, four stars only because I don't know how long it will last (I'll try to revisit this rating in the future).I have other TaoTronics Bluetooth products which I have used regularly for the past 4 or 5 years without any issue. Solid products from a known company.

I had a problem with sound quality when using this with my exercise bike.  I contacted their support and got right through to someone who was very helpful.  She suggested that I try a different 3.5mm cable than the one that came with the device.  When I did that it worked fine.  I have now used it for one hour long workout with no issues.  I gave it 4 stars instead of five because I think that the cable in the box should have worked.  It may just be a quirk of my bike but the first cable I pulled out of my cable drawer worked fine so I don't see why theirs wouldn't.

Wife bought a TV for the master bedroom to watch while she uses the treadmill. I bought this so she could use her BT ear buds.Connecting this transmitter to the earbuds takes longer than I’d like (takes about 20 to 30 seconds), but it does consistently connect. When the devices connect, there is no conspicuous audible indicator. No voice, no beep. Just a brief moment of static. Just a little “pshhht” is all you hear to let you know the transmitter has connected to your earbuds.

This product works well overall for the price. I've had no problems with connectivity or volume. Transmitting and receiving functions worked equally well for me. I use this for my hdtv and a bluetooth stereo headset. It’s reliable.

The lag is extremely low but exists on Transmission (TR mode).The aptX Low Latency is amazing, timing of the audio from my aptXLL headset and sound coming from a speak arrive at the same time to my ears. But even with a cheap $10 Bluetooth headset from the Target that does have aptXLL, I can watch movies and play video games without feeling uneased or nauseated by audio latency. The audio quality as far as wireless headsets go is perfect, limited to 16bits at 48hz from testing.

I wanted an inexpensive BT transmitter so I could use an iPod Classic (7th gen) with my car audio system, with BT headphones, and with a Harmon Kardan Onyx Studio 3 BT speaker in the house. 2 out of 3 ain't bad.Pro: Relatively small (smaller than the iPod). Included short stereo 3.5mm AUX cable to connect to device. Functions as both transmitter and receiver. Battery recharges with any micro-B USB cable (and we all have several laying around) connected to a USB power brick. Battery life not bad; I got a little over 4 hours of continuous play before needing to recharge. Sound quality is as good as the source material and the speaker(s) will allow (192kbps MP3 files ripped from recent CDs sound very good on the HK speaker).

I bought this so I could use my Skullcandy bluetooth headphones while watching TV at night. I use Roku as my main media device, and with Roku you have to use wired headphones through their remote (even though Roku uses bluetooth for the remote, it won't allow you to pair bluetooth headphones directly). Besides requiring wired headphones, the Roku loses connection after 30 feet, so I loose my audio as soon as I walk away from the TV - completely defeating the purpose!With the TaoTronics, I pair it to the the Skullcandy headphones, and then plug the TaoTronics into the headphone jack on my audio receiver, and VOILA! Problem Solved. The TaoTronics unit works so well that I can walk anywhere in the house, plus I can walk all around my yard outside and still stay connected!

I love my Dell XPS 13, but the one flaw it has is that if I enable Bluetooth to listen to my Bluetooth headphones (another great item from TauTronic), my computer will crash.To avoid the BSOD, you have to be creative.

I primarily bought this to use my Beats by Apple Powerbeats Pro with a portable MiniDisc player.  It's a nice way to use "vintage" technology with wireless sound.  For this purpose it works quite well.  Although it's a bit awkward to pair two devices without a screen, following the directions for this adapter and the Beats made it quick and easy.  Within seconds I was listening to my MiniDiscs wirelessly.  One thing I will note is that it seems to pair with anything that's discoverable in the area.  Every time I turn it on at my desk it pairs and links with my headphones and an old Belkin Bluetooth receiver that I have hooked to my computer speakers.  It defaults audio to the Beats, but the light stays on on the Belkin too.  Other than turning one device or the other off, I'm not sure how you could switch between paired and active devices.  Sound quality and wireless range both seem fine to me.  I haven't tested the latter to its limits, but I can move around my area of the office without any signal loss.I know this may seem like kind of a backwards way of doing things, but I had already spent the money on the headphones and was not about to buy an equally-expensive wired set to use with non-Bluetooth devices.  Plus, I'm notorious for catching the wire on something and yanking them from my ear.  This little guy bridges the gap with ease and I would not hesitate to buy more to use in other situations.

I used this in my TV so I could watch movies on bluetooth headphones without disturbing others in my house while they slept.  I have an earlier version that I tried first and the lag between audio and video was horrible.  I figured I'd give the newer version a try and hope the lag would be gone.  While the lag is better, there is still a lag that makes watching a movie impossible.  The audio is just a little behind the video, but enough to be noticeable.  There is also an annoying hum or buzz when the audio in the movie goes quiet and then it clicks back on when the audio in the movie starts up again.  It's just annoying and both of those features together takes away from watching the TV or movie.  I ended up plugging in the headphones directly, which negates the use of a bluetooth transmitter.  I know the issues are not headphone related because when I plug in the headphones directly to the TV the problems go away.  I wouldn't recommend this if you want to watch TV or movies or anywhere you need audio and video to sync up.  I will be returning mine and look for another transmitter that has zero lag.

I purchased this unit to use as a transmitter for my TV so I can listen with some Bluetooth earbuds while working in my office and not disturb my son when he happens to work from home on occasion. It was very easy to setup. I did not really even need the instructions.I had to use a longer cable with a 3.5mm jack and RCA plugs on the other end to connect to the TV - which I had, as my TV is an older model and does not have a USB connection to provide the needed power. Using the longer cable  allowed me to set the unit on a table below the TV so I could make the power connection using a USB adapter and longer cable which I also had. Depending on your application you might need these as well.

I've been looking for something like this for a long time. I've been using some IR wireless headphones that lose sound, if I'm out of sight of the transmitter. I recently bought some rechargeable ANC Bluetooth headphones to replace my IR headphones.  I was amazed at how small this transmitter is and simple to set up.  It works great and the audio has no lag.  I can go anywhere in the house and still have audio. I have a 3mm headphone adaptor to plug this in to our surround sound system.  This little guy is kept in the case I keep my headphones in. My only issues are: 1) I wish the battery life was longer. On the plus side, you can still use it while charging from a dead battery.  2) I have to turn my headphones on first, then turn on the transmitter for them to connect. Other then that, great product.

This thing works, most of the time. The audio quality is pretty good, and low latency. However, I ran into a number of problems with this device and my Sony WH-1000XM3. I was using this in "TX" mode, with only one device paired (my headphones), and it plugged in to a USB power source 24/7. The headphones would often not connect at all - I would leave the device on 24/7 and just turn my headphones on/off when using the computer. I had to re-pair my headphones a number of times, but the issue kept coming back. I also ran into a "low volume" issue - I'm not sure exactly what was happening, but when I was listening to things that had parts that were of low enough volume, the BT stream would seemingly fade in/out as if it were thinking the audio had stopped.Between the inability to connect to my headphones most days, and the weird audio cut-outs, I hucked this thing and went back to wired. Not worth the frustration.

When I bought this I needed a Bluetooth receiver for my camper so I could quit hotspotting to my iPad just to listen to music. So the only thing I really wanted was just the option to pair my phone to it. I was planning on camping soon so I ended up going with a receiver that had the fastest delivery date, which was this guy, even though it seemed kinda pricy at $30. When I got it I tested it out in my camper. Pairing to my iPhone was painless and went as you would normally expect. Interestingly I seen the switch on it that said TX and RX so I looked in the instructions to see what that switch did and to my surprise I found out that it had the ability to transmit too. I read on further and found out that it could also transmit to two devices as well as receive from two devices too.I haven’t tested out the double pairing yet and I probably won’t until I go camping again in two weeks but when I do I’ll test out the functionality and update this review again if something is off about the device.

If you're like me and you wanted to listen to your computer's audio with your bluetooth headphones than what you need is a Bluetooth dongle, not this.  Plugging this guy into your computer or speakers will NOT make it transmit audio.  This device doesn't work like that (I bought another one exactly like this from Best Buy and the Geek Squad guy told me it isn't meant for PCs).  Shame on this seller for tricking me into buying something this device wasn't designed for.However, this does not mean it isn't worth it for your own needs if its not regarding your PC.  I can't comment on that because I never experienced it working.  But the one star is deserved.  Don't lie in your descriptions.

I bought two devices of this kind, from different manufacturers and was able to compare them thoroughly. At the time of my purchase TaoTronics was a bestseller on Amazon. And EUASOO (another similar device which I bought) had a higher user rating. They cost exactly the same at that time. So, here is a list of reasons why I choose TaoTronics. Maybe someone who chooses between these two devices (as I did at the time, but as a result I bought both) will find this useful.• TaoTronics is able to automatically reconnect to AirPods after AirPods are temporarily manually connected to iPhone to answer incoming calls, etc. Yes, not quickly (25-35 seconds) after the end of the conversation, but at least like that. But EUASOO cannot reconnect to AirPods at all after temporarily manually redirecting AirPods to iPhone for a phone call. You have to turn it off and turn it back on for that. And what if you are relaxing on the couch? You need to get up, go to the adapter, turn it off and turn it back on. Therefore, this is a biggest epic fail compared to TaoTronics. This drawback alone would have been enough for me to no longer consider that EUASOO or another similar product with this huge disadvantage for purchase. I don't know why manufacturers do not mention this crucial point in the description.

TaoTronics Bluetooth 5.0 Transmitter and Receiver - GREAT!Needless to say, I am impressed with this transmitter/receiver. This is the fourth of this model I have purchased from Amazon over the past several years. All of them are still serving me flawlessly. They have been a pleasure for me to use on all of my electronics, including TVs , desk top and lap top computers  and a tablet.  They have served in  my need to improve my hearing impairment to the point of me being able to clearly understand and enjoy the audio portion of all of my electronic devices. I highly rate the product because it has good volume control, sound quality and Bluetooth connectivity.  I particularly enjoy the freedom of moving about the house without being followed by wires.  Whoever invented Bluetooth  is a lifesaver to me.

This is by far the best bluetooth receiver I've had. Previous ones I've purchased have resulted in an unbearable high pitched tone that makes listening to podcasts or music impossible. I've used this TaoTronics one only as a receiver in my car. My car is a little older and does not have an installed bluetooth system but it does have an AUX input. This connects easily to my AUX input and I use the USB cord to keep it connected to a power source. This is all located in my center console/arm rest so its completely out of the way. Once I turn the power on the receiver it seamlessly connects to my phone. Its one of the faster connections to a 3rd party bluetooth device which has been nice. The sound quality is superb and there is no noticeable difference between using the receiver and connecting my phone directly through the AUX input (which is how I previously had it connected). Its nice to be able to charge my phone while listening to podcasts or music. I definitely recommend this model if you're searching for a high quality bluetooth receiver for a very good price.

I bought a new Sony flat-screen TV, (supposedly) Bluetooth-capable, but I could not get any of my pairs of Bluetooth headphones to connect to it so that I could watch TV without disturbing the neighbors (thin walls) or my wife (thin patience for anything above louder than a 6 on the volume).So I did some searching and found this. It's easy to connect, right out of the box, and a single charge is good for several hours of TV watching. Really glad to have found a reasonably priced and reliable solution to being able to watch TV without disturbing anyone!

I bought this Bluetooth 5.0 Transmitter and Receiver to pair with Taotronics TT-BH090 headphones and they connected\paired quickly. However on my NEW TV it does not have a 3.5 audio out plug for the cables they provided, I only have an Optical out. I ended up swapping my transmitters on both my TVs to make things work as my older tv did have a 3.5 audio out plug. I wish this came with a audio out Optical to 3.5 cable. In time i will probably buy one on Amazon because they are only $5-$10 bucks!

I bought this because it was recommended on the official Samsung support forums.  I am trying to use it with my Samsung HDTV to transmit to my bluetooth headphones.  I had so much trouble getting it to pair.  The instructions provided seem to say to turn the headphones into pair mode first, then power on the Taotronics device and put it into pair mode.  I tried it in multiple combinations but could not get it to pair!  After resetting the Taotronics, I finally got it to pair and it was working fine for a few days.  Now it is unable to connect to my headphones and I can't seem to get it to re-pair.  Even with a reset.  What a piece of junk.

I purchased this with the purpose of hooking pairing it up with an "old fashioned record player (those folks of a certain age know what I mean) and mob Amazon Echo.  NO SUCCESS!  But not to be defeated and with their wonderful tech support, I tried to pair it with a Bose Sound link  With their help it worked!!  The unit works wonderfully. We're wanted  it to provide a better sound system to our playing 45s at our local American Legion. (our original attempt was using computer speakers plugged into the speaker jack on the record player) - but the Tao Tronics  unit has given us so much more flexibility for better sound.  I really recommend this unit!  Not only does it work but they really support what they sell!!!  Thank you Tao Troniics!!

I had a problem. Every time I went to my kids house for the weekend I was unable to hear their TV. They simply don't turn up the volume - ever. They won't turn it up for me or allow me to turn it up either for fear of waking up my grandson. After searching for a solution I landed on the TauTronics Bluetooth transmitter and receiver.A PERFECT SOLUTION! I can use it by attaching it to either the headphone jack on the TV or the red/white RCA outputs on the TV. The difference being that connected to the headphone jack cuts out the audio from the TV. The RCA jacks feed an audio sound the the TauTronics device without interfering with the normal sound from the TV. That means I can put on my Bluetooth headset and listen at my preferred volume and, they can watch the show at super low volume.

This helped my marriage. Yes, it did. You see I am, for all accounts, mostly deaf. That's my fault though, I listened to my music at ultra high volume all my life. With headphones. Yeah, I know. SO...anyway. These kept my wife from leaving me. She is an early riser, so early to bed she goes. I, on the other hand, am not. I like to watch tv and listen to music while everyone else in my house is trying to sleep. That's not easy with me there in the living room, listening at FULL volume, to some Aphex Twin. They didn't like me much. I bought these to quell those desires to physically hurt me. It worked. I like sound, and this little gadget allowed me to hear that sound, all by myself, and with great quality. And I am still here, and still married, and well, just here.

It's nice that a product with this functionality is available but the major drawback, at least in my setup, is that the volume is not loud enough.  The Bluetooth earbuds I'm using work in many other scenarios and often these earbuds can be very loud but this device with the referred Bluetooth earbuds  did not give me the volume range that I would have wanted and expected.  Perhaps they are afraid that the trial lawyers are going to bring a lawsuit claiming that the device permanently damaged a clients hearing.  The manufacturer has nothing to fear in this area.Perhaps the device should have been named the "Bluetooth Whisperer".  "Can you hear me now?" might be a good label.

I purchased this product specifically for use on a plane without having to use the cable for the inflight entertainment system with my bose qc35 bluetooth headphones.Pairing was quick and easy after reading the manual.

Works very well. I originally bought this to give my very old iPod bluetooth and play music from it to a wireless speaker, and it worked great for that.  However, it also came in very handy when my more modern iPad stopped connecting to my Prius C's Bluetooth system. For months I tried troubleshooting the issue, and eventually I decided to just give up and use this Bluetooth for the iPad in the car. Somehow (I suspect jealousy), the iPad miraculously began connecting to the Prius C's sytem again. I don't know what witchcraft caused this result, but I'm not questioning it.Great for giving devices with a headphone port Bluetooth. Also good for inducing a jealous rage out of your other Bluetooth devices.

I wasn't sure if this would work as expected, but I did what everyone said: charged it up before and paired it with my Bose QC35 prior to traveling in a place where it wouldn't have any conflicting signals. Well.... it was a treat! Worked from San Francisco to London and back - not direct flights so that meant the signal worked for probably about 14 hours without issue. I did also plug in my volume control dongle on the way back (Air France hasn't turned down their announcement volumes) and it all worked beautifully.The joy of not being attached to the screen when you have to get up and down for fellow passengers can hardly be described! Also not getting your legs/blankets/tray tables caught up in the cable was just brilliant.

I bought this to use on a long flight this summer, which was cancelled due to COVID.  I used the audio cables to hook it up to my tv instead, and sometimes I use it with my noise cancelling bluetooth headphones if my neighbors are being a little loud.  It works and sounds great.  The only downside is that the instructions are terrible and it took many tries (on different days) to get it to work.  I swear I tried the combination of cables and modes I'm using now and they didn't work initially , so I have no clue how to reconnect if I ever unplugged it from my tv!
I have an Echo 1st Gen and Echo Dot 2nd Gen.-

I originally wanted this to add to my TV so I can watch tv, and my wife to sleep.  I have a Samsung TV and a Sony Bluetooth headphone already. My concern was, I wanted to make sure that when I plug this in, it doesn't turn off the TV sound.With this plugged in, you can still use the TV sound, including mute. The sound on the TV doesn't control the adaptor volume, it's controlled by your headphone only. I'm happy that I can put the TV on mute and still listen via my Bluetooth headphones.

I own several of these and they’ve all worked great. I gifted one to my stepdad so he could use his new Bose 700 Bluetooth Headphones with his old Bose Receiver connected to his TV. We tried and tried and tried to get the headphones to pair with the device and never could make it happen. We reset both, cleared out pairing history, and tried everything we could find online. So disappointed.UPDATE 3/9/20: Seller responded to me personally, stating I probably received a defective unit and replaced my unit with a newer model. Received it next-day delivery. Great customer service and I recommend this seller.

New update- April 2020.After my initial review, I was contacted by the seller and they compensated me for all the frustration that I had to go through with their products that I had purchased earlier.  So I definitely give them 5 stars for their customer service!

Used these to connect with both original AirPods and the new Airpods Pro and they both connected fine but the volume level was too low for practical usage.  Whether I was using a phone or laptop as the source of music to transmit ,I would have to turn the volume up to 1/2 before I could hear any music and even at full volume the sound was very light and would be far too quiet to hear on an airplane which is what I was hoping to use it for.  It did pair automatically with the AirPods after the initial pairing which is helpful.  I will be returning them, I now see that other reviewers have had the same low volume issue when transmitting to AirPods.Update: customer service support was excellent, they promptly provided a refund and went above and beyond providing an Amazon gift card for my trouble.  Updating the review from 2 stars to 4 stars to reflect strong customer service support.

We bought this for two reasons. First, to send music from a stereo system downstairs to a Bluetooth speaker upstairs - in this case the TaoTronics device is a transmitter. It works great! In the photo, you can see it connected to the stereo. The TaoTronics  device and the speaker are a full floor apart, but the sounds comes through great, and the pairing was simple and quick.And second, to send music from a phone to the device to play music through car speakers - in this case the TaoTronics device is a receiver. We have not tried that yet but when we do, I can update this review.

Great product, however, I was quite aggregated when my device stopped working (see old post below). Turned out it was a series of button holding that resets the device. I give this four stars for an unbelievable oversight on Taotronics, for making these instructions near impossible to find (unless they email you):1) Turn off the unit

Do not buy this to connect BT headphones to your TV. While yes the headphones will connect and play the tv audio, there is no way to control the volume. When you try to adjust the volume it just changes the volume on the tv speakers. I even tried changing the audio output settings. There is no way to adjust the volume playing through your bt headphones unless they have their own audio control on them. Pretty useless if I can't adjust the volume. Also when trying to connect my headphones they kept auto connecting to my phone so I had to turn bt off on my phone so then I could not have my phone connected to my fitbit etc...  This thing may be good for other uses but it advertised it was good for this and it isn't.

OK, don't laugh - rather than spend a boatload of money on an 120 gb iPod, I've been using my 120 gb Zune ever since I bought it way back when. It works great but it doesn't have Bluetooth. Enter this tiny little Bluetooth transmitter. I have it attached to the back of my Zune, and it has a very short 3.5mm cord that attaches it to the audio out of the Zune. Pairing to my ear buds takes about 15-30 seconds. Signal strength is strong - it rarely cuts out. Range is about 25 feet unobstructed but I can go to an adjacent room without loosing the signal. Operation is fairly straightforward. It will run about 8 hours on a single charge. Overall, I am very happy with my purchase. I'll keep using my Zune until it DIES!

As many purchasers have described, this Bluetooth transmitter/receiver has great sound and (most important) it always remembers your connection. I was pleased from the start, until......My application is in a vehicle, which the manufacturer claims is a perfect fit. The product worked great until I plugged it in to a 12V USB charger, and started the car. Then boom! The electronic interference was both loud and scary. I was worried it would blow my speakers, and, of course, it was impossible to hear any music over the noise.

I was happily using this with my Vizio TV and airpods for the past 6 weeks - I started having a low level static (like a humming sound) about a week ago that would usually resolve if I re-paired it again with my airpods, it was annoying but workable. But tonight it stopped pairing with my airpods. I followed all the trouble shooting and even tried other airpods (my hubby has the latest ones) and headphones - nothing would pair. I've contacted TaoTronics customer serves and asked what to do.

This is my second TaoTronics Bluetooth transmitter I've purchased. My work computer monitor has speakers bult into the monitor itself and my regular corded headphones make my daily life at work difficult when I go to move about my desk and forget I'm connected to a cord. I bought this thinking it would help make my working life a little bit easier. The first transmitter I purchased was the Upgraded Version TaoTronics Portable Bluetooth Transmitter for TV, AptX Low Latency Wireless Audio Adapter for 3.5mm Stereo, Pairs Bluetooth Headphones/Speakers which I bought for $19.99. I returned it due to the NOTICEABLE feedback I was hearing in my headphones. This "static like" sound in the background over everything that's playing is also noticeable with this product. As someone who struggles with sounds, this is infuriating. I'm not sure if it has anything to do with the fact I have Bluetooth ear budes and not over the ear headphones or large stereo headphones but the static feedback is something I personally just can't handle.I am also experiencing the low volume issue where it just STOPS transmitting and I have to go back to my web browser and click back on Spotify to make sure what I'm listening to is playing. Yes Spotify, I am still listening to you! I see from other lesser star reviews and answered questions that this issue is just "part of the product".

I bought this to connect my earphones so that I could listen to music/audio from my phone while charging the phone at the same time (my phone does not have the 3.5 mm jack, only lightning). It work beautifully!! Very easy to set up and use, and it’s a much smaller device than I was expecting — which was a good surprise.I gave it 4 stars because it beeps when the battery is low and needs recharging, and since I use it to sleep, it’s a bit annoying because it wakes me up. I wish there was a way to turn the beep off, or maybe have a light indicator instead? (The beep is common to pretty much ALL blue tooth earphones I’ve tested though.) However, the battery life is better than average; it goes one full night without beeping, and only beeps on the second night; all blue tooth earphones I’ve tested beeped sometime during the first night. I still need to try to see if I can use it while it’s plugged and charging though; if that works, maybe the annoying beep problem is solved too.

This Bluetooth transmitter is amazing. I stay up late and watch TV. Now I can use my Studio Beats to watch shows without waking up my wife. It sucks to have to go through the Bluetooth pairing every time you want to use it.The only negative is that I cannot turn the volume up or down. My Studio Beats have volume control on the side and work perfectly when paired with my iPhone or iPad. But when paired with this transmitter the volume buttons on my headphones do not work. The transmitter is plugged directly into our AT&T U-Verse cable box so I am not sure what volume there is to actually turn down. When I use the TV or cable remote, they both turn the volume up or down on the TV speakers.

My 2015 65" 4k tv has bluetooth for pairing with wireless headphones, but was not able to pair with 2 different brand headphones.  TV support line informed me the tv was too old for a software update to make it be able to pair with non LG wireless headphones or ear buds.  I received this unit, plugged it into the headphone jack on the back of the tv, and plugged the USB plug into a TV input for power, and was able to pair within one minute.  Now I am able to watch tv in man cave with headphones so the loud scenes do not disturb my wife upstairs.  There is no delay in the sound either, so the lips moving matches the dialogue perfectly.

This is a handy thing to have. I plug it into my keyboard so I can practice piano using wireless headphones. It gave a new life to our old stereo turntable/CD player, which now pairs with our nice tv Bluetooth sound bar. We can throw the crummy old wired speakers away! I think the transmitted sound is fine, but I'm not a knowledgeable audiophile, so only gave it 4 stars. I've only owned it a few days too, so can't judge its durability. But so far, I'm really glad I bought this.UPDATE: This thing is great.  I plugged it into my old mp3 player & listened to music through my headphones while weeding the garden.  I can watch videos on my tablet without disturbing anybody else.  And it's terrific for keyboard practice.  5 stars for TaoTronics!

This is a followup to my first review below this one: This is my second unit. it worked great just like the first one for a few months but stopped abruptly and will not pair again. I could give the first one a positive review since the first one could have just been a defective unit but having the second one fail tells me these are junk.Looks like I'm back to square one in finding something that will work.

I'm not really a tech person. My goal was to watch tv, but have the sound come through my bluetooth headphones, and this item works perfectly to let me do that. I haven't used this device for anything else, so I can't comment on any other uses, but for me, this item is just what I needed.Note: because of the input ports on this thing, for some tv's you'll also need to get a digital-to-analog audio converter.  That converter will plug into the tv and then into the Bluetooth transmitter.

UPDATE: Manufacture contacted me about my issue offered to resolve issue by recommending a different product.  Recommend manufacture, but not this specific product.  If you are going to use this to listen to music, it will work perfectly,  if you want the sound and video to sync, use the "TaoTronics Bluetooth 5.0 Transmitter Receiver with Codec Display, aptX Low Latency Wireless Audio Adapter for TV Home Audio System (3.5mm AUX, RCA, SPDIF in/Out) Dual Link, 24hrs Play Time".Works as described but delay between sound and video if your using to watch a video/movie.  Bought to use on airplanes so I would not have the wire between my headphones and the seat back screen. Delay between video and sound is far to much to make it usable.  Tried on my notebook and had same issue.

The Taotronics TT-BA07 works very well when connected to the 3.5 mm audio-out jack on my  NordicTrack S22i indoor spin bike.  It paired quickly to my Diginex DNX9 Bluetooth earbuds. The sound is clear and I cannot detect any distortion.  The Diginex are generic, inexpensive earbuds, so I’d expect that the Taotronics Bluetooth device would function well with most other earbuds. For my Apple Air Pods Pro, however, the output power from the S22i is not sufficient to drive the AirPods Pro.I called Taotronics tech support (the phone number is listed on a card in the box) and was connected quickly; shockingly so, I must say. The technician was courteous and efficient, and she told me (as I had suspected) that the TT-BA07 is just a pass through Bluetooth device without any amplification.  I asked if any other Taotronics Bluetooth devices have amplification capabilities. She said that she would check with the engineering team and send me an email the following day. The very next morning, I received an email stating that none of their products have amplification capabilities.  By the way, the product description on Amazon never said, or even hinted, that the TT-BA07 can amplify audio signals

To use tx mode, don’t plug your sound source (tv, iPod, CD player etc.) before this thing is paired with a Bluetooth speaker or earphones.  I made the mistake out of box and was frustrated because it didn’t work.My Bluetooth headphones gave me another frustration because I could not pair it no matter what.  After 30 minutes of trying, I finally figured out that I had to hold my headphone on/off button to active Bluetooth pairing before this little device can connect with headphones.  Make sure your phone or tablet doesn’t auto connect headphones.  If headphones are tethered, they won’t pair with this device.

It was quite amazing what this little device can do. I have connected it to my car's AUX input since I don't have bluetooth and it just works. It automatically turns off after a while when there is no activity, plus, when you get into your car, just turn it back on and your phone automatically syncs into it. I also love that you can switch it to sending and receiving audio. I've used it to connect multiple bluetooth headsets to output the same sound and it just works. The only thing that is unfortunate is that you can't use it to receive calls in your phone so when you have your phone connected to bluetooth, music will play in your car stereo, but when someone calls you, it will not pick up the voice from the call to your car. I think that's because it does not have a mic, but otherwise, it is a life changing device.Pros:

This TaoTronics Bluetooth transmitter and reciever works great. I have used both functions. I have had it connected to my pre-internet receiver and been able to connect my phone and or kindle or tablet to it. Also You can actually connect the transmitter to 2 Bluetooth devices simultaneously. Also great in the car for streaming from devices that don't have bluetooth! Battery last a long time.  It has never died on me after hours of use. I also use it at work, where I can connect my music device to the soundboard at the back of theater during show rehearsals for playback while I am at the stage. Highly recommend this device to everyone!

I was using an old TV modulator & wireless speakers (not Bluetooth).  The sound quality was horrible and it required 4 batteries (2 in the headset, 2 in the converter).  This is light years better.What I liked:

But, I had to figure out the sequencing. Frustrated me the first few times. Put it down for weeks, forgot about it for awhile, and then re-tried per the video. Still didn't work. Got the delay thing. Got the one speaker drops the other out too. FINALLY got it. Seems to be a matter of what you do when turning the first speaker back on. Pair the first, turn it off. Pair the second. Leave it on and playing audio with steady blue light on Tao unit.  Go back to first, turn it on, speaker attempts to pair with flashing blue. Give it ten seconds. Hit steady blue Tao ONLY once. THERE IT IS. Same sound from both EasyACC speakers (two LX-839s). No delay. Amazing volume and sound. Tried this ten times in a row. Worked every time. Will try with different speakers. I'll repost if there's a change. But it's really amazing sound for speakers the size of a baseball.

When I saw a post recommending this device, I was doubtful at first. I decided to take the risk and bought it, and I couldn't be happier now. The Bluetooth connectivity has virtually no latency; I played the Space Pirate Trainer without any latency, which killed the immersion when I was using a different, cheaper Bluetooth transmitter. For Beat Saber, there's a setting that adjusts the sound latency in-game in the "setting", and with 300 ms (max) it was  no different from having a wired headphone.Above is my modded Oculus Quest. As you can see, the transmitter is so small that you wouldn't notice any weight changes. It can also be used without the power bank, if you haven't bought one already. Some people would swear by the wired headphones being better, but I disagree. First, if you are a serious VR gamer, you should use something that can be used with the PC (i.e. "wired"), like the Rift. Second, the wires easily get in the way when you just take off to wipe the sweat off your face, or just moving around even with the short wires; that really becomes irritating and distracting to say the least.  Finally, if you already have a good wireless headphone/ neckband/ earbuds, why waste your money to buy the wired headphone for just this purpose?

Original review:I'm thinking Tao electronics are a non-trustworthy brand. Headphones purchased from them broke at the 4 week point. Now the receiver is also broken -- the cord/port connection is no longer tight and transmission is spotty.  Bluetooth connectivity was very spotty, requires frequent resets.

I travel a lot and wanted a way to use my bluetooth headphones on planes.  The TaoTronics Bluetooth transmitter fits the bill perfectly.  The unit is small which makes it easy to plug into the seat audio output on the plane.  I also use it with my mini MP3 player.  I am only worried i will leave it on a plane someday because it is small and stays out of the way.The sound is good.  My only issue is sometimes when starting up it does not connect to my headphones so I need to go through the pairing process.  It is not a big problems because the process is fast and once it is connected, it is solid.

I was really impressed with the build quality of this and overall its a nice looking and small package.However, it will not work the speakers/application that I intended it for.  I've followed the instructions and tried in various ways and it just won't connect.  Part of it may be that the Bluetooth speakers they are connecting to do no have an explicit "pairing" mode that they can be put into, they simply broadcast and accept any incoming Bluetooth connections.  The instructions for this transmitter state that the receiving device must be put into pairing mode, so I am guessing that they are detecting for a standard signal that is only present when a device is in pairing mode, and so my speakers are no good.

I have only used this on airlines, as a way to use my own Bluetooth earphones with the IFE. It works exactly as advertised. Battery life has not been an issue in that I have not had to charge the adapter in flight. For $30, this is a steal. Now, for balance, I will say that working out precisely how long a press needed to be to turn it on and off versus initiating pairing was an art, and the instruction manual was not super-helpful. Also, the adapter for the left-and-right specific channels that some airlines have has some crackling, suggesting it is quite cheap. But this is a $30 device that is super-small and also two-way, so you can connect it to the hotel alarm clock or speaker when you arrive, and *it works*. I wondered whether this was not more of a four-star product, and truth be told it is… until, again, you remember that this is $30 and frees you from the cable in exactly the kinds of spaces where space is at a premium. You won't love it - a 2.0 product is needed - but you'll thank yourself that you bought the 1.0 regardless.

My experience with intermittent Bluetooth connections and poor lip sync with my video caused me to give up on this item and return it to Amazon.  I was really anticipating a good wireless solution between my video projector and my sound system but this item was, unfortunately, not it.Among the policies to like about Amazon is the ability to return items right away that do not performance as expected and receive a full refund.  When UPS scanned this returned item my account was immediately credited.  Therefore there was no loss and no fowl.  Although I rarely need to return items, it's comforting to know that if an item does not perform as expected I need not take a loss on it.

Every once in a while I come across a product that truly surprises me.  This little inexpensive bluetooth receiver / transmitter is one of those items.  It worked perfectly right out the box.  I use it in my car and have it in Rx (receive) mode.  It works perfectly.  My car is a 2005 Acura TL so it doesn't have bluetooth audio built in (it can do first generation bluetooth with phone calls that only works with phone calls).  I installed an aftermarket 3.5mm jack and was plugging in my phone.  I decided to see if I could find a bluetooth receiver to install so I won't have to manually plug into the car (yeah, first world problem to be sure!).  I installed a USB to power port that only gets power when the car is on and leave the TaoTronic plugged in.  Then plugged in the 3.5mm from my car to the device and select Rx and it worked flawlessly.  I do turn off the device when I park the car at night and turn it on for my morning commute but my iPhone 7 connects immediately every time.  I thought I had an issue once, but I realized that the volume on my phone (which thinks they are headphones) was turned down.  For the price, I have be extremely pleased and have to give it a 5 stars.  I didn't expect it to work this well.  The sound quality is great and so far it is performed perfectly.  It appears to be a quality unit.  I can not speak to longevity yet as I have had it installed for a couple of weeks.

I purchased this product in order to provide my husband with a way to turn up the volume when he is watching TV without blasting me out of the room in the process. It has worked so well in so many ways.  He finds the TaoTronics headphones that we also purchased very comfortable and he is able to hear dialogue much more clearly than when it was coming from just the TV speakers.  I was a little concerned about whether such a modestly priced product would do the job.  No worries. It has performed like a champ.It also has demonstrated great range.  I occasionally use the headset myself and find that I can wander throughout the first floor of our house and never lose connection with the transmitter.

I was having trouble dealing with long wires running from my sound bar to the projector hanging on the ceiling. It was ugly and clunky. A friend suggested a Bluetooth audio adapter. This was the first one I found. It works. The sound is great. My only complaint is that it sometimes takes multiple tries (2-3) to pair with my Vizio soundbar system. I'm not sure if it is the fault of the sound bar or the adapter, but my soundbar pairs on the first try with everything else we connect to it.The sound is great. I get surround sound from my budget projector. It's exactly what i wanted. I just don't have anything to compare it to. It's sort of annoying to have to stand up on the couch to turn it on and pair it each time, but that is the only negative and I don't know how you would get around that.

Update: Opportunity came up to use this again.  Turns out the 3.5mm audio cable that came with the unit was bad, and that's why the sound quality was horrible.  Swapped out cables and the quality is fine when using as a receiver.  Haven't used as a transmitter yet.---

Was elated with respect to the ease of setup and size of the item.  Unfortunately in TX mode, there is about a 1/4 of a second lag (250ms). While this is ok when listening to music or listening to radio, watching TV is extremely annoying when you can see people talk ahead of the sound.This is advertised as low latency (which is ~40 ms) . It clearly is not.  Pity, would've been 5 stars otherwise.

DOES NOT WORK ON BOSE SOUNDLINK MINI 2. Look for TROND version of this exact same product. That one works with this speaker. :)UPDATE 5/12/20: The company kindly reached out to me and gave me detailed directions on how to connect the Bluetooth Transmitter to the Bose Speaker. However, despite numerous attempts, it still did not work. That being said, it was pretty great to have the company reach out to me and give me detailed instructions on how to troubleshoot the problem. I've increased the stars from 3 to 4.

What a great product.  I am so pleased with this transmitter/receiver it's one of the best purchases I've made in several years.  I travel to China every 6 weeks and use my Sony BLE ANC headphones to watch movies in flight and listen to music on my iPhone.  The most annoying feature of my headphones is the cord to the seat back screen.  Every time I shift in my seat or the person next to me gets up I have to deal with the cord pulling, tugging, popping out of one end or both ends.  This unit solves this problem and works flawlessly.  Connects immediately, easy to use, small, light and hold a charge for the entire flight from SFO to Hong Kong.I will not travel without this transmitter, period.  Great job Tao Tronics

I have an iPad 6th Generation. Purchased this specifically to use on the airplane for a trip so my daughter and I could watch movies on my iPad that I had downloaded. We both have AirPods. After doing a "practice test" at home before my trip, I can say this successfully worked extremely well. We were both able to use our Bluetooth AirPods to watch all our movies. One thing to note, we had to turn off our Bluetooth capabilities on the iPad for this device to work and then pair the device with each of our AirPods. Highly recommend this splitter.  It's small and lightweight, held it's charge for our 5 hour flight.

I purchased the TaoTronics Bluetooth Transmitter because of a problem with out of sync sound with video through my phone to headset using the Roku app. Upon receiving the transmitter I immediately plugged the 3 mm jack into my TV and turned the transmitter on. I then set my headset to pair while standing near the transmitter and within seconds it paired. There is no lag and I can walk outside and still not lose a connection. I am totally happy with this purchase and recommend it to anyone who needs to use their headset jack on their TV to connect Bluetooth headset. This model all allows two simultaneous connections which is a big plus. It has a rechargeable battery so in order to charge it I connect it to the USB port on my TV. It allows you to use Bluetooth while charging which is extremely convenient. It also lasts at least 6 hours on battery alone. A heads up you must remove the 3 mm jack from the headset port on your TV to get sound if you set your TV to turn off the speakers when a headset is attached. I highly recommend this Bluetooth transmitter.

I was searching for a gadget that would prolong the life span of my Power House Hardon Kardon audio receiver by having Bluetooth capabilities for audio streaming and the Toatronic Bluetooth adapter does the job exceptionally well. Also, it is extremely small and remains out of sight if you need it to. The clarity is great and I have not experienced any sound quality issues at all. The distance is great as well, I went upstairs with my phone and it kept playing audio on my receiver. I love it when a product does what it is meant to do and keeps its promise.

This works well so far. It’s small and out of the way.  It comes with an RCA cable and 3.5mm jack, is easy to pair and the sound is good and there is no delay (tha5 I can tell). However, one thing I noticed is that when you plug the included usb cable into the same device your transmitting from, there is a noticeable high pitch. It’s very distracting. It’s not present when you plug the usb cable to a normal power supply, though.

Have had this for over a week now. I have been mainly using this in transmitter mode where I plugged this into the audio output of my non-bluetooth projector and connect to my bluetooth speaker system. First of all the device is very compact which I like as I don't have like a big thing hanging from my projector. Followed the instructions provided and pairing the device with the bluetooth speaker was easy. Based on some reviews that I had read, I always keep the device in charge mode while using it and I haven't seen any lag with the audio. Very happy with this purchase.Update:

Ordered this in Sept. 2018 the input audio jack has a short and sounds fades completely out on or channel (stereo) and I have to go wiggle male Jack to get working again. It may work for awhile or in 30 minutes I have to do it again. Also the range is pitiful. At 25 feet it starts cutting out bad and there's nothing in between but a glass door, I can see the transmitter. No excuses to make such a piece of junk. (UPDATE) OCTOBER 20, 2019. TaoTronics cared enough about their products and customer satisfaction that they sent me an upgraded Bluetooth unit at no cost to me. Let me tell you, the new model is FANTASTIC so far!! It's model #TT-BA014. First to everyone.....this company CARES and i WILL buy from them for any of their products that i want. Most companies just say, send in for repair or replace the exact product if in warranty, but TaoTronics went far beyond and reached out to me and asked me if they could send me an upgraded replacement unit. I was so excited and of course said, " Sure!"  Please, give TaoTronics a try. You can buy with confidence that they will see your 100% satisfied! I sure am. Thanks, TaoTronics.

I use this as a bluetooth transmitter from a classic ZUNE to a pair of headphones while at the gym to avoid bothersome wires while working out, as ZUNEs are not bluetooth enabled. The device plugs into the ZUNE headphone jack with the included 4 inch mini plug cord and has a much better output than other transmitters I have tried, both in volume and frequency range. It tucks easily into the soft arm case I have for the ZUNE and stays charged for about 12 hours of use.  The extended warranty is nice but hopefully I won't need to use it.Note: I was asked to write a review by TaoTronics which I had intended to do, and the above is an honest review.  However, they requested I review and in exchange would send me a pair of Bluetooth, noise reduction headphones for free.  The headphones are complete crap, do not hold a charge for any amount of time and are useless.  The 5.0 transmitter is still working fine however.

UPDATE 2: they keep offering me a refund to delete my review or change it to 5 stars. NEWSFLASH: reviews are meant to reflect the user's experience dealing with the company. I found that their product did not perform as advertised. Offering me a refund is fair, but I feel that with a refund, a 4-star rating for my trouble and wasted time is reasonable, especially since the potentially misleading product information persists. I'm downgrading them again to a 1-star review again because they continue to offer good customer service not in good faith but as a bribe for a perfect review.UPDATE: my complaint is real---the number of Bluetooth devices it can transmit to is far more limited than e.g. what a Bluetooth headset can transmit to---but the company has been admirably persistent in reaching out to me to offer a full refund. So my review goes from 1 star (not a fully functional "transmitter") to 4 stars (still doesn't do everything "transmitter" implies, but the company stood behind the sale).

I use this mostly for watching television and playing video games with Bluetooth headphones. It does the job with some caveats and it's easy to use. It has connectivity throughout my small apartment for the most part.There is always a slight hum and popping sound on the line which may be less noticeable if you turn up the volume on the connected device. I know it isn't from the TV because it happens when connected to other devices as well such as my radio or my PS4 controller. There is also a delay of nearly one second which is somewhat bad for watching television and even worse for playing video games. This device is best suited to audio-only applications such as listening to the radio or to podcasts or when you want to have the news on while you do other things.

This is my second unit - the first one was used as a receiver for an older car without BT. This one I used as a transmitter for a wireless connection to the TV sound on an airplane to pair with my wireless earbuds. In all cases, the units perform flawlessly and are easy to connect. I had a problem at first connecting this unit, so I emailed customer support. I received a reply within hours with detailed instructions. It turns out, the problem was with the earbuds I was pairing with the unit. After a factory reset of the earbuds, everything worked perfectly. Customer tech support is excellent. I would highly recommend this company and this BT receiver/transmitter.

I plugged this device into the sound card on my PC, switched it to transmit and without any prompting, it immediately found the Taotronics Receiver on my Powerwerks PW50 amp and started playing. The sound is a HUGE improvement over a stereo patch cord I tried. The cord was supposed to be shielded, but there was tons of noise on the speaker when I plugged it in. It was also cumbersome and annoying, so win-win!Next I'd like to find my Y-connector so I can use my PC speakers and Bluetooth simultaneously. I might update this review at that time. For now, I love it. I can use various PC programs to play music (and other things) over my amp. Neat.

I purchased the first one through Amazon.  It worked for a few hours then died.  I thought the battery had discharged.  I was unable to get the red charge light to come on and it never worked again.  I returned to Amazon and received a replacement.  It did exactly the same thing.  I called the tech department at TaoTronics.  The agent was most helpful and accommodating.  He offered to send another, send a different type, or refund my money.  I elected to get another in kind.  It arrived in a few days and just to make sure it wasn't already fully charged; I turned it on and ran the battery down.  Then charged it to full charge.  It worked perfectly.  Easy set up and pairing.  I have now used it with headphone speakers by splitting the sound from my TV.  I definitely recommend  this item.  The reason for 4 stars is only because of replacement issue.  I love the simplicity of the product.

I have bad hearing.  I can't afford and don't really want hearing aids.  I'm ok with what I miss.  The problem is the TV.  I have to have the volume so loud, no one can stand to be in the same room.  I looked at several options.  I chose this bluetooth transmitter, over the cheaper model, because of the reviews.It was easy to hook up.  Now, I can wear headphones or ear buds and listen to the tv at whatever volume I want.  My wife can set the tv volume at whatever she likes.  Yesterday she had it at 0, and I could sit and listen to it comfortably. (she had it at zero because she doesn't like to watch fishing shows.  Her loss)

The jury is still out on this one. I have two older-model sound bars I refuse to dispose of because they produce great sound quality. Only problem is...they are not bluetooth, so I decided to get an adapter thinking it would solve all of my problems. Well, it did...sort of. It took a bit for some devices (Google, Alexa) to discover the device but once it did, it connected without issue. However, playing music from Google via YouTube left a lot to be desired. Very choppy no matter which way I set the switch, so I moved the device to one of my Echos to use with Alexa. Worked a bit better but still not as precise as if the unit came with bluetooth already.

I use this to send audio from my  computer to sennheiser wireless headphones. This produces a great quality sound and after a year an a half the battery still lasts about 20 hours. I usually just leave it plugged into a charge so I probably killed the life of the battery more than regular use would. I still had a signal outside of my house and down the street about 250ft away. Seems to transmit though glass but has very poor signal in my garage. Actually any signal at all in my garage is surprising cause it has to transmit through a brick wall or steel door. Anyway, this is a very small transmitter but surprisingly high quality for the price.

The sound quality on this is very good and overall it connects decently enough (some connection mishaps with my Bose headphones, but not enough to warrant any major complaints).My main gripe with this product is the battery. While I'm sure it lasts a long time on paper, in practice it becomes annoying to manage. I keep it plugged into my work computer, and if I don't turn it off when I'm done using it then it sits there overnight flashing and is drained by the next day. Meaning I have to replug it in to recharge it. I could just keep it plugged in, but once it reaches a full charge there's some static feedback in the sound, so I have to unplug it at that point and the cycle repeats itself. This could be solved if this bluetooth adapter had an automatic power-off timer of about 10 minutes or so, but it doesn't look like such a timeout exists. So I have to do this plug/unplug dance every once in awhile and it gets a little annoying.

These blue tooth devices are great.  I use mine for both transmitting from and to older devices that don't have built in blue tooth. I had one before that I lost, but it was connected to my desktop to transmit to my bose headphones, connected to my laptop to transmit to my headphones, connected to my older stereo to receive from my cell phone.. all worked great, so much so I bought another when I lost my old one.

I use this mostly to listen to audio books in the car. It works great for that. But when I used it for just navigation, it would cutoff the first two or three words from the navigation audio every time. This made the narration more confusing. Hopefully they can fix with a firmware update. I don't have this problem with my phone and other bluetooth audio receivers.I love the small size - about two iPod shuffles stacked together, and that all of the needed cords come with it.

Material feels sturdy, light, and high-quality. Texture is gently grippy, quite a pleasant feel, in my opinion. Came without any bumps or scratches on either the transmitter itself-or any of the cords it came included with. Mode toggle switch is firm and clicky. Can't easily be switched using just a swipe of my finger, have to use a little bit of nail (but is easy with just a little leverage) which I consider a good thing because it means it will not accidently switch when I run. It's a little larger than my iPod shuffle, which is what I intend to use it with. Is not any thicker, just about half an inch taller. And maybe 2cm wider. Is actually lighter than the shuffle, even with the auxiliary cord included. Controls seem confusing, at first, but just after reading through them twice I consider myself pretty fluent with them. Pictured with the shuffle, a quarter, and a dollar bill for scale.P.s. came charged, which I appreciate because the user guide recommends charging it for two hours before first use. I ain't about that life. #instantGratificationFTW

I use this to get a fully wireless VR experience. I run a simple 3.5mm cable split from my output to studio headphones for normal monitor and the other end to this device in TX mode and connect a pair of Galaxy buds to it. The galaxy buds do not support aptx-ll like this device does but it falls back to other protocols without issue and even without LL codec support on my receiving device, there's only a minor delay in most VR games.Pairing is easy, sound quality is good, and this is a cheap and effective solution to my wireless audio needs without having to blow $200-300 on some janky BT headphones solution that works natively with my mixer, a goxlr.

I was shocked!  Not physically, but mentally. I relied heavily on the product description and this product in no way shape or form did what it said it would do. I purchase a lot of things here and ninety-nine times out of a hundred I hit the mark. This was one of those RARE occasions that i missed the mark. It would not pair to anything properly. Did not split the signal. The instructions were unclear. This was an expensive mistake. If you're looking for something that will allow two people, with separate wireless Bluetooth earphones, to share sound coming from one source (smartphone), I would advise you go to the app store and get an app. This product did not work.

I bought this so that I can watch TV, or a movie, while my husband sleeps, without waking him. It's very effective for this purpose.I also like how it can turn my car radio into a speaker phone; because my radio is not itself Bluetooth enabled. It's a neat little device. The ability to transmit to 2 Bluetooth devices is super cool. We can watch a movie with the sound as loud as we individually want it (with 2 different blue tooth headphones with their own volume controls. And as loud as it might be for us, the neighbors don't hear a thing, except our laughter.  I recommend this product. It is a good value; and performs as described.

Tried several different headphones and configurations,  result:  Good for music listening, kind of OK for Videos (video/audio sync is a little, worse depending on quality of headphones), not at all usable for live applications, delay is TOO great,Really awesome for music listening, pre-recorded sound.

i got this thing for my projector since mine didn't have built-in Bluetooth.  i first test it with music. everything was fine.  next i test it on a movie. the audio/video was sync fine for about 30 minutes then it unsync, the audio was delay by almost a full 2 second. it ruins the movie experience i try to get.  you can fix this but turning off both the adapter and speaker and returning it on.the second problem is the battery. it says it can last up to 10 hours. it didn't. it lasts 5-6 hours tops, not even with full volume. maybe at 20-25% volume.

I have an older HD TV that didn't have Bluetooth capability. I could listen to programming via the Firestick with my wireless headphones, but not movies through the DVD player. I purchased this and plugged it into the "Audio Out" port for wired headphones and it works fantastic. I can listen to everything I watch now through the wireless headphones. I'm not real tech savvy so wasn't sure what to expect. Setting up the connection to my headphones was very easy. After some reading I thought I might experience delayed transmission/lag to the headphones, but I haven't noticed any of the sound/speech being out of sync with what I'm watching. I would buy this product again.

I've had this adapter for a couple years now and it's come in handy both in TX mode and RX mode.  I've used it to make my TV Bluetooth capable and my older ipod Bluetooth capable as well.  For RX mode it made my nice but older boombox able to receive Bluetooth from my laptop.The quality and packaging is small so very easy to add anywhere.

Update: Taotronics customer support has been fantasic. Although no fault of their own, they were disappointed that I was not able to get the product to work in my intended use. In response to my review, they reached out and offered a number of options to help me out. Bumped from 3 to 4 stars for fantastic customer service!Original Review: I bought this transmitter to use with a Ford Sync system to transmit the signal from my aftermarket satillite radio. Unfortunately it seems like the device is unable to pair with the Ford system for whatever reason. Ice also experienced difficulty pairing other devices as well. I find that you need to have the transmitter within an inch or two of the Bluetooth receiver. When it works, it works well, but unfortunately it didn't work for my purposes.

I am using this to connect my iPhone SE 2020 to a Tivoli Audio Model Three Table Radio that only has a miniplug audio input.  Works great.  What's more I also have my SE connected to my Widex hearing aids via bluetooth.  The nice thing is the hand off between the two.  So I can be listening with the phone thru the TaoTronics and when I put in my hearing aids and switch them on the audio immediately routes to the aids and drops from the radio.  Neat and convenient.  The one minor annoyance is recharging.  I suspect I use it about 1 to 1-1/2 hrs/day and need to recharge it weekly, so it looks like you get about 10 hrs use.  More would be nice but this is good.  By the way, hookup was straightforward and easy.  Everything paired just like it was supposed to.

Have two LG Tone 730 wireless headsets that I tried to pair simultaneously.  There is not a problem with each one pairing individually but when you try and play music at the same time to both you get static in one and music in the other.  In single mode, each one will play great, just not simultaneously which is the whole reason for buying the device.  Too late to return so I am stuck with more Chinese junk electronics.Update:  Based on the comments from the manufacturer on how to pair two devices, these updated instructions have made it work as intended.  I am giving 4 stars instead of 5 since I had no use of this device for 8 months until the manufacturer emailed me recently.  Otherwise, would have been 5 stars.

Excellent product!  Makes all my non Bluetooth devices capable of connecting wirelessly.  I have an old iPod that works well with this device so I can use my wireless bluetooth headphone with it using this innovative device.  This also works well as a receiver;  I've hooked up my car's stereo using the auxiliary inputs and paired the device with my iphone and it works beautifully.  Very well done!

This is a really small compact sized bluetooth transmitter and receiver. It is well-made with a silicone textured exterior. I am using this to make my non-bluetooth stereo hi-fi system into a bluetooth one. I paired my iPhone to the device in the 'receiving/rx mode' and then connected it to AUX port of the hi-fi system using the included 3.5mm Audio cable and the 3.5mm female to 2 RCA Male Cable. Another use for me was plugging my regular non-bluetooth headphones into the device's 3.5mm headphone jack and pairing it in 'receiving/rx mode' with my iPhone. In either case, I had no issues pairing the device and the sound that went through sounded fine.

This is a great, great tool. We are dance instructors and before this product, we had to jump back and forth to the dj booth to change music. Wrong song? Song too fast? great! Now I have to go back to the booth again! Not anymore. This little device connects quickly to your aux port, it connects to your phone via bluethooth and... done!  Sound coming through is flawless, and I've been as far as 40 feet and it has been perfectly responsive.PROS:

I was pleasantly surprised that I was able to connect through Bluetooth, my Sony wireless headphones to my Samsung smart TV. After reading the problems that some customers had with this product I was reluctant to buy it, however many people had positive results, one in particular suggested that a connection of this transmitter from the cable box could solve the issue that another customer had, it seemed reasonable, and I was willing to take a chance, glad I did. Now at first I tried a connection to the TV using the audio left right cable, but no luck, so then I connected the transmitter to the cable box "audio, left right ports", and it worked. I want to also point out that I have a Bose Solo 5 soundbar connected to the TV, if you have a similar connection than you will need to turn off that soundbar, no need to unhook anything connected  to anything else, "Just The Transmitter to the Cable Box". Oh, and don't forget to first pair the transmitter to the device you are trying to connect to.

I use this product with my cheap portable radio.  I enjoy fm radio and didn't want to spend $50.00+ dollars on a radio that has bluetooth builtin.  I've also used this product to watch Tv at night while my wife sleeps.  It works well.The Bluetooth connectivity method isn't the best.  I use a pair of Bose QC35 headphones to connect with this device.  Sometimes I have to use the connection wizard/bluetooth pairing method everytime I turn them off; this happens when I connect to a different device (like my phone) then attempt to pair with the TaoTronics device later.  Not a big problem but I thought I should mention it.  My headphones normally remembers every device it pairs with but the TaoTronics sometimes requires me to use the  connection wizard/bluetooth pairing method more than I'd like to.

This bluetooth transmitter is so little you can easily hide it in a pocket.  You just have to connect your 3.5mm Adapter wire (included in package.  It is easy to connect just hold the power button until it goes into pairing mode. I have it connect to my iphone and windows 10 computer.  I have used this for several hours at a time and so far I have not run out of power yet. I don't know exactly how long the rechargeable battery will last but I have used it for about 7 hours one day and it didn't die.When I first received my transmitter I had trouble getting it to connect with any of my BT electronics.  TaoTronics was very responsive to help resolve the problem. So should you have any questions or issues rest assured that TaoTronics customer service is really good.

Initially, I was a little bummed when I realized instead of  3.5mm or RCA jacks, the only "audio" out on my television is "optical/digital". I was on the verge of ordering a converter when the light bulb went off. I looked on the back of my Dish receiver and Viola! I plugged the transmitter into the RCA jacks on the receiver and I've got Bluetooth. Very happy with the sound quality and the range seems to be further than advertised.

This is a great aid for devices that don't have built in Bluetooth.  It's pairs quite easily and remembers the two headphones I paired to it without having to re-pair them.  The battery life is extraordinary,  I have used it for 12 continuous hours and still had power to spare.  The range appears better than described, I have been able to go up to and maybe over 50ft away without losing fidelity.  Also don't experience much interference when outside unlike some other BT devices I have used.  I haven't used the transmitting function yet, but if it's comparable with the receiving, then I would be happy if I needed that function.  I would highly recommend this device.

Finally, a product that works and allows me to use my Apple iPod Gen 6 with my 2017 Ford F-150 that doesn’t have a Aux Input and only Bluetooth. I highly recommend this product. I’ve tried another product and wasted my money.  This product paired to my truck’s Bluetooth quickly. I was so happy when I heard music from my iPod to my truck’s stereo. Just plug the 3.5mm Audio Jack into this product and your iPod (Audio Jack is Included). I had it on Transmitter Mode (TX Mode) in order for it to work with my truck’s Bluetooth. Includes simple instructions booklet, charge cable and Audio Adapter for Television. I also reviewed on YouTube.

I bought this to watch tv with wireless earbuds so I don’t disturb my wife at night. This was completely new for me and after researching Bluetooth transmitters I decided to try this one. After figuring out the TINY directions I got it to work. (Had to figure out the earbuds too) This solves a big problem for me and I’m so happy I got my setup working. It does what it says it will do and that’s what I wanted. I’m very happy with my purchase.

The TaoTronics Bluetooth 5.0 Transmitter and Receiver is much better compared to my old Bluetooth 4.2 transmitter from another brand in the following areas:-there is no more sound delay when watching movies because of the aptX Low Latency technology, I also use it to monitor sound wirelessly when I shoot video by connecting it to the headphone jack of my DSLR, it works flawlessly

UPDATE: Got an email with help instructions and it reset. Now working! Return cancelled!Used it for two days and was about to order another two and *poof* it quit pairing. My Bluetooth headphones would no longer pair with it, and my iPhone, nor my iPad could see it on the Bluetooth settings. Judging from all the positive revues I must have got a lemon. The teeny tiny instructions say it will remain in pairing mode for thirty seconds, but it drops out of pairing mode in less than five seconds. If it wasn't thirty bucks I'd blow it off, but as it is I will be returning it to Amazon. ASAP because $30 is too much for 30 hours of use.

I looked at a few of these devices, and this seemed to be the best bet for what I needed. I needed a transmitter only to plug into my computer and watch Netflix or Prime through my Bose headphones without disturbing my family. I have both the QuietComfort 35 (series II) and Soundsport Wireless. I had to dig through a bunch of forums to find a way for my headphones to connect to the TaoTronics, but once I figured it out, it was fine. It's still fiddly, but at least it works! The key is you have to wipe out all previous connections - connect to TaoTronics, then reconnect to other devices afterwards.

I have various speakers at home that i've purchased back when "wireless everything!" was still not a big thing. Now that we've got smart speakers and microwaves and lights and everything integrated with google or samsung, why not make my old speakers wireless as well. Now this wont make it into a google speaker, but it does give me the freedom to connect as many devices as i want without having to go through the hassle of untangling wires in the back and plugging a new audio source. I can just connect with bluetooth and stream my music with ease. I havent used the transmitter function yet so i cant really comment on that, but this little device has been great. I might pick up a few more in the future.

I purchased two of these for my sister and I, who share an apartment. I purchased two Bluetooth headphones so that we could each listen to our televisions or other devices without hear the neighbors children. These devices work wonderfully and we’re really happy with them. Well, my sister is happier than I am. It seems that my headphones keep connecting to her transmitter, which is through a wall and 15 feet away instead of connecting to my own transmitter which sits inches away. Every time I want to connect, I have to go into her half of the apartment, turn her transmitter off, go back into my room, reconnect to my device, then go back into her room to turn it on. It’s as if her device has a stronger signal or something. I’m not sure, but it’s frustrating, for sure!UPDATE: The company reached out to me and provided both a remedy and compensation for the issues I was having. Very good customer service and support, which is rare.

You're settled in your seat and your neighbor wants to use the restroom. If you have the TaoTronics transmitter and headphones that support aptX low latency, no problem. You'll just have this tiny transmitter hanging out of the headphone jack in the seat in front of you and you wont have to pause the movie and unplug your headphone cable. No noticeable lag watching movies using this transmitter. If you're on a flight that exceeds the run time of the batteries, you can plug into a USB port to power the transmitter. Did I mention that your headphones need to support aptX low latency? Hope you can still return those $350 headphones that are supposed to be great for noise reduction, but don't support aptX.

Right out of the box, the transmitter connected with the Bluetooth headset I was using and is very clear, had a quick connection, and really good range. I was a bit upset when I tried to connect a different headset to it, and it wouldn't search to give me a new connection. I was going to give it a not-so-great review. THEN, I received an unsolicited email from the seller, Sunvalley Brands, with instructions on how to reset to connect with a new device.
