Clearly they recognized this was a problem and proactively reached out to customers to help them. Because of the device, and the seller's customer service, I give it my highest rating.

I found I wasn't using my cassette walkman as much since I got so sick of getting tangled up in the headphone cords when putting my bag down, etc. Looks like this thingy will change my life. Works great right out of the box (without even charging first). Paired after a few tries with my earbuds and sounds frankly incredible: great fidelity and bass, no crackling or dropouts. I also love that it's rechargeable. Considering putting some velcro pads on it & my walkman so they can stick together vs. it being loose & dangling. I used to play my tapes in the car but since I walk more than drive now, the cassette collection was getting neglected. No more!
I wish I could give it a 5. However it would not pair with the speakers until I did the following:1. Pair to  my phone on tx mode.

Works great as a transmitter, that is what I used it for. Didn't see a volume adjustment but that would have been nice. It definitely got louder when I turned it up when connected to my TV's headphone jack but on a different TV it was set this was with Sony bluetooth headphones.I ended up getting two bluetooth speakers as this will support two devices at the same time. I tied this to a two way radio station to allow users in two different offices to hear traffic and it works great. Saved me time from having to run wiring to a hardwired speaker. At least with the TV use it had a little bit of background  noise but it was acceptable.

I have an older car with an audio jack but no bluetooth. The 3.5 audio jack on my older phone is hosed. Needed a connectivity solution and this adapter works perfectly. Just as nice as a hard wire connection. The audio output is higher when plugged into a power adapter. This may be due to the fact it was not fully charged with first use. I don't care much about battery life  or power output on battery power as it will remain plugged in for normal use. I do care about sound quality and this adapter sounds great. Pairing was quick and easy. I may edit this review after it's fully charged to compare output on battery power. There are less expensive adapters out there but the positive reviews are spot on and made it worth the extra money.

The Bluetooth connected quite easily, so this product worked just fine.  Unfortunately I found out while setting these up my Samsung TV doesn't allow volume control for the TV headphone jack that this was plugged in to.  Sound only came out at a fixed extremely loud volume from the TV's headphone jack.  Then I thought plan B would be to plug this into the headphone jack on my stereo receiver that's connected to my TV.  But then I read the fine print on the instructions that says to not connect it to an amplifier or it will damage this device due to overvoltage.  So they did work well but just not for my TV which isn't this product's fault.  So I had to return it due to no way to control volume for my TV.

We have a samsung smart tv and although it’s smart it doesn’t have Bluetooth. Our tv doesn’t have a stereo jack either so I used the other included red/white adapter to plug this into the back of our directv box. This transmitter paired up to our Bluetooth speakers but wouldn’t pair with any of our Bluetooth headphones (4 pairs all different brands). When it’s paired to the speakers there’s no way to adjust the volume and I tried adjusting it both from the tv and speakers with no luck. I ended up purchasing a pair of Taotronics Bluetooth headphones to see if they would pair to the transmitter and they do. There’s no latency at all and it seems to be working well but I’ve only had it for 2 days so I can’t say how long the charge lasts. I give it 3 stars because it wouldn’t pair to 4 different brands of Bluetooth headphones and when paired to a speaker there’s no way to adjust the volume. I also didn’t expect to have to purchase more Bluetooth headphones in order for it to work so keep in mind that it does not pair with all Bluetooth devices.

I purchased this item because I needed to add bluetooth transmission to my laptop because, for some reason, the built in bluetooth would connect to my headsets, pair with them, etc, but would not work with them.  This was incredibly easy to use and came fully charged right out of the box. I just set it to TX mode, plugged it into the headphone jack, turned it on, put it in pairing mode and my headset connected within seconds. It is small enough to be unobtrusive and slides right under the laptop, out of the way. In terms of functionality, it does exactly what it is supposed to do, and it does it with absolutely zero noticeable lag. So, audio and video is in perfect sync. It just works. I couldn't be happier. It's the perfect solution to my problem. Thank you, Seller!

I had purchased all the cable needed to run from my sound system across the room under the carpet to my projector screen sound bar.  Then I saw this on Amazon.  Thank goodness I did.  The connection from our projector to our bluetooth Visio soundbar was so simple.  I have to admit, I didn't even read the instructions.  In less than two minutes we were up and going with perfect sound.  The projector sits 11 feet from the soundbar.  There is no noticeable delay in sound so movies and tv are perfect.  After a week of use I would highly recommend this product and would not hesitate to purchase it again.  (I did not receive any discount or payment of any kind for writing this review)

I had wireless headphones so that I could watch and hear tv when my husband wanted a nap.  But the transmitter on the SharperImage set quit working after a few months.  So I purchased this TaoTronics transmitter in the hopes that it would pair with the old headphones.  It would not . . . those headphones apparently only pair with the dedicated SharperImage transmitter.  Then I purchased a new set of bluetooth headphones and the TaoTronics paired with them!  Now I am delighted to hear the tv again without disturbing hubby.  Also, really like the small portable size of this transmitter for traveling on airplanes.

TaoTronics Bluetooth 5.0 Transmitter and Receiver was used on a DISH TV WALLY receiver in our RV to provide a Bluetooth output signal. We are using a Yamaha YAS-109 sound bar to improve sound from our HDTV by streaming content to the sound bar which is bluetooth equipped. Now we can pick up all the music and voice transmitted to the sound bar in our RV and hear audio clearly. When desired, set your Satellite receiver to music channel and enjoy more of what you are paying for. Pairing the TaoTronics unit was easy by holding down the ONE button until the colors flash red & blue, your receiving unit (sound bar) should picked up the signal and starts producing audio. Included Instructions were pretty helpful.

This is the third Bluetooth adapter we've tried for our TV (ok, the 2nd one was a receiver ONLY and never would have worked) and it works great! My husband and I are anything but techies so we had no clue what we were doing, let alone familiar with the lingo but we wanted to use Bluetooth (JBL) headphones with our 10 Y/O Phillips non-Bluetooth TV. This adapter is simple enough for our simple minds ;) And I love the fact that it is teeny-tiny and just kind of hangs on the back of the TV so there aren't any wires hanging down. I haven't paired my headphones yet - we got these primarily for husband so the TV volume wouldn't drive me out of the house and I'd rather use my headphones for music - so I personally can't attest to the sound quality. But HE seems to be happy!

Yesterday I received the device at my house and tried to pair it with my JBL headset, but when I turn on the Tao Tronics the red and blue light never stops flashes and does not pair. Connect the Tao Tronics of the audio output of my Sony TV and tried to pair it with my JBL headset, but I have not succeeded, because the blue and red light does not stop flashing.The seller contacted me and gave me the guidelines to make it work. It is already working perfectly.

I have been using this transmitter for half a year and I am so satisfied with this little transmitter. I bought this for connecting my wireless earbuds to the tv so that I can watch TV while exercising on the treadmill. I first tried fireTV and the Bluetooth transmission function of fireTV is really awful, it was hard to connect and audio was lagging behind the video. Then I bought this product to give it a try. Surprisingly, this transmitter worked perfectly! After the initial setup, it automatically connects my earbuds and no audio lagging issues any longer. I highly recommend this product

I love it!  First off, I am only using this as a receiver for my car and can only review the receiving function of this device.  The sound quality is superb in my 135i when compared to the previous Bluetooth 4.2 units I have used, I would definitely say Bluetooth 5.0 is near CD like quality.  I leave it plugged in to the charger and to the auxiliary port at all times and there is no background noise from the alternator. Once I turn it on it instantly connects to my phone with no issues every time.Now the only issue I have is that the unit goes to sleep after a period of inactivity, so after leaving the car and returning from, say, grocery shopping, you have to turn the unit back on,  and I only complain about this because it’s located in an awkward area in my car and is a little annoying to have to do,  if the unit had a dedicated on off switch i believe the battery capacity would be more than plenty to keep it alive even overnight, as a previous unit I had did so.  However this is something I’m willing to overlook considering the quality of the audio and quality of the unit itself.  Would recommend to anyone needing a Bluetooth receiver in a vehicle.

Admittedly I was a little skeptical given the name brand and relatively cheap price when compared to other bluetooth transmitters. However let me assure you this thing works great. Bought a couple of them for my father since his hearing ain't what is used to be! Took about a minute to plug I to the TV and pair to his wireless headphones. Crystal clear reception with no lag. He is very happy as is my mother for not havi g to listen to the TV volume turned all the way up.

I've been trying to search for a receiver/transmitter to go along with my bluetooth headphones that have ultra low (or no) latency for my music recording goals and these definitely are excellent! My setup isn't for high-end recording of course, however, I just needed some recording equipment to lay down some guitar tracks to send to my drummer. I don't like having to juggle with so many cables around me so I'm trying to lessen the mess while recording as much as I can :). Having so many cables around kind of interferes and makes a hassle during recording for me. So these definitely help!

The Bluetooth receiver/ transmitter is intuitive and  easy to use. I have only used it in the transmit mode. the sound was clear with no static even with using it while being charged. The instructions were easy to understand. I'm 73 so I needed a good lighting and a magnifying glass to read. Paring was fairly easy squeeze the transmitter/receiver until it flashes red and blue; then hold down the Bluetooth head phones power button  constantly usually you will hear "power on" from the headphones continue to hold down the power button in a few seconds you will hear "paring" from the head phones. TaoTronics and Sony headphones usually work that way.

As a frequent traveler I bought this product for the purpose of allowing me to use my usual pair of (completely wireless) Bose bluetooth headphones on a plane with their in-flight entertainment system.  During a recent trip to/from London, I brought this transmitter and enjoyed the in-flight movies with zero issues.  It's so much better than using the cheap headphones that the airline gives you!I was able to pair it easily, even while sitting in the airplane seat.  Also, I was able to charge the unit consistently throughout the flight and not have to worry about anything during the 8 hour flight.

I watch TV at night and my wife and I go to bed at different times.  Often a couple hours apart.  My TV is mounted on the wall in our bedroom and 10-15 feet away.  That meant that I had to watch TV in the other room due to sound.  I have Bluetooth headphones but my TV didn’t support Bluetooth.I ordered this transmitter and plugged it into the tv headphone jack.  Synced my headphones with it in under 2 minutes and BAM!!! Sound from the transmitter to my Bluetooth headphones.  Happy wife, happy life.  Now we can go to bed at the same time and I no longer keep her up with loud TV.

Bought two of these; one for a 2008 BMW and one for my boat that doesn’t have a Bluetooth stereo head unit. Each has an auxiliary (aux) port and that is all you need. I love this product. It’s well made and works great. Easy to plug in and use as well. Steaming music from my phone now in this car and on the water w/o having to replace the receivers, for what would have been much more money and time. No issues what so ever.

I purchased this a little over a year ago. I have it permanently connected to my TV with it plugged in to power all the time. It worked great for a year.  Now is cuts in and out and makes a humming noise that gets progressively worse the longer you are using it.  I have confirmed that it is the transmitter, not my bluetooth headset.  I can use my headset to listen to music on my phone and get no annoying noises or cut outs.  I expected it to last longer for the price.  Back to the drawing board.UPDATE: Jan. 28, 2020

I bought one of these about a year ago with the intent to use it to listen to the television.  I was to replace a set of infrared headphones attached to the TV.  Well, I finally got to install it recently on my downstairs TV.  I paired it to a set of wireless earbuds and everything worked fine.  That is, until the battery went dead after umpteen hours of use.  I fixed that problem real quick by plugging the charging cable into one of the USB ports on the TV.  Now every time I watch TV the unit is being charged.One thing I noticed is there is about a half-second delay between the sound on the TV speakers and the sound on the earbuds.  However, I have noticed this delay on other wireless headphones so I think it is par for the course.

What is the warranty on this product? It quits pairing after 2 months. Lights were blinking blue and red but would not pair with bluetooth speaker which pairs easily with my computer bluetooth.Update: tried off and on for hours and it starts to magically work again. I hope it stays that way. Not sure what happened but that was frustrating to worry about an unreliable device.

I bought this to use with Sony WH-1000xm3 headphones on an older (2016) Sony TV.  Naturally, the two Sony products were incompatible, even though both were said to be A2DP friendly.  Apparently, Sony's "version" of A2DP for older TV's in not function with their own new products.  Can you say "we want you to buy a new TV?"  RANT DONEIn order to get my headphones working with the TV, I purchased this unit since it is BT 5 and I was 99% sure it would pair with BT 4.2 headphones.  On my initial attempt(s) over two hours, I was unable to get the two paired, so I sent a rather terse email to TaoTronics  asking why their BT device was so lame.  By 5 a.m. the next business day, I had an email from Ella at TaoTronics which asked me to reset the BA07 device, incuding detailed instructions on how to do that task.  Once completed, I followed the pairing instruction Ella provided, and BOOM, it worked like a charm.  That's what I call great customer service.

Bought two of these to take advantage of the AptX low latency feature. Using to transmit audio from projector headphone output to portable speaker RCA input. Because the speaker is only about 20 feet from the projector, the latency is virtually undetectable and sound quality are fine. When using a cable to connect the projector to speaker, the sound quality is better and the volume can be turned up to very loud and painful levels. The minor issue is sound volume. When using this tandem, wireless connection, the volume is limited even when the projector volume and speaker volume controls are turned up to 100% (equivalent to about 60-70% with wired connection). Only downside preventing a 5-star rating.

Edit:I was contacted by customer support and they suggested the units plugged into the televison were under powered so I Plugged them into a ac usb adaptor and they work fine. 5 stars for customer service and problem solving.Bought two of them one to transmit the other to receive. both make a loud "teeee" sound when charging, one had battery issues (2-4 hour life) the other would make random popping noises and would disconnect. I tested both on 2 pairs of headphones, one pair of speakers, and 3 differant bluetooth sources (PC, samsung s8, and an iphone 10).

I've owned a few adapters of this sort. This one is the most well made of the lot, pairing is easy, it's plenty loud, and the battery life is adequate. Bear in mind that there will be a noticeable lag between audio and video if you're transmitting to an Apple device or Bose headphones. It works fine as a receiver. (I use it as a receiver for movies viewed on an iPad---converting my wired earbuds to wireless---without difficulty, but the lag when transmitting from an airplane audio jack to Bose bluetooth headphones is awful). That's Bose and Apple's problem (they both use the antique, brain-dead AAC codec exclusively), though. Works great with Sony bluetooth phones, which support the faster codecs.

Love the idea here, but the sound is not loud enough to make it viable. I use this for flights and it’s so quiet I’m going to have to change back to my  hard wired headset.Update: The company reached out to me to understand my issue.  I was sent a replacement unit as the low volume should not have been as low as what i was experiencing.  The new product is working as intended and has fixed my volume issues.

Transmits and receives excellently, great range, great battery life, extremely light and small, simple to use, this thing is LIFE.I got this for outdoor movie projector night. I don’t want the sound playing out loud so I have this connected to transmit from the aux port of my projector. Me and my wife each have wireless Bluetooth earbuds and we connected both sets simultaneously.

I encountered the same issue as some other reviewers with the sound cutting out when playing movies from my video projector with quiet/low volume scenes.  As per a previous reviewer's post: "According to support, the device has a low Db cutoff feature to save power. So, for example, if the scene audio is a slight breeze with crickets (as it is a lot in "Zelda: Breath of the Wild" and many movies, I would imagine), that ambient noise has been cut off and you hear nothing because the unit has stopped transmitting until the audio comes back up above the Db cutoff level. I understand the reasoning for the "feature" to save power, but, in my opinion, it renders the unit useless."I had my TaoTronics transmitter plugged into the headphone audio output jack on my projector which then connected to a bluetooth receiver to my old stereo receiver/speakers.  I finally figured out that the problem was that the output volume was set too low for this audio output port on the projector, and therefore the TaoTronics transmitter was not getting enough audio input volume in order to broadcast an uninterrupted signal.  By simply adjusting the output volume of the projector, it resolved the issue by eliminating the sound cutting out from the quiet/low volume/low db scenes.  So glad that this resolved the issue in my case, as I was about to return the product.  Also am surprised that the vendor's support line was not able to offer this workaround as a fix.  Hope they read this review and update their product documentation to include the fix in their 'Troubleshooting Tips' section of the product manual.

Latency is a huge problem. If you use it for playing musical instruments without bothering others, forget it. The delay is ridiculously long for this application. For TV, if you don’t mind sound being off from picture it’s ok. For Bluetooth earbuds, music only, I’m sure it’s fine. I didn’t test the sound quality BC I already have BT earbuds.For my application (playing guitar) completely worthless. Huge disappointment.

I used this with my airpods with the television receiver when I'm doing my workouts. My BF doesn't like the music on the dvds and all the shouted instructions but I want to be able to hear it loud for motivation...This keeps us both happy.

Purchased and received product, failed to connect to my Amazon purchased Sony Noise Cancelling Headphones WH1000XM3: Wireless Bluetooth Over the Ear Headphones which are the best on the market currently. Sent back and recieved 2nd product that again failed to pair with my new headphones purchased from Amazon. There are only three steps to allegedly pair device so I can't believe that it was my issue following directions. This was a total waste of time on a product that obviously doesn't function as advertised. Now I have to wait for a week to get my money back!

Very simple device. I use it to provide Bluetooth sound from a Roland electronic keyboard to Sony Bluetooth headphones.  Because there is no computer or phone between these devices, I had to have faith that by following the pairing directions that the keyboard and headphones would connect. They did. I have only used this to transmit. There is very little lag with headphones. There was noticeable lag and sound quality issues when paired with earbuds, but with the headphones, I can't complain. I do have to follow the pairing procedure each time I want to use the device which is a minor inconvenience but at least it works. This unit charges by USB and I have gone as long as 2 hours on a single charge.

I received this product in October 2019, and it has died. wires for charging cord disconnected and no-longer charges. I had hoped it would have lasted at least a year, but I guess you get what you pay for. I've ordered a replacement WiFi receiver/transmitter that has more of the features I wanted anyway and plugs into the wall with a switch that allows me to switch the RCA mini cable to the headphone jack of and on instead of disconnecting.  https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B01H6I3YGK/ref=ppx_yo_dt_b_asin_title_o01_s00?ie=UTF8&psc=1

I purchased this because I was tired of using wired connection for my PC. It would limit my ability to move around freely in my room hence I purchased the transmitter. And does it do a great job as a transmitter. First, it works great and sounds great but the first time using it was a bit confusing. To elaborate, the instructions say press it twice to pair, however, when you turn it on it will already be on pairing mode which I guess is great.Second, I noticed that if you charge it via USB port on a PC while using the device you start to hear a slight buzz. But if you stop charging it; the buzzing sound goes away.

Great customer service and followup.  I could not find direction to pairing to this unit with my headset.  Finally I did.  I do recommend buying their earphone as they are matched for each other I believe.  It is very small so I can bring it when traveling and watch TV with this setup.  No more complaint from spouse about TV sound.  In fact I may buy another one as the price is good and have it handy at the bed room for TV watching.  You can also keep it charging while being used.  No worry about running out of power.

This Bluetooth transmitter connect to my IsoTune ear plugs easy.  I’ve walked around the house and it stayed connected about 2 rooms away.  When you turn it off, it will NOT auto connect next time it’s turned on.  There is a very slight delay.  If your watching a movie it’s just a bit annoying.  I mostly use this on a video camera to monitor the audio.  The right ear is my shotgun mic and the left is the wireless system.  I’ve not tested the battery life.  When filming I start it out fully charged and still have it plugged into a battery pack.

This bluetooth adapter is a very quick and easy way to connect devices.  I used to connect my Sony TV to my Denon home stereo.  The set up took minutes, bluetooth connection was very quick and extremely easy.  I use in the transmit mode from my TV to the stereo.  Sound quality is fine and the bluetooth connection works well.I had minor interference from my WiFi router when I initially installed the device.  After moving my Wifi router two feet away all interference stopped.  Currently the Taotronics bluetooth transmitter is approximatly 8-10 feet away from my bluetooth receiver and it works well.

The unit, when connected, works great. Been using for a couple of months now at work. The pro's are that the range is pretty good and quality of sound transmitted is great. The battery life is kinda average, it can only run for about 8 hours. The other issue is connectivity, once every 10 days or so the adapter refuses to connect to speaker it has been connected to and other devices. It requires a fair bit of jerry rigging and button presses before it can work again. I will give it the benefit of the doubt and chalk it up to numerous bluetooth devices being around, but it starting to get annoying.

My wife and I travel quite a bit and we do some touring especially in Europe, (easier than driving). The tour companies provide you with a transmitter made by Vox with an earphone and a wired earphone. So when you're walking around with the Vox around your neck on a lanyard with the earphone plugged in your ear EVERYONE knows you're a tourist. The Taotronic Bluetooth allow you to put the transmitter in your bag and your bluetooth earphones in your ears (no wires or lanyards show). You hear everything without looking like a "duffus!"

UPDATE - I'm giving this a 5 star for the excellent customer service, after reading this review the company reached to me and offered the upgraded model of this receiver, so far I've tried it on a couple of my stereos and it worked as it was advertised, I will continue to try it on my other stereos just to make sure but so far I had no problems with this unit; it even works with the stereo in my garage while streaming music from my phone inside my home (no interference whatsoever).-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

I bought this to connect to my television to watch movies with headphones. The transmission is in stereo and is capable of transmitting throughout the house. The battery lasts a long time upon charging. The sound quality through the headphones is really good, and I’m able to hear things much more clearly than using my stereo surround sound speaker system. It transmits to two headphones at a time, so now my spouse and I can watch movies together, without struggling to hear everything in the movie. We can individually adjust the volume on the headphones. So glad I bought this.

Works as expected.  Using this in a 2010 Toyota RAV4 via AUX port and connects quickly.  Using only in receiver mode (music streaming from my iPhone).  Cables that are included (headphone and usb charging cable) are the perfect length to connect to usb plug that I put into cigarette lighter spot and connect to this device to constantly charge while car is on.

This little gizmo is very small, simple, and efficient to use.  Pairing is easy.  I just hold the button in until it starts blinking.  Next, I hold in the button on my headsets, and, BAM...it's paired.  I plug this into my 1/4" headphone jack on my amp (I had a downsizing adapter to 1/8").My only complaint is that it doesn't see to hold the connection.  I use this for watching TV/Video.  So, I may use it for a few hours a day.  But, when I turn my headsets off for the night, the next morning I have to re-pair the Bluetooth.  Since it's simple, it's no big deal. And, maybe it's the fault of the headset. Who knows?  All-in-all, I give this a high recommend and would buy it again!

(Review written after 10 days of use)Works perfectly well. We sit about 7 feet from the TV, a Sharp lc-55p6000u. The Techtronics is permanently plugged in to a charger. Once you get the headsets paired, they stay paired (unless you use one or the other to pair with some other device).  There is no noticeable latency even with two headsets. One of us is slightly deaf so it is great to able to adjust the headset volume on one set without affecting the other.  And since the speakers aren't used there is no disturbance to others in the house or to condo neighbors.

I bought first on 16 DEC 2018, it failed. one  and TaoTronics  then sent me a " free replacement when the first unit failed 26 Jan 2019.  Now that second unit failed.Same symptoms on both failure, still connects to phone, no audio output...

If you are like me and have been wishing there was a way for you and your wife to watch movies on a plane and both use your bluetooth headphones, this is it!Its kind of confusing at first on how to pair two headphones, but just make sure to read the instructions and you will be good to go!

We like to watch DVDs or connect to the TV through our Roku stick while working out on our treadmill/exercycle in the basement, but prefer listening through our Bluetooth headphones so as not to disturb other family members upstairs.  I knew I was taking a chance by ordering a product I had never tried, and that no family members or friends had used. I was not disappointed!  I was able to attach the device to our somewhat outdated DVD player (thus eliminating the need to connect it to an amplifier, then to standard corded headphones), and the results were incredible!  I can control the volume using my Bluetooth headphones, and the sound quality exceeded my expectations -- I've never had to turn the volume up to the maximum level.  I liked this device so much, I ordered a 2nd to connect to our Roku box.  Now we can watch virtual scenery cycling videos and listen to the included soundtrack while riding our exercise cycle. This device is easy to connect when following the instructions in the guide (and I a somewhat technology-challenged).  It can also be used as either a transmitting or receiving device. Like any bluetooth add-on, the TaoTronics must be charged, but no more frequently than our Bluetooth ear buds. All the necessay connectors/accessories are included. A great buy for the money!

I have Bluetooth Noise Canceling headphones from Sony.  They are awesome in the airplane (and not exactly cheap).  I usually have them connected to my phone for music.  However, sometimes I like to watch the free movies on the plane.  I have to plug my headphones into the console which is fine I guess, but it becomes a pain when someone needs to get up and I have to unplug all my stuff.  This solves that.  I can plug the transmitter into the monitor's 1/8" headphone jack and if someone needs to leave I just get up without worrying about the person tripping over wires.The other use case for it is that some rental cars still don't have bluetooth or I don't want to connect my phone and have it's contacts sync...  So I plug this in the AUX port and I can listen to my music off my phone on the car stereo

When using in Tx mode to connect headphones to TV, this product doesn't transmit all audio out of the TV. It is not a Bluetooth issue - this product has a cutoff feature where low volume sounds (background music, quiet speech, etc) gets cutoff apparently to "save power". This is a huge deal breaker if using mainly to watch TV, where the full audio is part of a good sound experience!!Loud sounds and foreground speech comes through clearly. When loud sounds exist, quieter background comes through as well, but when the sound in the scene is quieter, you hear nothing entirely. It results in an obvious choppy sound effect that sounds at first like Bluetooth connectivity issues, but it is not - it is apparently a "feature" of the product.

I was very pleased to get my new bluetooth transmitter and headphones.  (I stepped on the cordless headphones I'd had for several years.)  Then I opened the boxes.  I think the transmitter is the big problem.  Less then 30 ft. of open space, no walls, was the best it could do.  In all honesty, Tao Tronics  does offer a free up grade--take it!  The headphones were okay.  They fit well and were comfortable to wear.  But they do not have a good range of volume.My real problem now is that they no longer even recognize each other.  I have tried them on my computer and my Amazon Fire tablet, same result on each.  I believe I've had them too long for a refund.

Installation: simple, straightforward with instant results.  Tech support previous to purchase: excellent.  Sound?  Great in that we run classical music from internet station located in Europe...good for discerning ears...and we are running a powerful amplifier that pushes serious juice to two AR-3a classic 1960s 8ohm speakers.  Use?  Turn on laptop, turn on stereo amplifier, press and hold for a bit the start button on the TaoTronics transmitter (for the laptop) and receiver (for the amplifier)...select the internet station and ... VOILA! ... Music for the ears.  Sometimes there's no hesitation on giving a good review.  This is one of those times.  Unreservedly LOVING IT!
UPDATE:the company reached out to me, and sent me the newest model of the bluetooth transmitter.

Exactly what I needed to turn my 15-year-old 75 W fender guitar amp into a Bluetooth ready soundsystem. Took about two seconds to sync with my phone with no worries about Alexa responding to everything I say – whether or not directed to her. And no problems with it randomly activating other Bluetooth devices in my house. Can give no stars for sound quality because, well, sound comes from my speaker; same with volume control. When I calculated the price of a Sonos, Apple, Bose, or Marshall smart speaker, I figure for $30 I saved about $307.

To give you an Idea of the physical size, it's exactly a quarter and nickel wide and 5 quarters tall.I got this small unit to mount to my motorcycle helmet so I can bluetooth stream my music from my phone (Galaxy S8) to a pair of speakers i put in the helmet. Bluetooth pairing was achieved in seconds and the audio streams flawlessly with NO lag, cut out or robotic mechanical sounding audio translation.

I was looking for a quality solution to stream our non-bluetooth indoor audio setup outside without paying an arm and a leg for a new Sonos type system and this fit the bill.  Bought a pair of them, set one to transmit (plug into audio out or use an adapter to convert line-out to 1/8 phono plug) and the other to receive and plug into the AUX input.  It was very easy to set up the bluetooth and sounds great. Plug into anything with an aux input and you can stream music. I couldn't be happier with the decison. I'll definitely buy from TT again.

Hooked it up for the first time yesterday to try it out, and im impressed by the sound quality.  This is an initial review.Update as of 8-7-20.  I personally have nothing negative to say about this product.  The bluetooth 5.0 frequency pushes the sound of my pandora thru the vehicle speakers crystal clear and way better than any auxiliary cord I've ever used.  I just can't use it in my semi which is what I bought it for bc the stupid truck shuts the radio off periodically while I'm driving so nothing bad about this product. 👍👍

I don't usually review products, but I am impressed with the size and versatility of this product.  I bought it to use with basic head phones so I could connect with my phone when I am going to sleep.  I have tried a lot of blue tooth head phones but they don't hold up well after several uses and the constant flashing is annoying.  With this device, I can flip it over so I don't have to see the light unless I want to.The sound quality is good and I liked the product well enough to buy a 2nd one.

This works better than expected. I needed something that would allow me to use my wired noise - cancelling headphones with my iPhone X. I’ve used numerous lightning to audio dongles and all of them were bad - either flaky from the start or didn’t last long.This transmitter works great, I can just plug in my headphones and keep it in my pocket. It lets me listen to my music regardless of whether my phone is plugged in on the other side of the room, or even if I need to leave the room for a minute. The range seems good and I have no complaints any audio quality.

This product worked fine for one day.  Then it would not.  Just repeats, pairing, pairing...never connects.  I contacted customer service and they were helpful which makes the device work and if it goes not connect, I know how to make it work.  Still somewhat frustrating.  I unplugged it from power and let it sit for a time.  I switched from TX to RX, powered on and then powered off.  Switched back to TX and powered on.  It then connected.  But two days later I had to repeat the whole process again as it would not pair with my headset once again.  I turn off the device every time I am done.  The device has been working okay for a while now.
This device is good in overall. Only few cons I can think of.1. For user's experience, it's kind of awkward to link my laptop or phone to a "music transmitter" via stereo cable.

I read a bit about it and others like it before I purchased. I wasn’t completely sold that this was the product I would buy. Then I saw that it was Amazons best seller or whatever u call it. That validated my thoughts and so bought it. I didn’t compare prices. I wanted beat value. Set-up directions seem to leave out a few things (to me). I just tried what I thought would be the most intuitive way to get it to work and happy that it was easy. I bought for my Bluetooth headphones to work with an older smart tv without Bluetooth. Next I need to figure out a way to get 2 devices working at the same time. There are directions and will attempt that later. I have construction going on at my house and the Nextdoor neighbor does too. His is even more loud. I’m very happy with the purchase and thrilled that I received it so fast!
Updated Review:Had some issues w/ initial unit, but customer service went out of their way to make it right.

Device works fine. Very small.  Made well.  The drawback is no auto shut off.  As soon as you disconnect Bluetooth from it - it blinks bright light incessantly - as if it is in rectal pain. Yep - just Like Lionel’s dumb tune “All Night Long” and most likely even longer until it burns its a$s out.  If it was less than $20 - you would be ok with this unpleasant feature - especially if you actual enjoy suffering and think electronic devices experience feelings.  I use it solely for TV watching in the evening.  Turn off my Bluetooth headset and TV - our boy here starts to blink as if the world is suddenly out of gas relief pills. I turn it off in the morning when I wake.  I’ll let you know when it finally blinks no more.  It works fine.  Buy it - if you main use is NOT evening TV viewing.  Lol. Enjoy.

I started out with the lower priced TT-BA01. Worked fine for a month or so then wouldn't pair no matter what I tried. Anything you find on the web is just the same sparse instructions you get with the device. Zero customer support.Oh well, I thought only $19.00 maybe I got a bad one (return window expired) I'll go ahead and upgrade to the TT-BA07 $32.00. Well, here I am 2 months later with a worthless piece of plastic. I'm out around $60.00. My bad for giving this company a second chance. Lesson learned

I bought this a couple of months ago because my tv was not Bluetooth and I wanted to be able to watch my movies without disturbing other people in my house. I paired it with my headphones and it worked perfect out of the box. Then I tried pairing it to my speaker, and it cut out Everytime the audio was low on the tv, for example no talking or just music. I thought it was something with the speaker, and I didn't use it again for a while because I moved and my previous tv broke. I just got settled in my place, bought a new TV and paired it with my headphones again. This time I could notice drastically how much it cut out, to the point where it would cut out people speaking. I thought then it night have been a battery issue, so I charged it for a full three days to no avail. Then while using it, it suddenly disconnected from my headphones and would not repair. I'm really frustrated with it, and it's too late to return. My advice! Spend the extra money on something worth it. Thirty dollars is alot to just throw away.Updated 4/29/20

I am using the TaoTronics Bluetooth 5.0 Transmitter and Receiver as a bluetooth transmitter for a Sansa Clip for use in my 2004 Ford Thunderbird with the FM Transmitter with Bluetooth capability.  It works flawlessly.  It is also great for use while exercising with my bluetooth headphones.  No wires to get in the way!.  I am very pleased with the size of the TaoTronics Bluetooth 5.0 Transmitter.  It is very small, about the size of my Sansa Clip only slimmer.  I am very pleased with my purchase.

I have a receiver and TV without bluetooth pairing for headphones, and I will sometimes watch TV or a movie late at night. Using headphones allows me to respect the noise levels for others and to hear my shows better. So, I began my search for a bluetooth transmitter that would pair with my Air Pods and other wireless headphones. About two months ago, I ordered and received the TaoTronics Bluetooth 5.0 3.5mm adapter (TT-BA07).The first time I tried to use it was with my Air Pods (the only working wireless headphones I have), but the two devices couldn’t seem to connect with each other. I searched and tried several possible solutions from different sources before contacting TaoTronics support; this is one of those cases where I should have started there!

This is my second TaoTronics device, my first was the TT-BA01 that I later gave to my boss.I use this on every flight that I have, it works perfectly in transmitting the in-seat entertainment to my bluetooth headphones. This alone has prevented me from breaking anymore cables when I have to get up to let somebody in to the aisle and forgetting to unplug a cable. It also makes a great conversation piece when other passengers see that I'm watching my entertainment wirelessly. :)

My TV is only 6 months old.  When I plug this Bluetooth device to it, the TV shorts out and turns off.  I tried twice to make sure it wasn't a coincidence.  Luckily I could plug the USB into a stand alone plug.  This devices is transmitting now but with lag.  I tried it on my satellite receiver and on my DVD player all have lag.  I may have to call shenanigans on the "aptX Low Latency" claim.  I'm just glad my TV came back on.  I was afraid this thing fried the internals.

The TV in my exercise room never gets loud enough despite volume maxed out, it's a cheap TV without bluetooth so I live with it during every DVD workout and just get more annoyed. I hit my limit last week and decided to try this transmitter paired to my bluetooth wireless earbuds. I was blown away immediately.  It paired on the first try and I am beyond impressed at the new volume level...I had to actually turn down my headphones for the first time ever.  This brings a new level of focus and motivation to my workouts and I wish I bought this years ago.  Definitely recommend it to anyone needing more volume for a cheaper TV

I connected this to my police scanner in the Tx mode to my Apple Airpods.  I turned it on and it started searching for connections.  I opened my Apple Airpods case and pressed the button on the back.  Presto.  Within a few seconds, I was streaming to my Airpods.  The audio volume was controlled by my scanner without any issues.  After shutting everything down it takes a few seconds for this device to reconnect to see the Airpods again but it connects again without any issues.  This works great!

I always managed to buy the model year vehicle just prior to the intro of the good stuff like cd players, multi-disc players, players that can read mps, bluetooth...yeah, first world problem.Anywho, this work great connecting phone to the AUX port on my truck radio.  Pair was simple, press and hold til it blinks, find it in your phone settings, bim-bam, your set.

I almost never leave reviews, but this item is worth reviewing. Really liking the transmitter through my travels over the past many months. Smaller than I expected (pleasant surprise). I’ve used it on airplanes to connect to two pairs of Bluetooth headphones (Tx mode), with a ski helmet to turn my wired connection into a wireless one (Rx mode), and with two Bluetooth speakers to play the same music on both for “stereo” music at the hot tub (Tx mode). All of these scenarios worked flawlessly. I’m really quite impressed. Also, thanks Taotronics — able to stop turning my wireless headphones into wired ones with an annoying splitter on flights!Battery life has been very good (haven’t measured closely, but always lasted a lot longer than expected), including when using on very cold days skiing. Also, battery hasn’t discharged significantly after weeks of not using or charging, which has been a pleasant surprise when I’ve forgotten to charge before a flight.

My husband and I have different TV rooms and, often, he can hear my TV and finds it very annoying.  I had researched adding BT to the TV but had held off until I found this item as a Deal of the Day.  WOW, I don't know why I waited so long as it works perfectly.  I don't know about battery life as I keep it plugged in when in use and unplugged when not.  I did need to upgrade my BT earphones to a APTX low latency set but, other than that, the transmitter has been a very good addition to our married life.

I was very excited to try this product and after reading many 4 and 5 star reviews I expected it to work perfectly.  I have a projector and a bluetooth speaker that I would like to pair.  Seems like a fairly simple task and exactly what this product was designed for.  I hooked everything up and was able to pair the device with my speaker fairly easily the first time.  Unfortunately, there was a lag between the audio and the video...that's absolutely unacceptable.Even more unfortunate is the fact that I have not been able to get the device to pair with my bluetooth speaker since that first use...so basically I bought this product and it worked exactly once and even when it worked it was so laggy that it was useless.

This was my third - and final - purchase/attempt at a Bluetooth transmitter for my mom's TV in her bedroom...and it worked! (unlike two previous purchases, different brands). I tried this one because the listing had an instructional video. First thing I noticed when unpacked...the manual was very clear in the setup directions, obviously not a translated-to-english version, no gaps in the setup, didn't need the video. Once set up and charged, my mom can go room to room with no interruptions - except when she's got her head in the fridge. My mom is 82 yrs old and not mechanical; if she's happy and can operate the device, it's a winner.

This little item lets me watch TV into the night without disturbing my wife's sleep. I love it. I have just ordered another one!A note: These folks sent a card with an offer of a gift for a 5 star review. I jumped through all the hoops and applied for the gift. That was a week ago. Thus far, nothing. Though, I do think this items deserves 5 stars.

states that it supports aptX low-latency, which should come in at around ~40ms. I used two identical devices paired TX/RX, and measured latency with a function generator/oscilloscope a best case latency of 189ms. the audio is programmed to quickly cut out at volumes marginally below medium. it's distactingly low-quality noisy, and overpoweringly distorted when plugged into the charger. really the only thing they got right was the pairing and outside rubberized texture. returning for my 60 bucks back in hand to put towards something that accomplishes what it says on the description

This little gem does everything I had hoped for. Broadcasts all audible frequencies from 20hz to 20khz! Makes my E7 pros sound like Bose. No static long range and small to move around the house or on a flight or in a car or rv. Pairs easy to my E7 Pro headphones! Love this device. Worth the price!Could use another one. Highly recommended!

This is such a great little device! We have an older stereo system which sounds great, but isn't wireless. This transmitter/receiver allows my wife to stream music on her phone, but play it on the stereo. The setup was easy and it sounds great. I ended up running power to it with an extra USB charging cable I had so we don't have to worry about remembering to turn it off or recharging the battery. It will also allow us to not lose it...it is pretty small.Liked it so much, I ordered another as a gift for my brother-in-law and he loves it too!

So far this is working pretty decently as a bluetooth transmitter for my Switch. I'm also hoping to use it in the future on airplane audio jacks. I have some trouble getting multiple headphones paired (as it supposedly can do), and I do get some interference that I don't get on other devices, so it's not perfect. I was annoyed to see that in the box is a card asking for a 5 star review and promising a 10 dollar gift card if you email it to them. Seems to be why there are so many reviews for this product.

I was not able to use this device as for some reason it’s frequency wiped out my Netgear router 2.5 ghz WiFi. I tried changing the channel on the router but to no avail. So sadly I am having to return it as if I have to choose, my WiFi Connection is more important than Bluetooth in my home.UPDATE 2/14/19. Since writing this review Ada from Taotronics has reached out to me in the hope I would give it another try.

This is the second one I have purchased for my husband. He has one in the garage connected to his old stereo and one in his car. Such an inexpensive way to update your stereo without having to buy a new stereo. The range is great also. I highly recommend the TaoTronics Bluetooth 5.0 Transmitter / Receiver. His plan is to set one transmitting and one receiving to connect his record player to the stereo so he doesn't have to run cables which we understand can be done. Will update our review once we give this a try. We have recommended the TaoTronics Bluetooth 5.0 Transmitter / Receiver to several of our friends!

I love this product, it enables me to use my bluetooth headphones to connect to my TV so my husband doesn't have to hear the TV. I'm not sure if this is how it is with all TVs, but I had to mute the TV so that the external speakers wouldn't play.The only thing I dislike is that it is annoying to have to recharge the device- the battery lasts for a few hours. It will not let you use it while it is charging, which is a bummer. This is just a minor irritation, I would still recommend buying this!

I bought 2 units hoping I could pair them with one another so that I could connect my non-Bluetooth stereo with my non-Bluetooth headphones.  The instructions do not describe that usage, but the response from vendor tech support was that they are capable of that.  In fact that scenario works just fine, using one in RX mode and one in TX mode.  Bottom line, I am very pleased.  Considering the various pairs of non-Bluetooth headphones I have around the house, a second TX/RX device was much more useful than spending that same money on a single set of Bluetooth headphones.

This Bluetooth Tx and Rx worked flawlessly out of the box.  I got it to work that way because I went to the TaoTronics web site and downloaded the user's manual and printed out some copies of the instructions in a readable-sized print.  The manual that comes with it requires an electron microscope to read it.  It is a very fine product and the stereo sound quality is outstanding.  Now you can turn those non-Bluetooth MP-3 players and AM radios into Bluetooth transmitters at a very reasonable price.  I highly recommend this product.

I use this product every day in my physical education classes. I’m able to walk around the gym and control the volume from my Apple Watch without needing to carry my phone everywhere. When I need attention I’m able to pause and play through my watch which is connected to my phone to the taotronics transmitter. It connects so easily and it’s so convenient that I just slip it in my pocket and plug it in when I jump in my car as well. It’s a great product and has a large range and the audio sounds very clear in both the gym and my car. I have been using this for about six months now, and I would definitely recommend it to anyone looking for a transmitter to make any speaker system Bluetooth compatible.The only thing that I wish that this had there’s a way to control the volume when I use it to connect to my AirPod pros. I’m not sure if it was the airplane system or the fact that I cannot turn the volume up on my AirPods. When I was flying last week on Delta Airlines the using the taotronics to connect to my AirPod Pros I could barely hear the audio. When I used any other headphones with an Aux chord I had no problem. Idk if this was due to the fact that you cannot turn up the volume manually on the AirPod Pros, but I do not fly very often and most airplanes give you a set of headphones to use, so it wasn’t that big of a deal

Arrived on time and is as described/pictured. Easy Peasy to hook-up and pare. I've used it on my TV, PC, and my in-home stereo so I can use my wireless headphones. Last 10 hours on a charge or as long as you want if you leave it plugged into the charger. Great little device. I would recommend this Bluetooth adapter. I have only had this one experience with the seller, but if this product is indicative then I would recommend them.Update: This Taotronics Bluetooth 5.0 Transmitter/Receiver is really great! The range  I can move about on my Bluetooth headphones is amazing. It's easy to use, pairs up quickly, and I've never lost connectivity. I'm ordering another one today. Highly recommend this product and seller.

I bought this to plug into a stereo receiver that doesn't have bluetooth audio out support.  I charged the device, plugged it into my receiver with a 1/4 inch adapter and paired it to my bluetooth headphones with no issue.  I thought all was going to be well until I started listening to content.  The audio drops frequently and there are a lot of clicks and pops in the sound.  I only sit about 8 feet from the TV which should be plenty close.  I have since replaced it with the "EUASOO Bluetooth 5.0 Transmitter Receiver" which looks almost identical but works like a charm.

Connectivity deserves 5 stars. I didn't try to connect it TV, since my purpose was to have Bluetooth feature for my desktop. With Mic & Out, I was able to use my Headphones for making calls. I can't tell for how long battery lasts, since I plugged USB to computer and it is always on charge. Distance is also pretty impressive. However, I felt a little white noise on connection with Desktop. Most likely, it's something with my Desktop sound card that needs to be updated.Overall impressive little adapter

I bought this for a very specific purpose.  I have an app that will not allow music to be output via Bluetooth to prevent feedback.  I used this device to trick the app and transmit via Bluetooth from the audio out jack of an IPad to a Bluetooth capable column array speaker.  I was concerned I would not be able connect because I cannot see the device I’m trying to pair to on the speaker.  This connected within literal seconds, with no issues.  I tested what I thought was a very good range down a hall and into another room with no loss of connection.  I’m sure it will not go too far, but you shouldn’t expect that type of range from a device like this anyways.  Sound quality was perfectly acceptable and I was playing it through a $1700 speaker.  I could not perceive any latency.  For the price this is a handy little device.  Especially since it transmits or receives.  Thanks for helping me solve a problem.
**READ THIS FIRST**If you plan to use this device for music listening ONLY, then go ahead and purchase.

This device was purchased to wirelessly connect a set of Bluetooth stereo headphones to an AV Receiver with an integral headphone jack. Attaching the device to the AV Receiver's headphone jack and setting it to Tx (transmitter) mode effortlessly pairs the Bluetooth headphones, which now directs all audio directly to the stereo headphone set. What's more, the stereo sound quality is crystal clear with no detectable latency (delay), which is very useful when watching a movie or TV show. Lastly, the Bluetooth range while retaining superb audio quality is about 38 feet in my environment.

Just got this....Plugged into audio out jack in older TV in bedroom. Paired it with new blue tooth headphones I also just got, and voila!  Works great. Sounds a lot better with noise canceling on. I went downstairs to kitchen and still could hear TV nice & clear, and kitchen is on opposite end of small house.  I'm sure I figure out lots more ways to use this little device. And by little I mean 1 3/4" by 1 1/4". Plugged it into my little MP3 player and paired it with headphones. Sounds great!

I got this to use my bluetooth headphone with my television.  When my wife is asleep I can watch a fully loaded action movie with no strings attached.  I was very impressed with how easily it connected to the tv and to my bluetooth devices.  I was totally shocked when i pressed the button, turned on my headphones and the movie intro came streaming out!  It's also great for gaming with no strings attached.  (Provided you have bluetooth headphones).  I have yet to scratch the surface of what all I can do with it.  Not to mention it has a simple switch to change it over to a receiver.  It's a genius design and well built.  Love it.

This product connected to my ipod classic and brought the music I had there to my earbuds. I began hearing music from a playlist not on the ipod; don't try the initial setup near your cellphone or it will intercept the phone music and not the ipod collection. It was a bit stubborn at first, but after a few tries connected beautifully. It is about the size of a pack of matches, attaches via a cable into the ipod earphone connection, and gives pure fidelity to the music.Also, be sure to use the TX setting and not the RX one to connect with earphones. Great product, pricey, very good quality.

Love the fact I can now connect earbuds to watch my new Samsung Smart TV. I think the directions for connecting to the tv setup could be more informative and I can’t seem to get the volume to work up or down but I can hear it. Tech support was great and got me functional in seconds but didn’t know volume was an issue.

Many great things to say about the Taotronics TX/RX. I’ve had mine for at least 4+ yrs and still working perfectly, Initially  bought it to be able to use my Bose Noise cancelling headsets during my long and back then frequent International travels. Packing them was convenient inside headphone pack and battery would go around the world easily (not exaggerating and whenever ran out of juice just connected a small charging cable next to the audio jack on the seat. Loved it but then traveling thankfully stopped. That’s when second life started.Always had a set of speakers in my covered patio that are wired directly to the family room area where I connect the speakers to my receiver. About 2 yrs ago replaced a TV for a better one inside the house and moved the older TV to the patio near the speakers. I knew something was not right because was not able to connect the TV audio to the speakers (at least without making a major mess to get any audio cable from theT to the receiver). Suddenly remembered my Taotronics Tx, simply connected the Taotronics to the Audi out of the TV and Bluetooth connect to the receiver in the family area and boahlah... now I can watch a movie in the patio with amazing sound coming from the loud speakers. The Taotronics device has been sitting outside for about 2 yrs and operates perfectly like the first day. I’m extremely impressed that has survived outside weather for so long with zero issues. To be clear it’s in a roof covered area behind the tv so it doesn’t get wet but has resisted the extremely humid Florida weather.

I am using this to listen to my XM radio through my Sena 20s helmet communcations system on my motorcycle.  The XM  Onyx is secured in a Ram mount, with this small transmitter secured to the bottom of the cradle with double sided tape.  I ran a micro USB cable to it for power.  If it rains, I merely take the radio/transmitter/cradle assembly off of the mount and stow it in a saddlebag.  It easily paired to the 20S.  Sound quality while using earbuds (plugphones) is very good.  Very pleased with it.

Mostly does what it says well. Connected my iPod shuffle quickly and painlessly to several different models of Bose Bluetooth speakers. Also works well with the Bluetooth audio in my 2019 Toyota Prius enabling me to wirelessly connect my 3G iPod. I have note been able to get it to connect with a Bluetooth dongle that has a Cambridge Silicon Radio chipset, even after updating that sources drivers. Works smoothly with the widely used Broadcom chipset. It has been working for a week now, short time I know but disconnects and reconnects without a problem.

I got this because I have to listen to audio as part of my job, and have been spoiled by wireless headphones and didn't want to be tied to my desk. My computer does not have Bluetooth.  The instructions that came with were too small for my old eyes to read, but there are several reviews that walk through pairing perfectly! **MAKE SURE YOU ARE NOT NEAR ANY OTHER BLUETOOTH DEVICES WHEN TRYING TO PAIR** I had on my Apple Watch and my iPhone next to me that prevented any pairing, but once I walked away from those it was easy. They paired easily to my MPOW headphones and work great - no delay or degradation of sound and they connect automatically when I turn on. I was able to pair with my Apple Airpods after a few failed attempts.  The biggest negative is that you only have the blinking lights to know if paired or unpaired. I did not take away any stars for that since it should have been my own common sense to know that. The battery charge lasts at least 6 hours, but I haven't used for longer. I have recommended to all my coworkers!

At first I had a really really hard time connecting this with my earphones. I started reading customer comments and saw the interference issue. I turn off the bluetooth on my phone, computer, and tablet. No problems connecting. Range is great for me. I can walk all over my house and out to the mail box and still hear. I do notice a small lag in the sound to what's on the screen. I can watch tv without disturbing the other people in the house. Everyone is happy.
The instruction sheet was very small and hard for my old eyes to read, but Installing this was easy on our Visio TV.Controls can be touchy - but are backed by color-keyed LED

We bought a pair of boze headphones... NOT CHEAP, only to be heart broken because our Sharp Smart TV... was not so smart... we kept thinking it was the head phones... it wasn't... it was the TV.  My friend recommended this after it worked for them... DO NOT HESITATE TO PURCHASE THIS DEVICE!! It literally saved the day!! I work from home and hubby could not hear the TV nor did he want to hear my convos with customers all day... this little device fired up right away and connected our headphones to the sound... AWESOME!!

UPDATE: After contacting the seller, I was sent a replacement and the replacement worked a bit better in that the connection wan't unstable. I messed with the sound settings in my projector some more and was reach audio levels that I was satisfied with.ORIGINAL REVIEW: I wanted to connect my projector to my soundbar via bluetooth and used this to do so. It works okay for what it's worth. When I was trying to pair it to the soundbar, it kept pairing with other devices that weren't the soundbar despite having it next the soundbar. After a few attempts, I was able to pair them. Two things I noticed while using it: firstly, the connection randomly becomes unstable and it reaches the point of no longer transmitting sound. Turning it off and on usually fixes the issue but it is annoying to have to do it while a couple of times while watching a movie. Secondly, and this is the bigger issue, the sound it transmits is noticeably quieter. I did a comparison where I connect to my phone via bluetooth to my soundbar first and then connected the transmitter to the soundbar and plugged it to my phone. Transmitter to soundbar to was definitely quieter than phone to soundbar. This has been an issue when I watch movies because I've had to turn up the soundbar to its max to hear the movie and even then, it's hard to hear the quiet scenes. If you don't mind these issues, it's a decent transmitter but I'll probably switch to a different one.

I bought this for the transmitter function so that is what I tested. Connected it to my PC and then via Bluetooth to my headphones. Connecting was not intuitive and I was never sure what was going on. After connecting, sound would play, but appeared to be really distorted and really quite. Overall, a bad experience with the product.

I bought a pair of these to transmit audio from my laptop to my audio system. They pair very quickly and I have had no dropouts. Really love these things and I no longer have to have a cable running across my living room floor. Great product. Battery life was a little short but I now have them plugged in to a USB charger and that is no longer a concern for me.
I use this on my iPod Classic, which doesn't have any Bluetooth capabilities, and I can listen to my tunes anywhere with my portable Bluetooth speakers. Yay!!!

After searching for a product that can make a regular TV work with Bluetooth headphones I came across this product. Simple to connect to audio output of direct TV box or auxiliary audio out on my TV. I went with audio aux output on my TV since then i was able to plug in the USB power supply directly to the TV USB port. So small easy to hide behind the TV. EASY set up and works great. The best part is some have a similar product for twice the price and size. I would certainly buy another one.
I purchased this so that I could use my wireless headphones when watching TV/Movies on an airplane.For that purpose, I paired the headphones before travel (just to make sure it worked).  It did.

This was a great option to adding a sound bar to my tv via Bluetooth. It is easy to set up but I wish the cable that comes with it was a few inches longer since the tv plugs are in the back and it is quite difficult to reach each time the device is off or disconnected. It also would help if the transmitter would not disconnect when the tv is turned off since every time I turn on the tv I have to pair it again. Other than that it works well while connected, the sound is good and no lags.

I thought I found the solution to my non-Bluetooth Samsung TV in the TaoTronics Bluetooth 5.0 Transmitter and Reciever. Hooking up the unit to my TV was a breeze and pairing it to my Charge4 speakers was very simple. Unfortunately, the latency is just unbearable. The sound quality is nice but seeing a person speak without the sound being in sync, is very distracting. I really had high hopes for this device but I will be submitting for a refund.

Mostly a terrific product the TaoTronics Bluetooth 5.0 Transmitter and Receiver, 2-in-1 Wireless 3.5mm Adapter does exactly what it says it will do. It just doesn't do so without hiccups. Literal hiccups.As a rideshare driver, I use this adapter in my car to send audio from my phone to my car's head unit. I have no issues with the sound quality. There are times I think it sounds better than a wired connection. However, I think due to the low latency I will get fairly consistent 1 or so second drops before the audio picks up again. Fortunately, the longer I'm in the car using the adapter the less often the hiccups become.

Bought this for my wife so she could watch/listen to the TV as loud as she wanted while I slept. It worked and paired with the headphones immediately. Would definitely recommend. Glad I went with this rather than the wired versions of TV headphones. I will say that every one in a while (rarely) you will hear some crackling. I live in an 1800+ sq/ft house and I walked all around upstairs and downstairs with the paired headphones and it worked great.

My wife and I like to watch TV together but I have to turn the volume up too high for her.  I tried to solve this problem using the TaoTronics Bluetooth transmitter to stream the TV audio to my Linx Quatro hearing aids via a ReSound Unite Phone Clip. Although this procedure produced good quality audio, there were two major problems. First, there was a lip-synch problem even when the TV speakers were turned off. Secondly, when my wife turned up the TV speakers to also listen to the program, I could hear a disturbing echo. Both of these problems are apparently due to a "latency" issue that is discussed in the product's instruction manual/user guide. I suggest before buying this product, contact customer service to make sure the Blue Tooth device (headphones/speaker) you are using is actually compatible with the product's "low-latency" properties. None of my blue tooth headphones, nor my hearing aids were compatible, so I had to return the product. I hope my review is both a fair review of the product and helpful for other Amazon customers who may be considering buying this product for similar applications.

Bought transmitter and two TaoTronics ear bud receivers.  They worked for several months but stopped connecting recently. Since both buds went out I thought that it must be the transmitter. This was a replacement and it did not fix the problem.  Even before this total failure connecting was spotty.TaoTronics contacted me and gave me the new version of this transmitter to try.  The new transmitter worked perfectly.  I would recommend purchasing the new version of the transmitter over this one.

Works well with decent range.  I get several hours of transmitting time on a single charge.  Pairings and connections on Bluetooth can be a little confusing at times.  But overall, it works well and I often use mine in my car.  I have a hand-held police scanner that I enjoy listening to while travelling.  The speaker in the scanner is isn't the best, so using this to transmit the sound to my Bose stereo system in my car really makes a difference.  Gives it a beefy, powerful sound rather than the original tinny scanner sound.

Works great to retrofit both an old component stereo and an 2010 vintage Honda with bluetooth connectivity.  Also nice for retrofitting old headphones to provide a wireless connectivity to an old laptop driving a TV.  Can watch an action movie with higher volume than my wife could sleep with.This is the only device I've run across that can be the source or destination of a bluetooth audio stream.  I've only used it as a receiver so far.

Bluetooth 5.0 headset transmitter works great for Bluetooth headphones instead of wired headphones. I have an old amp with no Bluetooth support so this lets me use a small pair of Bluetooth headphones when working out.  Easy to setup and connects with multiple Bluetooth devices. Has a solid build feel to it and small enough to hide away if you don't want it seen.  The cables that come with it are a little short so I had to use my own. I leave it plugged in to my cable box via the USB port so its always charged.

I bought this because the Bluetooth transmitter I had would not pair with most of my devices, I was skeptical due to this experience.  This transmitter blows my last one out of the water! It was easy to install and it pair QUICKLY with ALL my headphones.  I couldn’t believe how well it worked.  The quality is great and the price is affordable.  This Transmitter is very small and portable and comes with every thing you need to make your older appliances Bluetooth ready. No regrets on this purchase.

I am buying a new bluetooth transmitter because this one no longer connects to my MPOW bluetooth headphones.  Before that happened, I noticed that the transmitter would cut sounds at low volume (maybe to save battery?).  I am sure that it is the transmitter because I tested the same audio with other configurations and found that it worked.  The battery life is mediocre, and I have resorted to a constant usb power supply.  Interference from other electronics happens very easily with this device, so I have isolated it from my computer and other wires.I like the small size and the transmit/receive functionality, but I feel like the quality is a little poor.

I have been using a competing product for years now, but that product does not have a battery like this one does, so I was always fighting with an external battery pack, which would power off because the draw was too low.  Not only does this model have that, awesomely-convenient and long-lasting internal battery, but I seems to connect and re-connect much better than the competitor brand.I am very happy with this purchase... I just wish I would have upgraded years ago!

I bought this to adapt my Zune (mp3 player) to Bluetooth technology for use with earbuds.  It has no volume control and does not respond to the earbud controls, which I suspect has more to do with the Zune than the adapter.  The Zune connects directly to the adapter via 1/8th inch cable. The volume setting of the Zune is merely passed directly to the adapter and transmitted to the earbuds via Bluetooth.  I have found that there is a loss of volume using earbuds as opposed to earphones connected directly to the Zune but not significantly.  All and all, I'm pleased with the unit.

I use this device to transmit audio from my old Dell XPS 8700 tower, which has poor built in Bluetooth capabilities.  I've used it with a few different Bluetooth headphones now and it connects seamlessly.  I've docked one star because the little 6" 3.5mm aux cord that came with the device was damaged... so I had to use a different one lying around.  I've docked another star because although you can use the device when it's charging, I get some pretty annoying feedback... so it's not really practical.  I can't comment on the battery life yet, but it would have been nice to not have to worry about it.

Bought 2, one week apart. Pairing with wireless earbuds took about 30 secs to 1 minute. Sometimes had to turn this unit off, then on and start over.Ordered 2nd one for bedroom, same issues. Then ordered another set of earbuds (slightly later model of the first pair). These paired very quickly with the bedroom unit but wouldn’t pair at all with the first bluetooth transmitter ordered. Can’t solidly blame this transmitter. Maybe not at all. Just bluetooth being bluetooth.

I needed a way to get the sound from a device that doesn't have bluetooth, to a bluetooth speaker.  It took a few minutes of pressing the buttons, despite following the directions, for it to connect, but once it did, it worked great. Does exactly what it says it would do. Highly recommended.

So far so good.  I got my first smart tv and for some reason it would not connect to wireless headphones.  I went to so many places to find something so I can watch tv with headphones I was about to give up.  I didn't want to spend a fortune on chargers and headsets etc.  So I took a chance.  Well guess what they connect to my Beats Solo 3 headphones beautifully.  It is a small size and works right in the back of the set.  I will be back if anything goes wrong but for today I love the item!

I would have really loved this product had it been more stable. It's small, and the sound through my Bose headphones was very good. I was able to pair it with two headsets, and they worked simultaneously, which was great for watching movies with another person without disturbing the rest of the household.Unfortunately, one of the headsets would always randomly un-pair while being used (the other would stay on). Sometimes it came back on automatically after a few minutes, sometimes we had to turn everything off and re-pair, and sometimes nothing helped.

The unit is small and inconspicuous which is nice. I required an adapter to connect from my optical output to the Tao unit, but not a big deal. The working distance is nice because my girl uses her Bluetooth headphones at night (while in bed so I can sleep while she watches TV). The only reason I do not give it 5-stars is the process of getting connected- it was less than ideal. It took me a a number of tries to get it to connect, but since pairing the unit with the headphones there have been no issues. No issues dropping or un-pairing. Overall great value.

Didn't notice any lag in the brief time I used it and setup took less than 30 seconds! Purchased this so my mother-in-law could use Bluetooth headphones with her TV. She doesn't have cable internet so options are limited. This fits the ticket! Paired with some brand new RCA Bluetooth headphones in ten seconds. Crazy easy to set up! It works while charging and would allow you to use Bluetooth headphones with your Nintendo Switch or anything else that posseses an audio jack.

Paired with 2 BT buds, LG HBS-780 and a Vtin Swan QY8, both work great.  Bought the TaoTronics Bluetooth Transmitter for use on planes based on reviews, will be flying soon and will update this review.Update...

UPDATE2: TaoTronics will go the distance to make sure you're happy with your purchase. No joke.UPDATE1: The company's PR team saw my poor experience with the product and offered to replace it with a different model. It's because of this atypically awesome customer service, that I'm raising this to a 3/5 star review, and will report in after the new model gets here.

Out the box, on charge, minimal effort to pair in both transmit and receive mode and working like a champ. That's how it should be but often is not. In this case the product and the seller were first class. I suddenly am able to give a new lease of life to old gadgets. I'm looking forward to a wireless connection on my next international flight. No more tether to the seat! Since it can be used while charging, it will be connected to the airplane USB to ensure my 16 hour flight is made easier.
I hooked this up to my tv for my Bluetooth headphone. Didn’t work at all as described. Works fine for a car that doesn’t have Bluetooth capability.UPDATE****

The device itself works as advertised. The sound quality with my AirPods is actually worse then my knockoff ones. I had to turn the volume on the AirPods all the way up to hear it well.  The pairing process itself isn’t bad. Connect the Bluetooth transmitter to your iPod or MP3 player, then power on the device, it will flash blue and red. Ensure it’s set to transmit or TX on the Bluetooth transmitter. For the AirPods you have to hold down the small white button on the back of the AirPod case while the lid is open.
