Keep the AirPods in the case next to the transmitter during the pairing process until the transmitter shows solid blue light. This means the device is connected to the AirPods and you’re ready to go!The knockoff headphones I just pulled out of the case and held down the buttons on the side of the headphones, they paired quite easily. And the sound quality is better, funnily enough.

**EDIT** They sent me a new one, and it is working great so far.  Great customer support!  Hopefully this one will last longer, I will update the review if there are any other issues, but right now I am very pleased with it!When I first got this, I LOVED it!!  It was a little difficult to set up if you had a couple of bluetooth devices (I had to turn the bluetooth on my phone off to get my ear buds synced), but it worked great.  Then after aabout 1 1 /2 months the volume on them went to practically '0'.  I plugged it into the same TV that I always used, and synced up the same earbuds, and I would have to turn the volume up to 100%, and I could barely hear anything.  So now, it is useless.

I got this to use with an iPod Classic. but it also works with my Roku Express. I have a HDMI to RCA (red and white audio and yellow for video) converter box to separate the audio from the video. So I can plug the RCA Red and White audio connectors into a RCA to 3.5 mm Headphone jack cable. Then I can plug this bluetooth thing in and put it in transmit mode and pair my bluetooth headphone. Not the greatest setup for HD video quality content because of the analog RCA signal, but it works. The audio sound decent with RCA, but definitely not for audiophile. What is nice about this is the fact it came with a 3.5mm Female to 2 RCA Male Cable. It also works great with making 3.5 mm apple earbuds into bluetooth headphones.

Super easy setup on older home sound system via Bluetooth and our smartphones apps and internet connections! We have our old stereo system for our outside sound system however living a fare distance from Chicago it was hard to draw in the great radio stations but our WIFI is great. So we hooked up this little device and paired it with our smartphones Bluetooth and now can connect via WiFi to any of our content we have available like Pandora of Amazon Prime music or radio from around the world, all without an antenna.

Charge the bluetooth TX/RX, set it to TX then just plug into 3.5mm earphone jack.I purchased this to transmit bluetooth from my CD/DVD player (which didn't have bluetooth) to an external bluetooth speaker. Works Great! Can also be used to receive bluetooth by switching to RX but I haven't tried it in that mode yet. This has a very small footprint so packs away easily, I just keep mine with my DVD player which has a small equip. pouch in the case.

Bluetooth transmit range is advertised as 33 feet but I can only get a maximum of 15 feet from the device before audio clips and Bluetooth disconnects. I’ve used my Bose noise cancelling headphones with the device to transmit music from my iPhone 11 while doing yard work so I don’t have to carry the phone with me.Also, indoors the range is much worse between rooms. I live in a 960 sq ft home and cannot transmit to the speakers from my living room to bathroom. Even without obstacles between phone and device the audio will start to clip and die around 10 feet away.

I used this to connect my high-quality Bose  Quiet Comfort Q35 bluetooth headphones to my high-quality Denon home receiver. It was easy to set up and easily provide the bluetooth connectivity. However, I was extremely disappointed with the sound quality, which didn't even come remotely close to the sound quality when I connect the same devices with a phono cord.

I didn’t know these things existed until I played an open mic session on Labor Day weekend (I’m a keyboard player and singer). The host connected his iPhone to the mixing board to play some music during a break. I asked if the board was Bluetooth enabled. He said no & showed me this little gadget - A TaoTronics Bluetooth transceiver - & told me that with two of them, he could pretty much Bluetooth enable anything!  I now have four of them - one in my car, which allows me to Bluetooth my phone into the car’s sound system - one to Bluetooth my Amazon Echo Dot into my downstairs sound system - and two to connect my digital recorder into my mixer. These things are grea! For $29.95, I highly  recommend them.

Extremely easy to use in both pairing and use. It functions better than I hoped. The only thing I notice while watching movies or TV shows, is that during really quiet scenes with no dialog it seems to cut out sound. During a dramatic scene you can hear the background music (usually violins) cut in and out. It might be due to the fact that I listen at very low volumes and it just doesn't detect the signal, but since it's only during quiet moments and there isn't much to hear anyway I don't care much.

I purchased this so I could connect my bluetooth Bose headphones with the little video systems you find on airplanes, on the back of the seat in front of you. worked completely perfectly. I used my Bose app to connect my headphones with this product on "transmit" mode, and then it is was easy and automatic from there. My travel buddy from now on

I live in a family of five software engineers and programmers and none of them can get it to work consistently. It will work for a little while and then it will stop working. Somebody will come in and adjust it to make sure it’s charged and everything and it works for maybe an evening and then the  next day it doesn’t work. Very frustrating.The company reached out to me because of my review. They send me an upgraded unit that is wonderful. I appreciate the service. It seems like customer service is important to them. I would purchase from them again in the future.

Bought headphones to allow television watching without disturbing anyone else--but the TV is not Bluetooth!  Enter the knight in shining armor.  Just plug the transmitter into the audio output jacks, put your Bluetooth headset (or whatever you want to use) to sync mode, then turn on the transmitter, and press the power button a second time and the transmitter goes into sync mode.  My wife and I each have a headset and the transmitter is synced with both!  In addition, since it is battery powered, I plugged the USB cable into our DVR and the device is always ready to go!  Love this product.  Even if we're both watching the same show, it allows us to adjust the volume for our own ease of hearing.  The sound is phenomenal!

Using it mostly in RX mode. I have need to use it over distance so I can't say much about usable range. Pros: - works well - pairs easily and stays connected - good sound - latency is conveniently low (didn't try it with sync'ed video though) Cons: - Seems that it doesn't have an auto off feature when not paired for a long time. So leaving it on usually means finding it drained next time you need it. - To make things worse, low-battery is indicated by a very intrusive and frequent interruption of audio by an alert tone. This makes it practically unusable as soon as the battery is low even if it still has some life in it. - Operation of the power button and status LED (single blue/red) isn't intuitive at all, I can't seem to memorize it.

Works great, sound quality is nice, no noticeable lag, very easy to pair even with headphones that also only have a 1 button interface.  I did knock off 1 star because of the ground loop issue.  I planned on installing this on the backside of a TV to broadcast the audio to my speakers.  I wanted to plug the usb charger cable into the usb service port on the TV so I would never have to worry about battery life however that creates a ground loop which results in a high pitched noise coming through with the audio.  Tested the same setup with my laptop and it had the same issue.  No problems leaving the unit plugged in to a regular wall outlet though so not a showstopper.

I bought this product to use to connect my Bluetooth headphones with my TV and it is a terrible experience due to the powersaving "feature" that TaoTronics put in the device. Whenever the device detects low volume from the TV, the Bluetooth transmitter will completely stop transmitting any sound. This means that if you're watching something that has any sort of atmospheric scenes (e.g., Crickets, wind) you won't hear any of it.I have no idea why there isn't any option to turn this feature off, or why it is even enabled when the device is currently plugged in. I suppose if all you use this for is to listen to music or anything else where there is a constant level of volume you'll be fine, but if you're using it for watching TV or movies look elsewhere.

First, let me say that depending on your other equipment - headphones, PC, mixer, soundcard, etc... - this may be a good item. However, for me it is not and that is incredibly disappointing.I'm not sure if I want to return it yet or just replace with a better option.

This thing is cheap, it does work without glitches and it’s a really good little format. Two issues though— the Indicator lights are under the button so you can’t tell what they’re indicating while you’re pushing the button. The second, and only real gripe is— poor audio quality. The DAC isn’t good resulting in a major loss of fidelity. If you like your speakers and amp, or if you consider yourself an audiophile, this device WILL be the weak link in your system.

Mainly bought it to connect the television to head phones, and it works well for that. You can connect to two devices to the unit at the same time. Have not used the receiver function,  but you can use it as a transmitter or a receiver from you phone to operate non Bluetooth speakers. Battery life is not as long as I'd hoped, but if the unit your transmitting from has a usb port you can plug the charging cord into it and it will charge the unit as your using it.

a dream to set up,  and a dream to listen to,  and superior to any other bluetooth device,  and as exceptional as the best Headphones I have ever owned - the TaoTronics ANC wireless (BH060)Update 09/12/2020 - just installed the 2nd device . . . flawless,  again . . . these amazing receivers now allow both of my pre-Bluetooth stereo system amplifiers to get and play the music sent from my computers - wirelessly . . . fantastic !!!

After my original Tao Tronics Bluetooth Transmitter failed to connect with my Bose Headphones, Iordered a replacement...since I was happy with the way it previously performed.  I wrote a less than flattering review in the Amazon comments section regarding the failure.  After receiving the

I bought this little marvel after I was gifted a headphone-jack-less phone, and couldn't use my favoured wired AKG headphones with it. The Bluetooth earphones bundled with the phone were not good. I could have upgraded them to try to match the AKGs' sound quality, but I'd have had to spend north of $100.This gizmo solved my problem, and more. Most importantly, sound quality is excellent, so I didn't have to mothball the AKGs. And the functionality is awesome. It just works. Connection, to 2 devices simultaneously, is almost instantaneous. Battery life is great (easily 8hrs+ of continuous use) and you can still use it while it's juicing up (some other devices switch off when you plug in the charger). The range is fantastic - it'll even work in the next room.

I'm using this unit to transmit from my PC sound card to my stereo on the other side of the room. This seemed like the easiest and least "messy" way to get PC audio to my amplifier, no wires needed.This unit is very small, be aware. It works well, has been flawless for the past month. Output is a little low so I have to turn up the amplifier to compensate, but this is a minor issue.

I bought this transmitter and connected it to my monitor to enable bluetooth audio transmission of my Nvidia Shield and Nintendo Switch to my Bose 500 (with Alexa built in). Boom, instant smart TV with Alexa. This Taotronics transmitter works well and rarely has a delay (a quick reset usually fixes it). There is a minor inconvenience and that is that it loses connection overnight. Not a huge deal, I just reach around the monitor, hold the button for a couple of seconds til it beeps, letting me know it's connected to the speaker. It's simple enough for my four-year-old to reconnect to watch TV in the mornings. I tried others and they didn't work or the bluetooth connectivity was too complicated. If this ever goes out on me, which I doubt, I will certainly buy another. Skip the other brands and buy this one.

Your Bluetooth Transmitter works great on most systems, but we keep asking why it has problems with others and get no answer.  We belong to Planet Fitness, which play TV programs using audio on their treadmills.  The wired headphones keep getting in the way, so we purchased your Bluetooth Transmitter to deal with this.  We have not been able to get it to work and have received no help from TaoTronics.  We would love to learn if there is something we can do to correct this or if we have purchased the wrong one.  Please give us some help!!!!

I like this company’s products and although this is a bit fidgety (BT connection and controls are hard to negotiate in a device that lacks video and has one button), once connected it was solid. The problem is that its output was too low to be used on planes as a connection to my AirPod earphones, which have no volume control of their own. Replaced with a device by the same company with independent volume controls, which I hope will work better.

the bluetooth receiving range is about 25 feet with obstructions, and that was the most important positive for me. An added bonus is that I can connect my old stereo speakers which really made me happy. The manual has clear instructions, and no broken English which makes me nervous about a product. The 3.5 m cord attaches to a plug and is not hard wired. I wasn't sure about that in looking at the photo. That means I can use some of the old stereo adapters and connectors that I have accumulated over the years.

I bought this to play TV audio through my Echo speaker; however, it was an extreme pain in the rear to set up, took about 10 tries. Sound was fine once I finally got it -- mouth and audio sync a little off, but not really bothersome. However, it doesn't stay paired -- next time I turned on the TV I had to go through the whole rigamarole again. Maybe it works better with other devices, but I'm sending it back. (Update: The company has sent me a replacement item with their updated version - I haven't tried it yet, but am giving them  stars now based on customer service).

The first test of this little bluetooth unit was a flight from NYC - Hong Kong, and not only did it last the entire flight (granted I wasn't listening to it the whole time, but still), but pairing was also super easy with my Sony noise canceling headphones. I was able to get them to pair on the first try, which I did not expect! Since that flight, it's been a part of my carry on and I've used it for a number of different applications, like broadcasting from a non-bluetooth TV to my Air Pods for quiet listening. It's amazing, and if I lost it I would immediately replace it.

I really like Love my new Tao Tronics Bluetooth Transmitter and receiver!  I only wish I could adjust the volume as I have it connected to my TV cable box and it b-casts at a high volume.  There is no adjustment on the box when coming out of the back red & white audio connectors.  Wish the transmisster had a volume control, as this is the only bad feature I can see.  It paired quickly to my airpods just as it was supposed to and has long range.

[Edit: Mea Culpa! I had lousy headphones. With decent headphones, it reconnects as expected]I was initially very impressed with this device. I was able to easily connect it to my TV for both audio and power. Sound reproduction was quite good with very little delay, even with a cheap pair of Bluetooth headphones.

*UPDATE*Upon return of this product, the seller quickly reached out to me to offer a replacement model. The seller was prompt in replying to emails, and quickly sent me a replacement. However, the replacement that was sent was of the higher end TT-BA09 Model. The replacement works like a charm however, so I could recommend that model. However, I must keep my current review here since I received a completely different device as a replacement.

Not super intuitive for audio noobs. I didn't really understand what TX vs RX was initially and it wasn't described in the instruction manual.After figuring out TX was for wireless headphones, I tried pairing. I was able to pair them within 30 sec or so. I connected the device to my electric piano and there is a noticeable lag even though my airpods are right beside the receiver.

I needed a Bluetooth Transmitter for my mp3 player, and this worked well and didn't take up much space.  It's compact enough and with the short cable included can usually just sit in my front shirt pocket with my mp3 player.  The battery seems to hold up pretty well, I use it infrequently so it's nice that I can use it off-and-on for about 2 weeks.  So far the pairing has worked well too, even in crowded airports where there could be other nearby devices I haven't had issues with it pairing the wrong device.  Range is pretty good too, I can have it in one corner of my basement and go to the opposite corner a floor up in my home and still have perfect connection.Two side-notes, if the previously pair device is not currently enabled when the transmitter is powered on then it will automatically skip to pairing mode, pairing is pretty quick though on both this and my headset so it's not an issue (maybe 3 seconds or so once both devices are in pairing mode).  This doesn't have a volume control, but that would have been an extra hassle as most times you would already have that on the main device, and in some cases the paired speakers/headphones as well.

One of my biggest gripes with phones is how you can't receive AM radio signal (or FM in some cases)... which is a problem because I love to listen to baseball games. Sure, you could install a radio app but most sports games aren't broadcasted on them and you need a good, old fashioned radio to listen. Connecting this transmitter to a pocket radio works like a charm and I can finally listen to live baseball games on my bluetooth earbuds without using my phone's data.Getting a device connected is a little tricky but the connection is pretty solid (only a few momentary dropouts) once your bluetooth device is connected. Definitely need to read the manuals for how to operate the transmitter/receiver as it's not super intuitive.

I use this Bluetooth transmitter to connect my TaoTronics Hybrid Active Noise Cancelling Headphones to my television so I can watch TV without bothering my wife.  This little unit works perfectly and provides a clear, strong signal to my headphones.  I like the fact that I can use them for other electronics that have a headphone jack.  This unit pairs perfectly with my headphones and does exactly what I ask of them.  I can recommend.

Product works fine as a transmitter, especially on battery, but the issue is when you plug in the micro usb charging cable into the same computer to charge while you're listening. They didn't do enough signal insulation, if any, so you can hear buzzing all the time from the power charging. Sometimes, there's even a high pitched squeal that goes for as long as another signal or wire is too close to the device.Bluetooth takes several seconds to fully establish the sound transmission, but that might just be because bluetooth kinda sucks. Know that if you turn off your headphones and leave this device running, some other device will pair with this thing if it's nearby.

So, i'm a night owl and stay up late watching tv in the living room, so that I don't interrupt my husbands sleep as he goes to work very early.  This usually ends with me falling asleep on the couch.  Well, he surprised me with this gadget so that I could start sleeping in the bed with him using my Bose headphones!  Once he connected it to our TV my speakers synced up with no problem at all and, the frequency is so strong that it picks up the speaker in my living room as well :) Great gadget to have!
Used this handy gizmo to make an Inficon Whisper ultrasonic leak detector wireless.Paired it with a bluetooth headphone pretty easily. Have it attached to the detector with a bit of velcro tape.

I run my music, TV, video games and Internet video/sound through my Sony surround sound bar. Unfortunately, connecting my premium headphones to the sound bar was not an option since it did not have a built in Bluetooth transmitter. My wife has been on me to get rid of the cord I have been using to listen through my headphones when I needed to listen at low volume. I have been putting it off but finally decided find a better solution. This works perfectly. Not only am I able to connect via Bluetooth but the quality and range are excellent and I don’t have any sync issues. Volume control worked perfectly for me and the option to pair two Bluetooth headphone receivers simultaneously clinched it for me. Wish I had known this was available sooner.

At first it wouldn’t “pair” with any of my Bluetooth devices, I shopped for another device and tried Roku after a salesperson recommendation, it didn’t “pair” and was returned. After more attempts success was achieved with this device with 3 separate BT devices. Yes, make sure you set to transmit and connected to the TV audio out. Plugged the USB to TV for power. Some TV’s may not be compatible.Also, I have a surround sound system (SSS) connected to my TV and had to unplug SSS to plug in this device, so I tried attaching this device and SSS with a “splutter”, this device wouldn’t work since it didn’t receive a strong enough signal even if SSS was not turned on. This may not apply to all TV/SSS but it did in my case.

The initial unit receivced had reception issue which cause signal drop within 20ft distance.  Upon working with customer serivce, it was dertermined to be a faulty unit and a replacement was received promplty.  I have owned a few Taotronic products (BT adapter, LED lamp, BT headset etc.) and the build quality is top tier so my surprise this one was an exception.There are two main criteria I look closely to when choosing a reputable brand, 1) quality of the products and 2) post sale support and they own both courts both my expectation and requirement were met.  I have to say I will gradually become a loyal customer to the brand simply with those traits mentioned above .  The CS rep comunicates effectivley with my issue and more importantly is empathetic towards them.

I returned this it. I bought it so that I could use my Bluetooth headphones with my tv. No matter what headphones I tried the sound would not sink up with the people’s mouths moving. There was a very significant lag. I ended up buying a Bluetooth compatible tv. I wouldn’t not recommend this product.

Amazing! I used this on a plane so I can use my Sony WF-1000XM3 wireless ear buds and it work flawless! The sound quality was awesome and there was NO delay. So happy I bought this. I was sitting in row 2 and had flawless sound in the bathroom!

I found that if a sound is too low, like the quiet rustling of leaves or just ambient background noise, the transmitter just won't send it. I'll be watching a video and a quiet part comes and you can hear the audio just completely cut out until something louder comes around. I've essentially had to turn up my main volume so that even quiet sounds get transmitted but that's not always workable. I don't know if this is a common problem with these sorts of transmitters but it is with this one at least. Other than that it works well.

I love these. I use this to pair 2 headphones to the tv so I don't have to hear Paw Patrol for my 2 toddlers. They have minimal lag and they make it possible for one to go downstairs and still hear when they are going potty. They do need to be paired each time. They do reconnect automatically if they get out of range temporarily. It starts on when plugged in to charge. I keep it plugged into the tv at all times using the USB built-in-port. I have not used this as a receiver.

Update: Tao Tronics Customer service contacted me and provided me with an updated replacement unit which is working great. Excellent work on their part and I've upgraded the review to 4 stars because of the extra effort!*Worked great for less than a month, never had to touch the thing but now it just gives me a red light for 30 seconds. Not sure what happened but this is just a useless piece old electronic clutter now...

I got this to be able to watch TV at night when my wife is sleeping. It does work, but the audio has noticeable delay, probably around a quarter second (it doesnt sound like much but it is very noticeable). Additionally I failed to check what my bedroom tv audio output has available, thats on me, it is purely digital out. This review does not take that into consideration.Tested it on living room tv with a tv show, audio delay. Tested it on pc, delay + intermittent strange noises coming through my headphones. And if you are wondering, I am using Bose QuietComfort headphones.

I bought this product in order to turn my TV into a Bluetooth transmitting device as I have an older style receiver and loudspeakers that I wanted the TV to play out of but I didn't want the receiver and speakers to be physically attached to the TV.  Therefore, I purchased this device to create a bluetooth connection and it was successful!  The only thing I noticed was that if you plug the device into your TV's USB port in order to ensure that it never runs out of battery life you may notice a faint constant buzz coming from your speakers.  Therefore, I just plugged into another device and that solved the problem.  I assume that it was picking up some sort of internal feedback from the TV when plugged into the TV's USB port and then transmitted it to the Bluetooth speakers.  Overall, I am happy with my purchase.  It is also nice that it is dual functioning (transmitting/receiving).

it took about 30 seconds to pair my headphones. I opened my browser and started Pandora. plugged the transmitter in to my PC and power it on. Powered the headphones and started its pairing process, then double tapped the power button on the transmitter and put my headphone about a 12 inches away from it. 30 seconds later they paired. Range is a little bit further than my LG G8. It is 7/24/2020 we'll see how long this lasts

This adapter works well, and provides a good signal to connect to. I have used it to connect things that weren't Bluetooth enabled, and all of them work with this adapter. You should know that since this is Bluetooth, the connection has a fraction of a second lag like any other Bluetooth system, so if you are using it to run speakers for a video (like I wanted to do), you will have to sync the audio and video. Other than that, this is an excellent way to get your systems connected!

Sound quality is great, connectivity is easy, price is right so I’ll give 5 stars. However, my intention for this product was to transmit sound from my amplifier to Bluetooth headphones while playing bass guitar. While the latency is low, it’s too much for playing an instrument. About .5 second delay between plucking the string and hearing in the headphones. Great device for casual music listening though I’m sure.

Super easy setup, range is impressive.  I have one in each car, and one connected to my ancient (1990) receiver.  Sound quality is super across the board.  I love all the connectors (RCA and 3.5mm) it comes work and the multifunctionality.

This little transmitter works just as I wanted it to. I take a lot of long haul International flights, and I was looking for the ability to use my Bluetooth headphones wirelessly with the inflight entertainment system.This is exactly what I was looking for. It’s small and easy to keep charged on a 17 hour flight with a short usb cable. (Without the usb it stays charged for a few hours of use, not sure the exact time)

I have a smart TV installed on my wall and I wanted to keep my set up clean by hiding/minimizing the cables and wires attached to it. The sound of my TV was not the best and it does not have bluetooth connectivity and I have a 200 watts bluetooth speaker. This BT transmitter works great in connecting my TV to my BT speaker. The sound is great and there is no noticeable lag.  However, I do have to position my speaker just below my TV to get the best sound. Other than that it works as good as I expected.

This is the solution I needed to enable listening to the TV using my Bluetooth headphones. When everyone is asleep and I want to watch TV, I didn't want to use my corded headphones. This is simple to connect to the stereo and so simple for my Bluetooth headphones to connect. Up and running under five or three minutes.The sound quality is excellent and lossless as far as I can tell. And there is NO LAG--a definite plus.

So I can't really rate on anything just yet. I am just super excited because I was worried my cheap little Ematic speakers wouldn't work with this, but it did! I got 2 speakers cause I was told they would connect together, they didn't.  And since this device said the speakers had to have a certain feature for this to work, the speakers had no mention of the said feature, I just had to try and find out for myself... Only frustrating thing for me was that the instructions left out one small part when pairing the 2 speakers together, after turning on the other device to pair again you have to push the button once on the Tronics device. It just said if you turned the device back on it would automatically start searching and connect, it didn't. It was by accident that I found this small step out, and saved me the time/effort of returning the device. The sound quality was great, depending on your device that you are playing from, and both devices do play at the same time. May come back to update information.

We bought this for our trip out West to use in our Motorhome while traveling so we didn't have to have the TV blaring. At first we had a little issue trying to get it to sync after successfully syncing it when we first got it, but once we had it synced it worked great. We kept the device plugged while we used it to avoid letting the battery run down and then trying to sync all over again. The range on this thing was great the kids could watch their movies with the Bluetooth speaker anywhere on the RV without any interruption in connection. Great product so glad it worked as expected.

It works as expected. I was able to hook this up to our projector to two separate bluetooth headsets. This setup took me about an hour and watching the training videos. I advise you to make sure all bluetooth equipment is turned off because when pairing the transmitter, it can connect to any BT headphone or speaker left on. That’s why it took me an hour b/c the TX was connecting to mu garage BT speaker over and over hahahaha.

Did have some issues with this product, though customer service reached out n' helped. ^-^It'll work well as a middle ground between a Oculus Quest and a Bluetooth Reciever(Line-in port) to a PC, though be mindful of the Low Frequency you'll need to have the Quest volume fairly high to pick up everything. Other than that there might be a lil' bit of a interference buzz with subtle noises.

During these days of lockdown, my wife brought up the fact that some friends had headphones hat connected to their televisions and couldn’t I do the same (hint - hint). I already had a set of Bluetooth headphones so I researched how to connect it to our recent model Sony (with Bluetooth) but couldn’t get them to pair. I ordered these based on their ratings and advertised low latency and ability to charge while using. Amazon shipped them quickly and they work as advertised. I can watch my Prime programs like Jack Ryan and Bosch without disturbing my wife. Happy wife - happy life.

I use this bluetooth transmitter to connect to my guitar practice amp. I connect it to my phone, and run my learning app or metronome app through the amp while practicing. When I am not playing, I use it in my amp to stream music from my phone. Works great by the pool. I also connect it to my aux input on my house stereo, and allow guests to connect to it, to play their own music. The battery life is good, it is versatile, and over all this has been a good purchase.

The ability to transmit and receive two signals was huge for me. The ability to put it in the receive mode or transmit mode gave me options. I used this product to allow my wife and me to treadmill and put the sound right where we were. Great battery and it just works. Had no problem pairing at all, worked right out of the box within seconds. Read the instructions though in order to get it right the first time! ToaTronics, thanks for a good Bluetooth product.

Took a few tries to connect but once it connected it was fine. I purchased this to listen to TV via headphones while working out.Instructions weren't 100% clear as I kinda had to figure it out my self. I really didn't know what TX or RX mode was but assumed it was receive and transmit. I plugged the jack directly into my cable box and eventually got it.

I tried this unit after using the APEX unit for a long time.  The TaoTronics has higher volume and sound quality than the APEX.  However, the APEX has a volume control on the unit, and other buttons to advance songs and pause.  The TaoTronics only has a pause button.  The APEX also has a convenient clip to attach the unit to a seat belt or shirt/jacket.  I actually prefer the TaoTronics unit because of the great sound quality.

This was easy to pair with my outdoor speakers for an outdoor movie night on my projector. You can connect two devices to it, but it did take me a minute to get both of them to connect. With my projector, I ended up only using one device though, as there was a lag on one speaker (but I believe that was due to the speaker, not this). I did end up returning as I realized I needed to upgrade to the one that allows further distance since we are using it outdoors. I do wish it had a volume control option.

Excellent little transmitter!Works well with AirPod Pro, just have to remember to turn off Bluetooth on phone before pairing with transmitter. Also, since we have surround sound, we just connected the transmitter to the headphone jack to have Bluetooth on the receiver.  Using a headphone jack adaptor on our Pioneer receiver, we could then connect the 35mm jack that comes with the TaoTronics and adjust the volume on the AirPod Pro accordingly.

I used this on my work laptop so I could connect my ear pods to it.  Unit sets up pretty easily and sound quality and range are good enough (not superb) but one frustration is if you walk out of range and lose the signal it does not simply pick back up, you need to go back through the pairing process.  It is very small and the USB charger with the 5MM earphone jack makes it very convenient to plug both in and always have power (shown in photo).

I will keep it “short and simple”; if you have any problems with your device contact Tao and I assure you will receive great service such as myself.  I purchased a Bluetooth transmitter/receiver to hook my television up to use with wireless headphones.  When I set everything up the first time, no problems.  The next time I used the same hook up method I had problems getting the device to work.I contacted the company, was sent a new device which I received in two short days.  The new device was a breeze to set up, just like the faulty one previous.  As a matter of fact, it took less then five minutes to hook up.  And works fantastic!

Have purchased several of these devices to add Bluetooth capability to sound bars and speaker systems.  Great capability in a small package at a reasonable price.  The device is straight-forward to connect and pair.  Sound quality is good in that it appears to transmit or receive on par with the source.  Battery life is acceptable initially but battery is not user replaceable so tends to degrade to being a strictly USB-powered device after a year or so.

Initially I was skeptical if I could connect two wireless headphones to the TaoTronics Transmitter. The reason was that neither this transimtter nor my headphones have any screen to let me choose which device to connect to (unlike my iPhone). However, I just simply followed the instructions, and one by one my two headphones became connected. It allowed my two kids to watch the same movies on my iPad during my recent flights.

Nice compact Bluetooth transmitter.  Was surprise at its size, it's about 1/3 of the size of a pack of gum.  It comes with both RCA and 3.5mm cable, as well as the USB charging cable.  I'm using it to watch Netflix and etc with S.O. during flight and at home, its size again it's a major plus, allowing us to carry it everywhere.  Ability to charging and using it simultaneously is handy especially with a portable charger.However, minus one star because sometimes it takes a while to pair new headsets, in occasion more than a few tries.

I love this item I bought two very high-end televisions unfortunately it wasn’t until next model year that Bluetooth was offered an attempt not to offend my neighbors I purchased this unit I found the instructions to install them vague however a two minute YouTube video did the trick. I bought three units however if you have more than one television and wish to use your headphones with it or any other non-Bluetooth device you really only need one with extra cables because it’s that easy to bring from one TV to the other

I am using this as a receiver for some noise-muffling headphones that I wear while using my power equipment. The battery lasts a while but not really a long as I would like. It seems to pair easily. I had tried to use it with a musical instrument as a transmitter to a bluetooth speaker system, but the latency/ delay between the two was just unworkable. I am not saying it is the fault of this device. I got a conventional wireless instrument set up for that and it works well.

I bought this product to use at the gym to attach non bluetooth tv screens to my bluetooth compatible hearing aides. It worked great and I was very happy with it for slightly over a month (until after the window to return it to Amazon expired). Since then, I have never been able to make a bluetooth connection with it. I have thought about buying another one, but I am concerned that it would also have the same problem and lose its bluetooth connectivity.After I wrote the above review, I was contacted by their customer support team. They quickly sent me an upgraded replacement product, which works perfectly. In addition, for the inconvenience of finding a defect in the original product, they sent a high quality bluetooth headset that can be used with my hearing aides.

It was a little confusing to get it started with the manual not really providing much help but after I figured it out it works great.I didn't notice any delay when I used it for my windows PC, and it can also be used off a battery charge, although the battery life isn't the best, it works just as well. But what I will say is that it is very very susceptible to bluetooth interference; interference could mean audio cutting out, low buzzing or hums, etc.
If you try to use it while it's plugged in to charge then there is a loud feedback/buzzing noise that is unbearable. Fortunately it has a pretty long battery life though.***update 2/16/19***

This was my first experience with Bluetooth and the price was such that I had very little to lose.  Charged it up and connected it via a headphone jack converter and connected it to a DOSS speaker/receiver.  The sound good, but not as full as expected.  However, it will work well to meet my needs.  I think the biggest problem I experienced was not with this item, but was with the poor signal from my classical music station.

This has worked super well with various pairs of headphones. I use it to listen to music on computers that don't have Bluetooth so that I can spare my phone battery, and I've used it to pair with speakers in the past as well. There is a high pitched whine as it approaches a full charge if I am using it with Bluetooth at the same time, presumably due to some interference in the sensitive transmit circuit, but for the price and ease of use I can live with not charging and using at the same time. Plus, the latency is unnoticeable (in my experience).

I just received the transmitter yesterday and I have yet to try it out more intensely, but so far the transmitter does what it promises. Unfortunately, I bought it for my piano to have a wireless connection, but the latency of my headphones is so big that it is unusable. I have yet to try out headphones with apt X LL to have a reference of what latency is possible with this transmitter. I will be using it for travel! Finally watching movies together with my girlfriend on the iPad without having to conform into apple realm.

Pairing two headphones may sound like a good idea, but it doesn't sound great, and you may accidentally connect to a nearby speaker.The device always seems to be searching for a second Bluetooth device, you cannot lock the device from pairing. One headphone sounds great, but there is no way to prevent accidental pairing. When two headphones are connected, the sync doesn't stick. It is best to connect the two headphones at the same time.

Receives bluetooth, i.e.; from your iPhone and you can play music from your phone to say a non-blue tooth device such as your surround sound system via the jacks in back of it.  However, it will not transmit music from a non-blue tooth device that it's plugged into to a bluetooth receiver such as a bluetooth speaker.  I even called their Customer Service and they said it would that the one I had must be defective so they would send me another.  They did, nothing different.  My biggest guess it something was "lost in translation".

Product worked great the one and only time I’ve ever used it.  I let the battery drain 100 %, the darn thing wouldn’t connect to my phone it was frozen.  So like I said I let the battery drain for a couple months.  So I put it on the charger last night and I’ll be darn it won’t do anything now.  The idea of the device is great and worked really well the first time I bought it.  But hasn’t done anything now.  So buyer beware find a better product.  Now if they would refund me I would be happy to update my post

I use it to receive audio from my non-bluetooth AV receiver. It works great. Once paired with my headphones I just turn on the headphones and it connects and I'm all set. One time pairing is all it needs. Works perfectly every time and with a rechargeable battery I just plug it in when I go to bed and it's ready the next morning.My wife goes to bed before I do and with this device I can listen to my hearts content and not disturb her..

My Silverado truck is old enough that builtin bluetooth only works for phone calls not media.  I was perfectly content with my android phone and a 1/8" audio cable for playing media from my phone while driving.  Work forced me to upgrade to an iPhone that does not have a headphone jack.What should I do?  Drop $40K+ for a new truck with newer bluetooth capability that can play media or drop $30 for a device that lets me keep my beloved truck for another couple of years?  Hmmm...

I spent 30 minutes trying every Bluetooth device in my house and could never pair with this device.I thought - well maybe something is interfering, so I turned off everything I could that might be bluetooth, yet it would never connect. I thought this might be a great little device to free up from headphones on Yeti mic. But I guess I will never know as this device won't connect no matter what I try.

I bought this to use as a transmitter between my bass amp and headphones.  But the delay was about a second behind the input.  So every time I hit a note there would be a second lag before I heard it.  Not usable for my purpose.  Otherwise quality seems decent.  Would probably work fine if you are just listening passively to music.UPDATE: 3/13/2019 - The seller contacted me and went above & beyond to fix the problem.  I 100% recommend the seller (and the product).  Seems like I just got a bad one.

This is a really cool little gadget. It is a niche technology since most everything already has bluetooth nowadays, but it works great. I needed to connect my tv to my stereo and direct wiring it was going to be a pain. However by using this I could take the audio from the TV and send it to my stereo via Bluetooth and it worked perfectly. Easy to use, ease to setup, and sounds great.

My wife an I have a 4 month old daughter, and when she sleeps at night, we didn't have an option to put 2 headphones to watch TV. I purchased this bluetooth transmitter with 2 Mpow H7 Bluetooth headsets. Quality is amazing and no latency at all!! I highly recommend it!!! Setup is easy. Just pair the first headset, turn it off, then pair the second headset and finally turn the first headset to connect. A++

My Vizio TV does not have bluetooth connectivity.  I use the Taotronics device for wireless earphones because I do not want to disturb my upstairs neighbor after 11pm.  Set up pretty easy.  Teeny tiny print on instructions require magnifying glass.  lol.

I purchased these headphones to use while my newborn slept in my living room. She was very sensitive to sounds as she had come home from the hospital at 4mos old (since she was born prematurely) and wasn't adjusted to the sounds of a tv. Thus, they synced seamlessly with my headphones (although sometimes it was tricky to flip my headphones back and forth with my phone and this device). The sound quality was better than that of my tv. And thus far I haven't had any issues or glitches- 7 months later. I'd highly recommend! Or if youre in a home with a tv in the bedroom that distracts another- this would do the job as well.

Surprisingly easy to use. I cast Spotify from my phone to the main speakers, and when anyone else wants to play their music it’s fast to switch. Would be 5/5 we’re it not for the horrible beeps. In RX mode when you unpair your phone / walk away, the TaoTronics starts beeping every 10s to indicate no connection. It is very annoying & you have to walk over to turn off the device whenever you’re done. Here’s a surprise, if I’ve unpaired all audio input, it’s because I want SILENCE! Had this for months and it’s slowly driving me mad.

I want to start off telling people how stupid I am,I rece'd my transmitter very fast,when I opened it up,I thought the transmiitter was missing,contacted amazon and a new one was sent out,noticed the same thing when I rec'd the other one,what I thought was a battery for the transmitter was the transmitter,in the pictures the transmitter looks bigger and since its rechargeable,I thought the transmitter was missing,it really says something about amazon's return and the company for taking care of it,even for people like me,need to read the instructions in the future.

I was surprised at how tiny this dongle is! Took several attempts to connect my non-Bluetooth TV with my Bluetooth earbuds, but eventually I was able to successfully pair them.... The sound is good—clear and  consistent, but I wish i could make it even louder. (May be an earbuds issue.).... I did have to go into my TV sound settings to adjust the delay so what I heard matched speakers’ lips.... There are two minor glitches.  One is that I cannot have the adapter plugged in to recharge it when I am using it to transmit a Bluetooth signal.  The second is that I have to enter my TV sound settings and switch to “external speaker” when I use the adapter.  Otherwise I have both TV speaker sound and Bluetooth, which some people may actually like. These are minor issues at worst, and don’t detract from my satisfaction with the Tautronics adapter.

What I bought this for was to connect my bluetooth earbuds to my amp so I could play guitar without any wires. Yet the latency is about ~0.4 of a second off, which makes it hard to play and kind of ruined the purpose I bought this for. I tried using it with the ps4 on Netflix to see how bad the latency was on there and it was pretty bad, you have to be like less than 2 feet away from your controller/transmitter or you can see ~0.4 sec latency between audio and movement. Another major problem, which I don't know why they did this but when you listen to anything and there is a part that is very quiet the sound fades out, which is super distracting. Overall I would only recommend this product for audio only listeners as long as you like your music loud otherwise like I said it will fade out. Those are the main issues I've had so far with this device. I will not be sending it back because I'm sure I'll have a use for this sometime down the line.

Advertised as low latency but tried with a Yamaha piano and it has a 1 sec delay which makes it impossible to use.  I tried with three Bluetooth headsets including Bose QC35 II.  Apparently your headset needs some codec hardware to fix this, the transmitter won’t correct it.Great personalized customer service from Taotronics.  They contacted me to explain this issue with latency.

When using as a transmitter,  I was only able to successfully connect a bluetooth receiver to it 3 times out of several hundred attempts.  Read manual multiple times, watched youtube videos thinking that the order in which i was initiating paring etc was incorrect, all to no avail.  I'm actually really bummed it doesn't work, as the few times i was able to successfully pair with it, the audio quality was actually quite good.

Wife needed a way to connect her phone to car stereo.  This little adapter worked perfect the first time and every time since.  Paired easily with the wife's Samsung S10+ and the battery on the transmitter only needs to be charged every other week or so depending upon use.  I have also used it to send a signal from my home receiver to a Bluetooth speaker in the garage, so it works great as both receive and send.  Will likely buy another to leave on the home receiver for when I am working in the garage.  Excellent little Bluetooth receiver.

Very impressed with this little gem. So light and small, and yet covers reliably both transmitter and receiver roles in one package. Comes already charged. I hooked it up, found the device on the phone, and there it goes with clear noise-free audio! Cannot dream for anything more: sound quality is great, clear and loud, works reliably, charges quick, super light and small, comes with all ever needed audio adapters, packaged neatly, looks awesome. Will buy one more just to keep it handy for cases when I can't find my first unit, or when it breaks in the middle of something, or to lend it to somebody, etc. Good to have extra stashed and this unit allows to want to buy it again.

I use it for travel so that I can connect to the airplane headrest screen with my bluetooth headphones. For this it lasts many hours, but since many of the newer screens have a usb adjacent to the headphone jack it has infinite battery. I also use it for my patio tv to connect the tv audio to my portable bluetooth speaker. In both applications it works well in transmitter mode. Pairing is not difficult either. I think the price is a little high otherwise a good product.

I've got an older circa 2001 TV, stereo with reel to reel tape drive, several turntables, etc.  I needed to upgrade so I can listen and not disturb the household. I had accomplished this in the past by using a very good set of wired headphones. However, my hearing is significantly impaired such that I use a bone conduction set of headphones/earbuds. Plugging this transmitter/receiver into my amp using an adapter for the plug I was instantly overjoyed being able to not be tethered to a wired head phone and have good sound quality.

We like to watch football outside.  So as not to disturb the neighbors, I decided to try a bluetooth speaker sitting inbetween us rather than using the tv speakers.  This works like a champ.  Took me about a minute to connect to my Bose Pill speaker and it does exactly what I hoped!  I'm thinking with the receive function I might be able to show my pics on the TV from the Iphone??  Haven't tried it yet.

Fast, easy to use. I'm currently using it with my Samsung TV (that has no Bluetooth built in) because i did not wanted to buy some 300 dollars noise canceling headset. This little fella works like a charm. i'm giving it 2 star because it keeps connecting to all my sound bars around the house and producing the connected tv sound in all of them which is really annoying and it creeps me out every time. so until i fix this, if i can ever fix it, i rate it 2 stars.

Bought it to connect my bluetooth earbuds to airplane entertainment systems. Paired easily, works as expected. Battery lasted a full 8-hour flight. No noticeable lag.I particularly like it's design, with a flexible audio jack. Other models have a rigid male-to-male adapter that makes the device stick out a lot when plugged to an airplane armrest.

I spent 1 hour working with 2 different bluetooth devices and the ToaTronics would not pair in TX mode.  I got it to work in Rec mode for one device but not the other.  I had to play around with the single button controller to get it to pair and the method was not as described in the manual.  I got it to go into pairing only once in an hour of pressing the button with different methods.  I do not recommend this device.

After connecting this product incorrectly, I sent an email  to the seller. They responded quickly and gave me an exercise to check the product. After confirming that the device was in fact operational, I realized that I had connected it to my TV incorrectly (LOL). This product turned my NON-BLUETOOTH TV into a device that I can connect speakers too. I am absolutely happy with this purchase!!

The process for connecting new Bluetooth headphones is tedious and unreliable. Sometimes it works and sometimes it doesn’t, and you really have no control over that.Update 10/2019: TaoTronics customer service reached out to me and sent me a replacement adapter. This is a new model and not this particular one, but I updated the rating here based on their responsive customer service. The newer model works much better than this one!

This worked as simple as can be.  Charge, turn on, connect and away I went.I have every had an item be as easy as this.  Love this product hope it lasts a long time as this made easy for the new wireless headphones that I am using :-) Very happy!!!
Working Awesome! Thanks for letting me listen to my ipod Classic wherever I go!! Thank you!

Allowed me to simultaneously stream to 2 sets of airpods without any noticeable lag. I was originally concerned about potential lag since the Taotronics device uses the AptX bluetooth codec while airpods use AAC; however, this has not been an issue. Bluetooth 5 for the win! I was able to stream youtube and videos with no discernable lag between actor mouths and the speech. Sound quality is good. These will be fantastic to use when watching airplane movies so my partner and I can watch without having to worry about many sets of cables getting tangled up.

Update- Someone from the company contacted me directly to make this purchase right. One of the better experiences I've ever had dealing with customer service. The unit itself is very easy to use. Set up was a breeze and it paired my headphones in seconds. I like that it can charge directly from the tv. I would not hesitate to buy from this company or this brand again.I have no idea how it actually works. After reading the reviews I ourchased it. It came without the small plug in. How could that possibly be missed?

As soon as I received the TaoTronics Bluetooth 5.0 Transmitter and Receiver, 2-in-1 Wireless 3.5mm Adapter, I loved it. I can use either a low or high impedance headphone and the fidelity are equally enjoyable.  Plug it in, press the big button and pair with the iPhone. the iPhone recognizes the TaTaronics device within1 second. The battery life ranges from 4-6 hours. It is durable. I've had the device in my pants pocket and the device continues to function. I frequently use it on an airplane works there, too. By the way, this is the second Ta Tronics product. I gave the first one to a relative and bought a second one.

This device is so perfect for what it does. I have a Samsung tv that doesn’t run Bluetooth, and I wanted something that would let me run headphones when I’m not on my Xbox. This has been perfect for regular tv and my Nintendo Switch and the sound quality is so crisp and clear. I use Beats Solo wireless headphones, and it took me less than 30 seconds to connect to the transmitter and get the audio from the tv. The great part is that whenever I turn on my headphones, it automatically connects too! No hassle. Only rough part is that I haven’t figured out volume control if there is any, but at least the sound is at a good level. Solid buy!!

I decided to purchase this after I bought a pair of Taotronics bluetooth headphones. The headphones sound great and have been incredibly reliable. In fact, they sound as good as the Sony WH1000XM3 while also getting louder.This transmitter has also been rock solid. Never any random disconnects or audio quality issues. I use it primarily as a way to connect headphones to a TV. There is almost zero latency which I have an incredibly unfortunate sensitivity to.

Projector in the back of the room, speaker bar in the front of the room. This little device seamlessly paired with my Bluetooth speaker bar without any issues. Now it automatically connects when I turn on my projector and speaker. I haven't noticed any delay. It works perfectly, even better than I had expected.Edit: There is a slight delay. It's not bad but I notice it more when I'm watching movies than playing videogames.

Love this product.  My equipment isn't the latest and greatest.  My ipod, computer, tv don't have bluetooth.  With Taotronics I can enjoy this feature without running out and upgrading all my electronics.  The best benefit is using Taotronics receiver with my Ipod paired to bluetooth helmet speakers going down the highway on my motorcycle.  Small,compact and battery charge lasts all day.  Great product.  The only reason lacking one star is I seem to have trouble when I turn it back on.  Have to re-pair the whole set up again. but that could be me.

This worked quite well and added capability to use the newest iPod wireless earbuds on an airplane using the armrest earphone socket to watch a movie.  Only issue is the somewhat tricky timing holding the only button down various lengths to do things.  Would be better to just have another tiny button or two and not have the user guess how long to hold it.  Overall though good value and it works.  Volume control would be a nice upgrade.

In order to  avoid hissing noises I'd recommend trying another supplier. Plus, not the easiest device to hook up and start on older Lcd televisions. Biggest complaint is the very annoying background his. Update : received a replacement unit very quickly. The hissing noise nearly disapated!  Im very  happy with customer service, they have communicated with me regularly and never gave up!

This item only works half the time and was not worth the wait. It has connectivity issues from time to time and the overall quality is less than mediocre. Whilst standing in the check out line at Walmart, I found one for $8 and have had no issues if you’re looking for an alternative.Update: Despite the original product, they display amazing costumer relationship. They were very willing to make us satisfied with there product and give us a great experience. They sent us out a different product that connects Immediately and works well. Also it got to us in a quick time.

Not bad but not great, these Tao Tronics transmitter will pair up. But it’s a bit Lengthy. The unit needs to be fully charged. To pair up a device, and likey stay charging if you are using it for a T.V. Or gaming. One device at a time is all I had luck pairing. I was surprised it paired with my iPod nano 7th gen. Also my Scullcandy Uproar Bluetooth headphones. I did have to reset the headphones back to factory which was easy. Sound quality I cannot complain.

This was really difficult to pair with a Bose QC30 noise cancelling headset, but after messing with it for about 30 min I finally was successful.  Just took repeated tried - not sure what finally made it connect.  Since then, it connects with my headset every time, and I haven't had to do this initial pairing routine again.I purchased this specifically so I could watch movies on air flights and get the audio to my BOSE BT headset.  It's nice that it can charge via USB while using, but the volume is so low, compared to just plugging in some ear buds, that I finally have resorted to using regular ear buds, and not my noise cancelling headset while watching movies on flights.  I just couldn't hear the softer volume parts of the movies.  I know it's not a Bose issue in this case, as when I bluetooth from other devices, like my Samsung 9+ phone, for music or movies the volume through the headset is very loud.

Updated:  Customer service for this vendor contacted me directly via Amazon in response to my review, and offered to send a replacement unit (updated model), and then followed up with me asking if the replacement was working properly.  I have changed the review to 5 stars because the replacement unit works perfectly, and the customer service was above and beyond expectation.Original review:

I purchased this device for two reasons.  First, I wanted something that I could use in an airplane to watch movies with bluetooth headphones.  Second, I wanted my wife and I to be able to listen to the same audio at the same time.  I haven't tested this device in a plane yet, but I tried with an old Discman CD player and everything worked great.  We connected my Panasonic headphones and my wife's Jabra earbuds at the same time with no problems!  I will try these on a plane soon.  I will update this review if I have any issues. So far so good!

I was extremely happy to be able to connect my Jabra elite active 75t to my iPod nano 7th generation and older laptop models with no bluetooth 5.0 capabilities. I'm really glad that the adapter is small, thin, and lightweight so it doesn't add an baggage to whatever carry-on I have with me. The connectivity is also extremely simple and quick on both the transmitter and receiving options.

I've Bowers & Wilkins speakers - purchased years ago and hard wired to my computer.  The sound is lovely, it wasn't a cheap date to start with and the thought of replacing was making me nuts.  But I wanted my speakers bluetoothed to my iPhone, the ability to listen to music without needing my computer.Took less than 3 minutes to connect and sync.  Honestly.  Works like a dream.

I purchased the TaoTronics Bluetooth receiver to plug into my non-amplified noise dampening headphones while mowing the lawn. The device pairs easily with my iPhone and sounds great!  I had previously purchased an Esuper Bluetooth receiver but ended up returning it as the volume output was very weak. Volume output of the TaoTronics receiver is very good. Has the added bonus of an included cable with RCA jacks!  Overall, very pleased with this device!!

This Transmitter/Receiver works great in terms of connecting with my Bluetooth headphones. It connects quickly, easily, and the connection was steady and never wavered. Unfortunately, I started having issues with streaming live TV and movies, and my Roku was saying I had a poor/non-existent internet connection the past 2 days. I unplugged and restarted both my Roku and my modem/router so many times to no avail. But as soon as I unplugged and turned off the receiver, I stopped having issues. It was a waste of $30, but maybe I can find somebody else who can find some use in it, and I'll have to try and find a different receiver/transmitter that doesn't affect WiFi.

Been using it for a week now and so far so good. I'm using it to listen to my HD radio at night when my wife's asleep. Bluetooth connects every time and sounds good. Wish there was a volume control, I had to turn up the volume on my headphones to max but it's all good.

It didn’t work for me. The tv I wanted to use it on apparently doesn’t have audio output ports and no headphone port. I did try it on a different tv with a headphone port. When I did that it took a long time to pair with the wireless head phones and even adjusting the latency on the tv it never did sync up to a comfortable watching situation. A waste of my money.

I purchased this item to connect to my TV, since its air conditioner season and it would be almost impossible to hear what I'm watching without turning the TV up to max volume. So far, there have been no problems with audio and visuals being out of sync. Sound is clear, and perfect for me.Setup was a little confusing as the tiny instruction booklet doesnt make it clear which setting is best for what devices. I found that my bluetooth headphones worked best with TX. Also the red and white a/v cables weren't necessary for my TV, I just use the 35mm audio Jack connector, and plugged it right in between the adapter and the TV. To setup/connect each time you need to be within 3ft of the device, but after that you can move further away. I would say I've been about 10 ft away, with no problems.

I live in a new apartment complex, and have older ears, and was very worried about disturbing neighbors with my tv volume being too high - this transmitter paired with 4.2 earbuds is the solution. Very easy to set up. Worked great very first time I paired to earbuds.  (I did follow instructions and let it charge for 2 hrs before trying to pair it to my earbuds)Paired with soundpeats and Apple AirPods.

We used this transmitter to sync a wireless speaker to our television and put the speaker on the side table near our chairs so we could  hear better.  The video on the amazon ad was very helpful for us.  We plugged this transmitter into the tv,  with the speaker next to it, pressed the button,  and voila!  The transmitter blinks to signal that it is syncing and blinks a different color when it is done syncing.  Probably ten minutes from start to finish, including watching the video.  ( Make sure both items are charged!)
I love connecting this adapter to the airplane entertainment systems, with my sony noise-cancelling headphones.  It's nice not having to fidget with wires.

This is an End Of Life review. After a couple years of using this adapter, it went into a weird flashy mode that wouldn't turn off...and stayed that way until the battery died. It worked OK while it worked. There was too much lag for my taste, and the audio quality was average. The volume levels were OK, but probably would be best paired with an amplifier...so why not just buy a bluetooth adapter with a built in amp? 3 stars for 2 years of average use.

I use for my older TV's that do not have bluetooth capabilities. I use it in the TX mode for this application.  I like to watch TV sometimes using my bluetooth earbuds in case I'm watching something that won't disturb my husband :-0  I like this brand better than the other brand I have purchased in the past.  It seems the sound tracks better with the image on the screen.  It's a great product !!

So it works, but there is some sort of sound output issue sometimes. If the sound output is not continuous or high enough volume, the transmitter won't send any sound. Soooooo if you're watching a show with low sounds, it might not be the best. I was watching the office with these and some sounds would cut off if they were loud enough. Works great when using PH website though

i was initially stymied, but figured out how to pair this in TX mode with my BT headphones... adapter arrived in a charged condition... plugged it into my high-freqency radio transceiver, put the adapter's switch in TX... pressed for a few seconds, then tapped twice... turned on my headphones, and pairing was done in a few secondssound quality is good... don't know yet about distance or longevity - i'll be testing this adapter outdoors while sitting underneath some palm trees down here in the near Tropics

I've wanted a way to connect my iPod w/o cords to both my Ford truck & my RV radios for a long time now. Finally, I have it. Easy to connect & to start transmitting or receiving, good battery life & great sound in a lightweight, compact package. What's not to like? For me, the TaoTronics Bluetooth Transmitter & Receiver solved my problem. I get much more use out of my iPod now than before I made this purchase. Thanks, TaoTronics!

I pretty well carry this around wherever I go since purchasing it. I can quickly send music from my phone to any device - car speakers, home sound system, sound boards; or I can make non-bluetooth devices send audio to bluetooth headphones which is especially helpful late at night if I want to listen to my TV through my headphones.Connecting new devices to it can sometimes take awhile, especially when switching between Tx and Rx mode - but you get the hang of it after awhile and once it recognizes an old device it connects pretty quickly.
There is some times a very high-pitched frequency noise. Disconnecting the power source alleviates this but I prefer to keep the power source connected at all times.Update,

Well I thought I would need this to use with my mini projector and bluetooth speaker while streaming movies and shows from my laptop but turns out I don't. I could just set the speaker settings in my laptop to use bluetooth speaker. So I ended up returning this product. However it arrived on time and worked as it supposed to so no complaints about the quality of the product.

I used these to connect my video projector to some wireless speakers.  I was slightly perplexed on how to do this without having a screen to select the device to pair too.  I don't know if it was this gizmo or the speakers, but with just a bit of fiddling, they connected and the system worked like a champ.  It remembered the pairing and connected automatically after that.

I bought this for my '97 truck that had a 2002 radio with aux input in the front. I have to say it works great and connects to my phone with no problems. One thing I like best about it is it will turn off automatically if it is not connect to a phone. That way you are not losing power while not in use. Another thing is I can take my old tape cassette I had as a kid and transmit from this dongle to my current stereo in my house.
I used it only when I travel.Finally can watch a movie with wireless headphones.

I wanted to be able connect my sound bar to my outdoor projector via bluetoothT and get rid of a couple of wires. Too many times I buy something like this hoping it will work the way it's supposed to but it ends up with its own challenges and problems. It was short money so I gave it a shot. And it works great! Simple set up, easy to pair, no lag that I can see. Glad I bought it.

TaoTronics BT5.0 adapter is excellent replacement for the 3.5mm headphones jack on the smartphones. I've switched to using this transmitter because it is more convenient than using wired headphones, it can be easily placed in the pocket while i'm using the smartphone for something else.The sound quality is great, exactly the same as the wired headphone jack, and TaoTronics BT5.0 adapter is powerful enough to drive large over-the-ear headphones loudly. The battery life is excellent too, easily a full day of listening.

The product is excellent for connecting wireless speakers, was simple to install and connect and connects to my soundbar and remote speaker at the same time.  When connecting to two wireless speakers at the same time I've noticed a delay between the two.  I don't know if there's a fix for that but we just select either the soundbar or the speaker, depending on what our needs are.  I can't wait to try wireless headphones with this device..

I wanted to watch TV after everyone went to sleep.  This device paired easily with my high-end Bluetooth headphones, the controls on the headphones allow easy volume control, and the range is quite impressive, I walk into other rooms during commercials and still hear everything.  The only issue is that on a rare occasion the sound is slightly delayed, but usually stopping and starting the DVR, or changing the channel, fixes it.

I still use an ipod shuffle for running, but wanted bluetooth headphones. This connects to my shuffle and allows me to use bluetooth. I have only used it that way, but anything with a headphone jack that you wanted to transmit would work. It is easy to connect, has great battery life, and recharges quickly. It's lightweight. In short it was exactly what I wanted and works perfectly. I am very happy.

Nothing to dislike about this product.  Very simple installation - about 20 seconds and the sound from my TV to Bluetooth Headphones is better than I ever expected.  I wanted to try listening to some TV shows thru headphones because I have trouble hearing certain “tones/pitches” - mostly female tones; when I connected this transmitter/receiver the sound was so much better...so much so that I am listening 18 numbers lower in volume, plus I can walk around the house doing laundry or cooking dinner and hear every word clearly!! Sound matches exactly where there is NO delay at all. Absolutely wonderful & my friends are already asking me to send them product # so they can order!!

One of the few things in my experience that gets better a well as less costly.  Three yeaars agoI purchased versio 4.1which as  an excellent TX/RX, but this time I got version 5.0. Ifound range slightly improved and latency substantially diminished----at a lowerprice!  I paid 39.95 three years back, but only 28.00 for this one.  Highly recommended
I needed this to improve sound from my TV for a hearing-impaired family member.  This is the trick. It was easy to set up and worked the first time.  I've had it a month and still going strong.

Latency is too much when watching video. Perfect for music!I bought this so I could watch movies on the plane with my Trekx Air Bluetooth headphones but the latency (delay) is nearly .5 to 1 second behind the video. Live sports is fine but videos where you see people speaking is super distracting. I have tried this from laptop and it’s just a long of a delay so I know it’s not the airplane.

Ordered from Amazon, had the next day.  Plugged into my tv and put my headphones on bluetooth search and they were connected in seconds.  I then tried my bose speaker and they connected immediately. This product worked the way it was advertised.  Quick, easy and inexpensive way to connect your tv to headphones or speaker.  It would be nice if you could hook up two  speakers at the same time but they haven't gotten there yet.
The seller contacted me and resolved the issue  THANKS!  works fine!*original* review but *NOW RESOLVED*

I purchased this because I wanted to connect my Airpods to a recorder/microphone. For context, I create youtube videos and want to hear the sound when I record live. Using this device, my Airpods did connect to the microphone but there is too much of a lag in sound to do what I needed. This is probably what would happen with any bluetooth device.But it did connect so that's cool! I'm going to keep this and use for whenever I fly, so I can connect to the plane TV with my Airpods.

I purchased this device to plug into my TV for use with wireless headphones while running on a treadmill.  I notice a very small delay (a fraction of a second) in the audio but it is not enough to be a problem, even for fast moving action movies.  I have to concentrate on the delay to even notice it.  Pairing was simple and when I power on the device it is quickly found by the headphones.

So I bought a Sirius XM player for my truck. With it charging and playing at the same time I could hear feedback in the speakers. I bought this Bluetooth receiver/transmitter to eliminate it being plugged it. It worked PERFECTLY!!! Connected easily and didn't have any feedback. Held a charge for plenty of time. I was impressed!! Would definitely recommended it!

I have tried a few different brands of similar adapters and I keep running into the same problem. When you open and try connecting them for the first time they usually workswithout any hiccups but once they go dead and you recharge them or they somehow lose connectivity for a while it's impossible to reconnect them to anything. I've tried different speakers, different headphones with the same result. I have not used this particular one in some months now because I can't get it to connect to anything.

Affordable, good quality BT Receiver/Transmitter. I use mine in my car since it is better than the cheap receiver that comes installed. Audio is pretty clear most of the time. Sometimes the audio cuts out but this is rare and doesn't detract from the overall experience most of the time.

This product works intermittently and I believe the specific one that I have is defective.  When it worked I was very pleased because it gave my Bowers Wilkins Zeppelin new life.  I love this speaker unit and all I want to do is connect devices that are not 30 pin connectors via Bluetooth.  If this doesn't work, I'm just going to go with my original plan of an adapter for 30 pin converter.  I'll update when the replacement arrives.UPDATE: I took some more time with this product by connecting to other devices.  BOTTOM LINE IM VERY PLEASED and am enjoying the music I want to hear

Great for listening to the tv through Bluetooth headphones. I hooked up my tv to my stereo receiver via TOSlink digital optical cable.  I plugged this TaoTronics Bluetooth transmitter 3.5mm jack into my stereo headphone jack. Push and hold Tao power button 5 seconds to turn on. It flashes blue then blue red. Takes about 20 seconds to link to headphones. Works great and didn't notice any delay in watching tv.  Also hooked it up to Echo Dot because my Cowin E7 Bluetooth headphones rarely connect with Echo Dot. Bummer.  Only downside is can't use the previous next track button on anything so far. I also tried the Tao in receiver mode. I plugged my computer speakers into the Tao 3.5mm jack and linked my Fire HD 8, and it worked great too.  Like the small size. It's about the size of a digital camera battery which makes it easy to drag around the house and plug it into things.

I live in a 1bedroom, and the tv is in the living room.  I wake up early to watch the news before going to work.  I able to get watch the news and eat my breakfast without waking up my other half.  I am even able to watch youtube exercise videos, and It sounds perfect.  I connect my Bluetooth headphones and it sounds perfectly clear.  I charge this item every 2 days.  It depends on how much I use it.  I definitely recommend this item!

Had this Bluetooth Transmitter for over two years and has work perfectly.
