I wish that this Bluetooth Transmitter will automatically turn on every time I turn on the car, but instead I had to manually turn it on, so I can use it with my iPhone X. Very easy to connect, not complicated! Overall, I am very happy With Bluetooth Transmitter that if ever breaks, I will immediately buy another one probably a newer version.

The device is simple to use and effective, and the fact that it can be used both to receive bluetooth signals and send them (so it can be used to turn any speakers/headphones into bluetooth devices, or use two bluetooth devices with one compter/tv) is very useful. The device is also very compact.The only downside is that the battery doesn't last very long - just a couple of hours of use on a single charge.

• We purchased this product to connect out movie projector audio to our camper stereo and a Bluetooth Speaker. When we camp we like to have movie night outside with the kids on a 10ft screen. By getting this I was able to eliminate the audio cables and can connect via Bluetooth directly to the camper stereo outside speakers and a portable Bluetooth speaker. When I first got it I charged it for a couple of hours. So far we have watched 4 movies with it and I have not had to charge it yet. It was easy to sync to the camper stereo and works as it should. I have not noticed any latency with it and the sound seems to be right on. It's also smaller than i thought and fits in my projector case with everything else no problem.

I use this in my car and it has been working perfectly. My phone links up every time so I can jam out to Spotify to and from work. I wasn't sure what to expect for that price but I am really happy with it. Battery life seems great as long as you don't leave it on when you're not using it. It does automatically turn off eventually but I found that if I manually turn it off when I'm done, the battery seems to last forever.

For the price, it is amazing for basic sound needs. Like listening to things.  IF yoy are planning to try to use it to connect your wireless headset so you can monitor your recording or online Zoom type stuff.. too much echo delay..IF it is connected to a sound controller board..IF you hook it directly to your laptop.  Yes. Headsets have no echo. It just doesnt work to mo monitor your sound board.

When a device that is connected to this is disconnected from it, it automatically goes into pairing mode. Because of this it will sync up to any other speakers you have nearby in your home. So in my case, when I turned off my headphones the TV would start blaring in my daughter's room. It doesn't make sense to me why they would make it do this when it has a way to force start pairing mode.

This little gadget is a must have for folks on the go. When you find yourself with no items that don't receive Bluetooth, just turn it on, pair it and you're all set. The sound is clear and the battery charge lasts a good amount of time. I have a previous version of this from TaoTronics which still works great. They seem to make a reliable product.

I've been using this device for several months now, as a bluetooth transmitter to a set if headphones I have. I've found that it transmits the sound wonderfully, with no noticeable quality loss. My only complaint with the device is that there is a delay between the source and my headphones. This isn't a problem when listening to music, but makes watching videos or playing games difficult. Overall, I'd highly recommend these if you plan to use them for music, just anticipate a slight delay!

Had an old pair of Wired Radio Shack Pro 35 and every time I moved around in my cube the cable was too short.And, I kept running over the extension when I used it. This will give me a level of freedom I have not previously had at work.

I could not get this clever device to pair. I am not at all an electronics expert, more like a neophyte. I believe for this device to function that one MUST order two of these, because they do not seem to pair with other Bluetooth devices. They are a clever device and it may be my fault that I couldn't get them to pair successfully, but certainly setup was not easy.

The audio sounds great. But when It is plugged into power there is somehow interference and it creates a buzzing noise that fades in and out. I would use it for 80% of situations, but if you are looking for using it in a setup where it is constantly plugged in, I'd look for a different transmitter.Update: I have tried different transmitters and this one is still the best. I guess my expectations for audio is too high. nothing compares to just a wired connection.

All I wanted was to connect ( just like the mnf picture on Amazon shows ) a non bluetooth floor speaker to a bluetooth receiver , simple right ? Well the tiny booklet is a joke and the mnf/vendor does not answer questions on Amazon I guess. The other answers from amazon clickers made no sense dont think they even read the question. Should not be this hard ! Sending it back and looking for a better option.

Does not fully work with my Apple Airpods.  I was able to pair the Airpods but there is no sound.  I tried my Jabra Bluetooth headsets and they work great with this product.  I would have bought a second transmitter for an upcoming family vacation if it worked with my Apple Airpods.

This Bluetooth RX/TX is very small and light it can barely be seen at a distance. I have been using it for about a week and it's worked flawlessly,and very easy to connect with my Bluetooth headphones. Sound quality is good not great but that may be my headphones. The delay on some TV programs is noticable but not a deal breaker the best part is I can walk outside and in my garage and still hear stuff. 👍

Bluetooth pairing took a while to set up with my Bose wireless headphones, had to call customer service to actually get it done and even then it seemed like it only paired randomly as we’d been doing the same thing several times as per their instructions.The main problem that the devise has a latency problem that makes watching any tv infuriating. So I tried them on my turntables for doing and the same issue there makes it impossible to mix records properly.

I originally gave this transmitter 3 stars because there was a voice delay from the TV picture to the sound through the Bluetooth earphones that was annoying. I had the transmitter plugged directly into the TV. However, in looking through other reviews, plugging it directly into the cable box solved the issue. Now it works just fine. Great value for the price.

I love the packaging and the overall quality of this transmitter. I had a minor hiccup when pairing with my AirPod Pros. Was promptly contacted by customer support and it turned out there was interference from my landlords bluetooth devices. I am a sound engineer and I use it to check for translation of my work on all consumer formats. Earlier, auditioning on bluetooth headphones meant copying files on my phone or playing outside of my primary digital audio workstation. Now my Airpods connect directly to my audio interface, I can make all the changes while listening to the music realtime, like any end consumer. Money very well spent. Love it.

I had a vintage boombox in pristine condition. It had super powerful speakers and a subwoofer. I always wished I can stream music from my phone (Spotify/YouTube/Etc.) to the speaker but it had no Bluetooth. Then I learned about the TaoTronics Bluetooth 5.0 Transmitter and Receiver, and decided to buy one to try it. When I got it I plugged it straight into the AUX jack on my stereo. Then I Paired the device with my phone. That was an easy process, it took less than a minute. Then all you have to do is play any music on your phone or tablet and it will be transmitted vis Bluetooth to the Stereo receiver. That brought new life to an otherwise obsolete machine. The TaoTronics Bluetooth 5.0 Transmitter and Receiver can also act as a receiver by clicking a switch. Thus I can broadcast music from my old CD/Cassette Player to a modern Bluetooth speaker and enjoy better quality music.

This transmitter is perfect to plug into the television while running on the treadmill. It is a little fidgety on getting the bluetooth connected sometimes to our TCL television, but once it is connected I am able to use my wireless headphones and listen to the TV while on the treadmill without the volume of the TV affecting the rest of the house.

I am a professional camera guy and was looking for  an easy way to monitor audio without having an extra cable dangling from my already involved camera setup. So far this is working great. It connects right away and while I do notice some lag, I’m pretty sure it’s from the headphones I’m using. This little thing gets the job done and is small and light enough that I don’t even know it’s there.

Great product! Easy to set up and use, and one of the best things is that you can use it while it's charging!  I bought it to use with my 20" TV and my xbox 1. Since the xbox 1 doesn't have Bluetooth capability, I pluged this into my TV and then connected my Bluetooth headphones to it. Much better sound now while playing games then using the TV speakers

Sound quality is pretty decent. I can’t hear much of a difference between direct connection, but there is a difference. Also although the latency is low, it is not perfect. There is half second delay that is noticeable when I exit one room and enter another with music playing. So if this is to extend the range of audio playing in one space you’ll have a noticeable delay. This is just one connection. What’s great though is the pairing so was super easy. I bought 2 of these, one to transmit and one to receive the transmission between two analog sound systems. Worked like a charm, never had blu tooth connection work so effortlessly.

I purchased this strictly for my son's distance learning. I wanted him to have headphones to focus a bit better but I also wanted to be able to listen to ensure he was paying attention. This product met that need. I am able to connect both of my Bluetooth headsets to it and we both can listen and speak to the teacher. Setup was easy. Definitely recommend!

Edit: customer service came back to me to make it work right. I am impressed they stand back so much behind their product.This unit just failed to pair for me. I am a significant Tech savvy person, and own decent pair of Bluetooth headphones like Jabra Elite 65t active and Sony WF1000 Xm3 both. No luck with either of those., tried for 1 hour, what a time waste. Please beware before making a purchase that this may happen, I am not even sure why the reviews are so good for this product. This is going back.

I used the Tao in transmit mode connected to the phone port (or the main ports) of my sound board.  A Sony WHH-H900 noise cancelling wireless stereo headset was used successfully--although it was necessary to fully charge both parts and remove a competing  nearby bluetooth device.  The previously used Sony transformer has given delayed sound from my mike system.  This unit was considerably improved, with a slight perceptible latency.  I'm happy with the result and using it regularly to overlay sounds from various sources including instrumental mikes allowing me to hear a balanced sound in my headset.

When I bought this, I thought - hey, wirefree on airline! But this one was a disappointment. Within 2 months, the battery life has dropped to less than 10 minutes - so its useless in an airplane. Maybe I got a lemon, but sound quality has dropped too and is mediocre at best, so save your money and invest elsewhere.

The earbuds fit perfectly put of the box and are so light, they don't fall out. They are perfect for listening to music and are easy to control. Very nice product.I know they are not aptX low latency, but compared to two different earbuds that are, I could tell little difference between this Taotronics latency and both the Pasonomi Bluetooth 5.0 and the Apanage 5.0 which are both aptX incoded. To get no latency on stage, I find I have to use wired earbuds.  With all three, the latency is about a sixteenth note at 140 beats a minute, not enough to cause a problem with a slow ballad, but real problem with a faster song. I hope the engineers keep working on better latency products, but for now, this Taotronics is as good as it gets.

I used the Bluetooth transmitter to connect to a TV sound bar for my spouse to hear the audio at a higher volume using earbuds . It works well except the sound in the earbud sound arrives slightly earlier than the sound bar giving her an echo effect. I'm not sure if I can solve this problem, but its not the blue tooth transmitter's fault.

I bought a 16 inch TV that had the worst sound in the world.  It was ok for my hubby because he only listens to the news and it always sounds bad...  The TV had no bluetooth and I couldn't connect it to anything.  Many speakers are output only ...I don't know why and some others produce feedback if they are connected to charge too long.  This bluetooth thingy was just what I needed to make my TV bluetoothable.  It works very well.

I liket the product at the beginning. A couple of weeks after I got it it started not holding the charge and started turning off about 15 minutes after I started using it to watch a movie.It only stayed on if continuesly plugged to be charged - BUT while it was plugged it was also sending a humming noise to my headphones (when I unplugged the charging cable to humming sound stopped).

I’ve been using this for a couple of months as a Bluetooth connector to my television so the volume level doesn’t drive my wife crazy. Overall I like the product pretty well however I do run into issues sometime when turning it off and on. There have been a few times when the headphones are use just don’t want to connect to it and I have to power it on and off again to get it to connect. Yes

The range isn’t all that good. I am maybe 25ft away. It cuts in/out while washing the car. If you go out of range it will disconnect and I have to reconnect it. I even tried moving it closer to increase its range. I kinda gave up. I am sure I will have use for it some day.  So, if ur in ur garage working at stay in range your good to go. But if you go to far it starts getting choppy.

I love this thing. I keep different waking hours than my family, but with the bluetooth transmitter hooked up to my TV, I can watch movies or play video games without bothering anyone while they're sleeping. The only issue I have with it is if the volume is too low, it tends to cut out the sound every few seconds. But that's easily fixed by moderating the volume on my headset low while keeping it higher on the television. I never have connectivity issues and it's so easy to hook up to my headset.

Decent product. It takes a little longer to pair then I would like. I use this for my switch. I used a different Bluetooth transmitter for the switch that connected to the charge port so of you needed to charge the switch, you have to take the transmitter out. Since this one plugs into the headphone jack, it makes it more convenient to still have your Bluetooth one and charge your switch at the same time. It is a little bit but I don't mind. It's what I wanted and it does a good job. I would recommend this to everyone.

I was hesitant about the sound quality from this transmitter/receiver; however, I have been very pleased. The audio is just as clear as other bluetooth devices that I have used.I have not noticed any crackling or cut-outs while using the device.

I had previously purchased a version of this product with a cable that was permanently attached. TaoTronics was good enough to replace that version after it failed, but I also chose to purchase this version as it seemed sturdier. So far so good; it has done an excellent job as both a transmitter and receiver. It has done what I need it to do, and with the cable easily removable, I don't think I will have any problems in the future.

Less than a year, battery stop holding a charge... Sound keeps breaking up and its only 10 feet from receiver. Literally doesn't do anything it's supposed to... Typical made in China junk...*******Update After my review TAO contacted me, and shipped me a new one which works. I can't speak to its longevity but its working now.

My Tao Tronics' BT headphones ( BH-22) paired, to this device,  without a problem. That was the end of my success.  I plugged into my Sony receiver headphone jack. After connection I received dome dialogue with a ton of distortion (static). I spoke with Tao Tronics' tech support and that was a waste of time. Being an audiophile, when it comes to this type of application; I have no problems.

Bought this to play Amazon Prime Music Unlimited through my home theater. Simple bluetooth adapter, quickly links to iPad. Used 1/8" jack to 2 RCA adapter(supplied) to connect to the front AUX input jacks. Sounds as good as any digital source. No audible dropouts or sound quality compression.10 Grant Rd.

Update:  Seller reached out and corrected the issue.  Great customer service.Way too many connectivity issues in transmit mode.  My bose headphone connects first time fine. after that it goes into pairing mode right away.  So every time it's turned on it's paired with new device.  I have to clear out the pairing every time.

Seemed like a great thing to add to my travel bag, so I could use wireless headphones on the plane, worked fine at home, but on the road it seems to have died , no lights or sign of life at all unless plugged in, then only some red lights. Return window of course just closed.Company rep reached out and offered a replacement anyway, so updated this review, they suspect a one off defect with my initial device.

TaoTronics Bluetooth 5.0 Transmitter and Receiver:  I didn't expect much for the price but this unit works great.  Receiver and transmitter function properly.  Sound quality is very good.  No noise.  Bluetooth pairs easily.  At first I though something was wrong with the receiver, it had a high pitch noise.  I discovered that it was from the USB port on my PC while charging the battery.  Tried a phone charger and have no noise at all.  I have not tested the aptX-low latency function as I don't have compatible headphones yet.

'Does not auto shut off when it is not blue tooth connected... Battery might discharge completely.. I'll call to find out.' Because the Seller was MORE THAN CONSIDERATE, Aida contacted me about the issue mentioned above and stated that if I am not 100% satisfied with my purchase, They would issue a credit to guarantee me that they were truly interested in my future purchasing consideration. This company values your business ! This is a company worth staying in touch with this holiday.... Thank you Aida for your compassion and customer service complete satisfaction levels..

I got this so my grandfather doesn't have to struggle and turn the volume up extremely high. It works well and he loves it.I will note that it has ever so small delay. I noticed it but my grandfather did not. It's small, most might not care if watching a talk show or drame but if gaming, it will likely bother you..

Though I'm not in love with the single-button control scheme, I can't complain about the range, and the sound quality is very good. I'm using it at work and find the range is at least 40', including through a cement wall (nearest restroom to my cubicle). Battery life is okay but not great as it's quite small, so I keep it powered via a USB power supply, though powering through a USB port on your PC should work too.

I bought this as a cheaper alternative to replacing my deck in my car. Have this receiving Bluetooth audio from my phone and sends it through aux.Overall it works as expected. I personally don't want hands free calling so if you're looking for it in this product, it is not supported.

I'm very happy with this purchase.  Unlike a similar product that I tried previously, this unit works very well at 18 to 20 feet.  It connects quickly and the quality of the sound is great.  The full level of volume is not there, but it is very adequate.  I just need to turn the volume knob higher than with other sources.  Battery life is better than expected.

I'm pretty happy with my purchase. We're almost always hosting guests at our tiki bar and like to play music on our box speakers through an amp from spotify using my phone. I am usually running back and forth into the house getting things ready or cooking, and I am really impressed with the range considering the phone is usually in my pocket. As a receiver, it works great and has all night battery life. I haven't used it as a transmitter through, but I can see it coming in handy so that I can listen to tv through my headphones.

For a Bluetooth transmitter/receiver the TaoTronics 2-In-1 is pretty fast, but there's still too much delay for gaming and the boosted speed sacrifices too much of the audio quality, in my opinion. TaoTronics' newer one might be a little better, but it's also more expensive and I haven't tried the newer one yet so Idk.Edit: After returning this device, TaoTronics reached out to me and generously offered a newer device (the TT-BA09) for free, and I accepted the offer. While this doesn't improve the quality of the old product, it does improve my impression of TaoTronics. I've learned that modern Bluetooth technology hasn't advanced enough to have latency low enough for gaming yet, so until then I'm going to lower my standards for Bluetooth a bit and add a star to my review for the TaoTronics 2-In-1.

This device works very well, allowing two persons to remotely listen to the TV at the same time.  The sound quality is as clear as the respective devices that are transmitting and receiving the audio signal.  If the listening device has volume control, each person can adjust voice control to suit his or her needs without disturbing the other person or anyone else in the room.  This is well suited to persons who have hearing challenges.  It is also suited to allowing one person to listen to the TV without disturbing a room or an entire household.

This thing works like a charm... TINY-- you'll never notice it... I bought it so our new wireless headphones could "pair" with the TV.  Easy to attach.  It comes with all the connections you'll need, depending upon the age of your non-bluetooth device.  I figure this little device saved me several hundred dollars, since I didn't have to buy a new TV.

This is a super little device that allows me to go wireless on our Samsung TV which has no wireless ability.  Who needs to buy a new TV when you can plug this little transmitter in and connect it to your earbuds or whatever route you choose.  May even buy a spare to connect to my silly PC which doesn't have wireless ability either.  It works well with both TV and PC when plugged into them.

I love it.  I connected  it to TV  Transmit mode and USB power.  I connected a receiver BT to a headset, also connected a Bluetooth  speaker.  Both headset and bluetooth speaker work together.  Headset can be worn by one and the other speaker for others in the room.  Sound quality  great.  Overnight free shipping.  It was supposed to take a week for delivery. Got it in a few days. Bought a second one to take with me to other locations

There is no clear documentation for this product on how to reset the connectivity with a device or to pair a new device. Long press and hold, double clicks, multiple clicks on start button, nothing seems to work. Never used transmitter option on this one but I am sure that would be as useless as the receiver option. After multiple tries, struggling with all combination of clicks, and dance moves, and a lot of pleading when it connects, it works normally until you try to connect another device.

Works great. I was able to listen to the same audio feed simultaneously on two different head sets which is critical for me to monitor my son's audio while he is taking video classes.  The only issue I have experienced is occasional lost of connectivity on one of the headsets. Not sure if the problem is the headset or the devise.

Purchased this device to connect my new bone conduction headphones (Aftershokz Aeropex) to TV, stereo  and computer.  Took a little time to get initial pairing completed but now it pairs immediately and allows me to listen to music, watch TV, etc. without interfering with housemate's COVID-19 induced work-at-home routine!  Will eventually use it to listen to airline videos, music, etc. using the BC headphones.  Very cool...

Purchased transmitter to use on my new Vizio TV that didn’t have a 3.5 jack. I used the RCA to 3.5 cable to connect to my Spectrum cable box. It works great. I can mute the TV speakers and only listen through my headset.I tried hooking the RCA jacks directly to the TV but it didn’t function. The device automatically paired to my headset quickly.

Works decently well, cuts off occasionally. I only ever use it in short range, typically while walking around, phone in one pocket and this device in the other, so I guess my legs are enough to occasionally block the signal. Also, sometimes I have to try pressing the button several times to get it to turn on, but it always eventually does turn on.

Used this on a couple of air trips and it was everything I hoped it would be. No more cables getting in the way when it’s time to get up and use the bathroom or put your tray down for meal service. I got many looks of curiosity from other passengers who had wired headsets. They definitely wish they had one of these! Thanks for making a great product!

My intent was to use this with my Bose wireless ear buds on stage with my audio monitor from our church's sound system instead of a wired headset. The device works well, but the latency makes it impossible for me to play my bass guitar in a live situation. The device is perfect for just listening to music on any audio device you desire, but not time-critical musical performance with an instrument.

Connected easily, sounds good and has been quite reliable. Cons: Latency! The description says low latency, but I'm not seeing it. I wanted to use this to practice my guitar thru my pedalboard with JBL wireless headphones, but there is a noticeable delay from the time I pluck the strings until I hear the sound. Makes practicing impossible. I'm using it to connect my TV to a JBL wireless speaker. Connects fine, sounds great, but there is still a delay from the video until you hear the sound.

Easy to install, works as expected. Sound quality is a little off but that could be my headset and I will be getting another set soon. I was having an occasional moment where the sound cut out but quickly came back, could not explain it, will know more after I get another set of headphones. Package arrived on time and in a secure box, I would still recommend this to anyone, good price for the item.

Very satisfied with this product. Needed a way to watch tv at night but didn’t want wires stringing from my tv to my headphones. Since my tv does not have Bluetooth, I needed something to transmit the signal from my tv to my headphones. This did the trick perfectly.  Just plug the transmitter into the headphone jack (if your tv does not have one you can use the supplied rca cables to plug into the audio out portion) and then connect to your Bluetooth headphones. The sound quality is excellent.  I have yet to run into any issues with battery life, but I have binged tv shows for 4-5 hours at a time without it losing the battery. Very highly recommended if you want wireless but don’t have the Bluetooth function built into the source you want to listen to.

Bought this to connect Bluetooth devices to my old Zenith tuner. Set-up was straight forward and simple enough; set to transmit or receive (in my case it was set to receive), power on by holding down the power button and then pair with your desired device. I haven’t tested the distance yet, but was able to pair Apple TV (in same room) and transmit to the Taotronics, which enabled the tuner to produce sound from the TV. I haven’t encountered any problems yet, will update if I run into any.

This is a great little unit. Works perfectly with good range and audio quality. Here was my setup and need for this device. I installed a pair of outdoor bluetooth speakers with wired AC. They sounded awesome on my patio. I wanted to mount a TV as well, but I wanted the TV audio to play through these speakers. So I found this TaoTronics bluetooth transmitter. It plugged directly into my TV audio out ports. I also use the TV's USB port to charge this unit. Now the TV and speakers work perfectly and are a great addition to my outdoor living space. This unit has not drop the signal and transmits reliable across a 17ft space outdoors perfectly. For the price and the performance, I couldn't be happier with this purchase.

I wanted to be able to watch TV late at night especially with the COVID lockdown. This work great. I have a bluetooth Jabra Headphone and it connected with no problem.I am extremely happy with this purchase.

I bought my Samsung television before all the smart TV's came out so my TV doesn't have built-in bluetooth. I needed a device that I could plug into my TV's AUX out and be able to watch TV with my bluetooth headphones on while my children are sound asleep in the adjacent room. I will admit I was a bit hesitant at first to purchase this device because I didn't recognize the brand, but I'm happy to report that this device did not disappoint. I've been using it for several months and I have not had a single issue.  I'm very pleased with this product and I'm now considering buying another so that I don't have to keep unplugging it to use it on my other TV.  I do recommend you charge it after a few uses so that it doesn't die out in the middle of a movie.

This little thing is amazing. No more fiddling with aux cords and adapters for my USB-C phone. Hooked it up to my car and it sounds great. Better than the auxillary cable.I use to use a Bluetooth FM transmitter years ago. These things have come a long way.

I wanted to connect my UE bluetooth wireless speaker to my Google Home speaker group. I connected a Chromecast Audio to this bluetooth transmitter, and I'm all set. Now my bluetooth speaker can play music along with my other Google connected devices. All music is perfectly in sync (Google allows for delay settings to help with this) and I'm happy! The only improvement would be an increased range, but I knew the limitations going into the purchase.

This had worked the first night but would not connect the next day. I contacted the company and they responded quickly. I've included the reset directions below. I followed them and am able to connect to my earbuds again.How to pair the TT-BA07 in TX：

I purchased this to see if I could eliminate some wires running from my ceiling mount video projector to a remote sound bar in a TV room. Not expecting cinema sound or anything crazy, my main worry was latency/audio sync with video. Much to my amazement, this device worked fine and I didn't have to run an unsightly cable along the wall or pay to have a cable run through the ceiling/wall.

Very nice audio and control. Nice piece and came with a lot of cables, which was a surprise.I bought it for Bose headphones but the specific codec required for low latency "Qualcomm aptX Low Latency" is not supported by Bose. Not the fault of this device.

This little gadget is pretty nifty to own if you like to listen to your tv with wireless headphones.It pairs quickly and doesn't lose connectivity as far as I've noticed. Some times when there is a pause in dialogue there will be a "muted" silence in between which is weird but tolerable. Probably not good if you're watching some Mumblecore.

For the price these are an amazing product.  I use one in my shop to hook up to a non-blue tooth speaker and in my 2008 bmw convertible that does not have Bluetooth capability.  Hooks right up to my iPhone 6s with no problem.  It sounds just awesome  Battery lasts a long time.  I only have to charge it maybe twice a month

I bought this bluetooth transmitter to be able to connect a pair of wireless headphones to my Sharp Aquos smart tv. It does the job and was fairly easy to pair. I like that it charges via usb directly to the tv so it's always ready! Happy with my purchase.
Pros:Fully Charged.Quick to Pair (RX Mode).

As few have mentioned, there's a noticeable slight delay in audio (which is expected for various bluetooth options). This is obvious when you watch videos but it's not enough where it's completely unusable.Another issue is when it's charging, there's a faint buzzing noise whenever audio comes through. I realized that the noise disappeared as soon as I disconnected the usb cable to charge it.

Super disappointed in this. I bought 4 other kinds for 9 each. They sound better, connect easier, and have a longer range. I used a 5 way aux splitter to create surround sound effect. I bought this expecting to have at least 1 good one if the cheaper ones failed but now I'm glad I bought only 1 of these hunks of junk. Doesn't work well without the splitter. I'd save money and look elsewhere. Not worth the price at all
This was great in a snap for late night gaming sessions without waking my roommates.Pros:

What can I say ?  This is the second one I have bought in two weeks ! The range is awesome no delay sound is great. It’s so versatile, I’m using this one for my vintage Harmon Kardon receiver (150 wpc and big bad boy Cerwin Vega speakers ) for my IPhone IPad and Sony  BDP-S6700 player. I have so many more ways to listen to all my music - My Neighbors just LOVE ME NOW ! ! !

I bought the item in a hope of playing digital piano directly into headphones, with no wire. For this purpose, the product is not suitable. I expect it to be similarly unsuitable for gaming.The product connects to my heaphones, and so far I did not have any disconnects. I also have no complaints in terms of sound quality.

I had a little trouble initially connecting the transmitter to my bluetooth speaker.  I have UE Megaboom and a UE boom, older models and couldn't get it connected to the megaboom and finally got it connected to the boom, had to put the transmitter in pairing mode before I put the speaker in pairing mode.  Then got both of them connected to my TV and it is great!  Way better sound from my speakers than the TV.  Looking to buy another one or two.  Easier than getting a whole TV speaker system.

My business trip is usually on long flight, the battery life is just not long enough to carry the whole journey unless I have to charge it at 80% of my journey. Yes, this damn thing needs charging, found out the hard way. But I highly recommend it to all business travelers, it eliminate the cluster of wiring in front of you.

I used this with my oculus go to pair with my jaybird x3's. This thing worked right out of the box. Perfect! There is zero audio delay. I tested with several movies and it did its job perfectly. I will buy another to gift to my friend!

Great sound quality. I don’t think I’ve lost any sound quality over Bluetooth (which most do) I have had this at a distance of 4 apartment buildings from my phone and still quality sound. Amazing! So far it has not needed to be recharged but it’s only been a week. If this continues I will be purchasing many more. Can’t loose with this adapter. Quality sound, distance and affordability.

I use it to connect Sony AVR and Onkyo amplifier to my Sony noise cancelling blue tooth headphones.  Works perfectly. No volume control on this device, but not needed because volume controls on amps and headphones.  This device works even though the Sony AVR built in bluetooth will not pair with my Sony headphones.

I’m not sure if I received a defective transmitter or if my standards are too high for this device, but the battery life on this is frustrating at times! I will have charged it overnight, plug it into my projector, not actually using the device, and later when I go to play a show or movie with it, it will die within an hour. I would keep it plugged into the charger at all times but, the cord is not long enough and I don’t think I should have to rely on using that way if it’s wireless.The connectivity to my speaker and headphones is good but I just wish I’d be able to use it for longer periods of time.

I never even knew these existed until a friend told me. I originally wanted it to hook to our stereo receiver to play music off our phones etc. through the home stereo system. After I got it I learned our receiver was too old and didn't have a space to plug this in. Well, we also have a large powered P.A. type speaker that sits in the corner that we used to play music off of our phones. So we hooked it to that. It's super easy to use and to Bluetooth to. We had it hooked up and were using it in minutes. It's small so it's out of the way, holds a charge for quite a long time. It's great giving Bluetooth capability to older electronics that don't come with it. Can't beat it for the price and it's super easy to use.

Initially bought so that I could use my wireless headphones with my new smart TV which does not have bluetooth, however on Christmas day I had to find a way to play music unobtrusively! And the receive mode came into play!Beauty is that it just works and can be charged as it work, which helps since I do not have to worry about it running out of power ...

Using this for travel has been great so far. I paired at home to avoid other Bluetooth devices on the plane and when turned on in flight paired back to the earbuds with no issues. Good range too. The small issue is a slight delay. Maybe a syllable or two off but on an airplane screen it’s hard to notice all the time. And for me it was an acceptable amount of latency considering I was free of cords.

We added after market speakers on our motorcycle and use to connect our iPod to this but then the iPod no longer worked so needed something to connect our phones  without having to actually connect with a wire.  This little gadget works perfect cause we plug it into speakers and use bluetooth for the phone to play music.  It is so small it tucks away perfectly under our motorcycle seat.  Set-up was easy.  Would purchase again.

Following the instructions it connects quickly to the AirPods Pro before initial use. No problem reconnecting after that. Have used it a few times for flight entertainment and on a computer. During flight entertainment I needed to bump up the volume higher than for wired head phones but still sufficient reserve. Sound quality is good.Considering the price of the ear buds this is an inexpensive but functional device to extend utilization of the Airpods.

My partner loves to watch Big Bang while I'm reading.... this saved our marriage! She can watch to her hearts content and I can sleep or read without wanting to throw the tv out the window.... Well made too and was easy to pair with both our sets of headphones! It also was able to be charged while its on the tv with the extra cable they provided... Nice!
USELESS PIECE OF JUNK.  Does not stay charged for even 1 hour.  Does not operate while charging.  May be useful for flights of 30 minute duration only, but I doubt it.

This is fine for audio only, but there is such a noticible lag in transmission that I couldn't use it with my keyboard (eletric piano); there was as much as a 1 second delay between pressing a key and hearing the tone through the device.I'm not sure that this could be used in conjunction with synchronised video unless there is a way to "slide" the video playback to match the delayed audio.

This unit does what it's supposed to do and seems to do it well.  However, be advised that if there is no signal going in, it will turn off after a length of time.  This would be very inconvenient if it were located in the back of a console/stereo amp/etc.  Fortunately, I have mine connected to the headphone jack on the front.  In this day and age of hand held remotes, it's annoying to have to power the unit up every time before use.

My Samsung smart TV does not feature blutooth connection. I bought this receiver so I could operate wireless blutoothheadphones through my TV audio. It was easy to install and operate and connect. Worked perfectly! Sound quality was clearly enhanced--dialog was crisp, much more so than the TV speakers. And the price was downright cheap--less than $10! I'm a happy camper.

There’s a build in power saving mechanism which causes the device to cut out when there is little to no sound being broadcast- then turns back on when the proper volume of sound reappears. So this item is best used for Listening to music or watching a sporting event.In movies and tv where the auto track varies on the content of a scene or situation- using this devise can become distracting as it constantly cuts in and out.

We figured out how to connect to our Bose headphones no problem, but the output volume is incredibly low. Like, we had to watch TV with subtitles while wearing our noise cancelling head phones low. HORRIBLE.

Got this for my Bluetooth headphones and connected it to the earphone jack on my TV. No problems connecting and it doesn't cancel the regular audio from the TV or sound bar. Now I can hear everything and not have to use the subtitles or try to listen over everybody talking. The signal can get blocked if people walk in front of the TV. Also connected a Bluetooth speaker to it and it worked great.

This POS is not connecting to my Bose Quiet comfort 35 headphones. I followed the directions word for word after connecting it to an audio device but have had no luck. I know it's not my headphones since they have no problem connecting to other Bluetooth devices. Very disappointed.

Bought the device for my wife so she could connect her new airpods pro and watch a movie from the plane entertainment system.Try multiple times to connect her iphone the TaoTronics in TX (Transmittor) mode, but without success.  I was able to connect in RX (Receiver) mode, but as soon I we changed it back to TX mode to get the sound of the movie, the bluetooth disconected.

Love it!!!Bought it to use it for connecting two headphones for my kids for traveling. Now, I also use it to connect with devices and cars that are not equipped with bluetooth. So I can practically can connect with "old" and new devices anywhere and use both the transmit and receive capabilities all the time.
Liked the fact that RCA to Mini adapter was provided. Easy to connect audio to TV.Not all TVs have a USB port, so current USB cable is too short if connecting to a USB Power adapter.

I had this hooked up to a projector and during low volume movie scenes, it completely cuts out the audio. Background music and all. I guess I should pay more for a transmitter, but this will not work for me. It totally kills the mood. Low ambience background sounds are cut out as well until the character starts talking again. This may be fine for music, but this is a deal breaker for me.

Overall I am disappointed in this product.  The problem is that the volume is too low.  I have a couple of different Bluetooth headphones that I use in different environments.  The headsets that don't have a volume control built into them are too quiet to use with this transmitter.  They work fine with my phone, tablet and computer.  Otherwise this would be a great product.

This fills a gap we have right now. To use Bluetooth on devices that don't have it. IO wanted to use my phone to send music to my yard. Using these, I do not have to wire in my phone when I am doing that. I am sure you think of 100 other reasons to not want to be tied to the amplifier. Give it a try.

I have this running from a projector to a Bose Soundbar. I think it works great. A few reviews about the sound cutting out. I had this too. You just need to turn the output device volume up!  In my case my projector volume was 2/10 when this was happening. I turned it up to 10 and no more issues.

I couldn't find a decent Bluetooth pillow speaker that wasn't outrageously expensive or without some major flaw or inconsistent ratings. So I bought this to add Bluetooth to any speaker I wanted. It is super cute and small and sounds great. The button allows for quickly pausing and resuming playback. And it works while charging so I just leave it plugged in.

This was a little complicated to set up with my new TaoTronics earbuds, but once everything decided to connect it has worked great. I enjoy the flexibility of still 'watching' TV from 2 rooms away. I set it up in front of my stereo receiver so I can switch between receiving or transmitting easily.

Not sure why tablets and phones don't allow multiple bluetooth connections to two headsets, but it is a problem for us when we take long flights.  My wife and I like to sit together and watch a movie or show when we fly.  In the past we had to use wired headsets and a splitter.  Now we can use two bluetooth headsets and this unit was super easy to set up.  We watched a long movie and it worked perfectly and the battery lasted the entire time with no problem.  I am wondering if it might be a good additional to a house TV where you both want to watch a movie after the kids are in bed, etc?  I might give it a try one of these days.

Works perfectly. I travel often enough for it to be worth the $$ and I’m glad I made the purchase. I get slight anxiety when flying and this combined with my noise canceling bose headphones drowns out the engine sounds to put me at ease so I can listen to music or watch movies. When I’m not flying I use it with my nintendo switch since it doesn’t support bluetooth. Works better than more expensive competitors. 5 Star Buy.

I loved the idea of this but instructions how to set your TV audio not so much I spent a hour researching how to switch modes and whatever then i experimented and as soon as i switched the audio from variable to fixed it worked immediately then turned up volume via my beats audio headphones but not certain of hooking to soundbar i just did the red white RCA cables to back of TV then turned off my soundbar and tv speakers. So happy I finally figured it out! :)

I bought a stero system  that only did Bluetooth in and not Bluetooth out.  I purchased this item for the transmitter option and so far it works great.  Once i paired the transmitter with my speakers it worked great.  I have a 3700 square foot house and test the speaker to all parts and it worked every where.  I'm very impressed and happy.  So far i have only used it one time.
A nice basic product.There are no specific volume controls that I have noticed, but does a decent job of transmitting.

For someone who really isn't about the bells and whistles of a Bluetooth product like this- I absolutely love this adapter. I needed the adapter for the nights when I am staying up later than my husband- I had plugged into my controller but that was bulky and cumbersome to carry around. This has simple instructions and straightforward operation. I was able to connect to the Bluetooth adapter in under a minute and had minimal problems walking around my 2 bedroom apartment without distorted sound. So I would give this a wildly positive review from my standards. Perhaps if you are someone who is looking for cutting edge crisp sound- you would not love this as much as I do.

My wife and I bought a cheaper vizio smart tv a few years a go - it didn't have bluetooth headphone capability, but now I can sleep at night while my wife enjoys watching netflix out in the living room at whatever volume that she likes. This was such an easy, affordable, plug-and-play solution! We haven't had a single issue. There doesn't seem to be any sound delay at all. I keep it plugged into my TV at all times - we just turn the device on, turn the tv to mute and this thing does the trick without skipping a beat. Highly recommend!

This little thing is great. I got it to plug into my backyard TV and sync with a bluetooth speaker. When we are hanging in the spa the TV was difficult to hear so we picked up this piece of voodoo and problem solved.  My TV and spa are 20 steps apart from each other (I just checked, no I didn't want to dig a tape measure out) and it didn't have any problem hooking up with my bluetooth speaker. Highly recommended.02-15-19

I bought this when it was on sale to try out with my Switch while docked. There's too much lag to really enjoy video games with it. Some of it is livable, but I preferred playing with the sound off to playing with this.Otherwise, it's a fine product. If you're just using it for music/podcasts/whatever it's good. There's no volume controls on it, which would have been nice. I had to turn my Switch up to 100% to even get an agreeable volume level.
We got this so that we could pair both our headphones to it and watch TV after the kids are in bed without disturbing them. It's been fantastic! Pairing was easy, and the sound is good.Setup note:

I love my car. It's my baby, but she was made in 2008. No Bluetooth then like we have now and TaoTronics has saved the day for me. I just turn the thing on and off like you would the radio and its seamless to my phone. The best part is that before I was using an aux jack still, so now I can use the bottom port of my phone to charge while I drive.

I bought this device with my wireless headphones to keep the volume down at home and away whenever I use a tv. Petsitting sometimes has me in apartments, condos, or other tightly packed neighborhoods where the neighbors are... Not so keen on the tv volume, no matter how low it is. Now I can watch a movie with Fido, without upsetting the neighbors :)The only thing I found a little confusing is that the tv and the bluetooth seem to have separate volumes, so I had to play around with that. A tip for anyone else with this issue is to just turn the volume on the tv all the way to zero, and then adjust with your headphones.

The transmitter itself works fine: connected with monitor and Nintendo Switch for my Airpods Pro, and the audio is there, though sometimes quiet like other reviews mention. My biggest complaint is the obvious cost-cutting with the other included cables. The micro-USB charging cable is a really poor fit, but even worse, THE AUDIO CABLE IS NOT COMPATIBLE WITH NINTENDO SWITCH. The only reason I'm able to still use it is because I have a leftover audio cable from some other bluetooth headphones, but it's really annoying to use a 3ft long audio cable from an entirely different product when the small portable yet broken audio cable is there taunting me.

This is just what I needed. My wife always complains that the TV is to loud when she tries to sleep. I now use my Bluetooth headset and life is good :-)It took a while to get it to pair, but once it was paired it was simple to use. The device is the size of a matchbook, so its easy to hide behind the tv so no one see it

This gadget works great to let me use my Bluetooth earphones with my TV. Its highly recommended. If it’s plugged in to a USB power supply it stays on forever (unlike another brand I got and returned which turned itself off after 10 minutes of no pairing). So all you gotta do to use it is turn on your headphones.

Connected immediately first time. Subsequent connections were sometimes difficult. Must be charged every third day. Sound quality through kinivo headset is excellent.This is an update.  This device stopped working after seven months.I

As a battery saving measure, this devices audio completely cuts out during low volume segments of movies. I assume this product only has the review score it has as a result of them constantly pestering via email those who give it bad ratings. You might be able to find use of the product if you are using a speaker and aren't too concerned with delay and audio quality. If you are using headphones however, this receiver is awful.

I bought this to connect my Bluetooth headphones to a audio mixer and it was super easy to set up and worked no problem with any of my Bluetooth headphones. Would recommend for anyone wanting to connect headphones to non Bluetooth devices and turning non Bluetooth devices into one. Battery also works good.

This did not work on one of my TV's but on the TV it did work on, it works well Connected to portable BT speaker so  wall mounted TV doesnt bother anyone else for bedtime viewing. There is a delay, but it doesn't matter that much. My biggest complaints are the need to re-pair every use and the bright light it emits in my bedroom. I have to put in a eyeglass case or the light keeps me awake.

I cannot keep this transmitter paired with Bose Quiet Comfort headphones.  I have wasted so much time trying to pair this transmitter to my headphones.  Once it is paired it work ok, but it is a nightmare pairing them.  I have bought several transmitters from this company.  Another transmitter I bought had an issue that it would make a god awful sound when it was fully charged.  So I would have to unconnected the power.  It was really inconvenient because I had it connected back behind a TV.  Overall, I am really not pleased with any of the products I have bought from this company.  I am going to try to find better options.
Make's it so nice to bluetooth to my headphones and not have that cord in the way.  I have chopped more than 1 cord digging before and this fixes that!

I bought it to pair my Sony earphones with my Sony Bravia Smart T.V. Sounds odd but yeah, Sony doesn't let even its own bluetooth connect with the TV!!...The bluetooth adapter worked as expected,  the first time pairing took about 45 secs

This little gizmo has solved a number of problems for me!! The speakers on both my projector and my record player are terrible! With this, I can send the sound to my lovely Bose speaker and voila, instant amazing sound and volume! It synchronizes very easily and I plan to purchase more of them for other devices with similar issues.

I enjoy listening to FM radio stations and I use this bluetooth transmitter to broadcast signals my bluetooth headphones so I can enjoy NPR or music without carrying around the radio when cooking or mowing the lawn.

This is an upgraded version of some I purchased 2+ years ago. The improvements are subtle but nice: 1) The LED is on top of device not a tiny light on back corner, 2) pairing much better, 3) can pair multiple devices to listen at same time. The is a receive function but I only use to transmit.

I purchased this to use with my Oculus Go, allowing me to use Bluetooth headphones instead of corded ones.  The unit is small, light enough to allow me to attach it to the top strap of my Oculus without any noticeable discomfort.  The sound is crystal clear and I have absolutely no complaints!

Very well constructed... very plush to keep my computer well protected.  Built-in pouch is a very good size and easily hold the charging cord.  The only thing that I'd like is if the piping material was a darker color... the grey used on mine seems to collect the dirt and is already starting to look dirty only after a few weeks of use.  (Dark red, or an all black option would have been better for me.  I do recommend this case.

I want to keep this review short. The battery life great but because it’s a very low power Bluetooth it suffered greatly in audio. I wanted to link two Soundboks 2 and it worked. But it changed the pitch of the song. My song was 320kbps and dropped it to 64kbps. So not only does it sound weird it’s awful with lots of static & clicking noise. Do I recommend this product, no.

This is a powerful little transmitter. Smaller than a credit card. I can go into any room in my home and it'sjust as strong as standing next to the transmitter. If you go to register it on TaoTronics website you can find coupon codes to use on Amazon's order page. This is really a good deal.

The fatal flaw with this device is the horrible noise leveling it does automatically when transmitting. I owned this device for months now and used it a few times with little issue. I tried transmitting music and it turns out it intentionally cuts out lower level sounds and does not transmit them. It makes listening to classical or anything without a constant sound impossible. More music was cut out than was not. Very frustrating, wish I would have discovered this before the time passed to get a refund. I feel like I was duped.

Like that it is small. The sound is great!!! (just be sure you do not "saturate" volume since they are not headphones when listen music from a home stereo equipment). The distance of reception is tricky since I use earphones blutooth inside the house and many walls to "travel", but in clear view it ridges the distance they say.

I wanted to use this for late night watching of movies so I wouldn't disturb anyone. I hooked this up to my headphones (bluetooth connection was fairly easy) and discovered that in low volume scenes, especially dialogues, the transmit automatically switches on and off (Maybe for battery life) so you lose background noise and it becomes very annoying to the point I couldn't use it. Works well for music but I really wanted it for movies so will be returning it.EDIT

I have a Airstream RV and I wanted something that could connect by bluetooth from my iPod to my stereo system inside the Airstream and to a bluetooth speaker outside so I could listen to music inside and outside at the same time since I find myself always going and coming from the Airstream. This little device works great. Love it!

The adapter allowed  me to use my Bose unit to play podcasts, audio books, and music without having to purchase separate speakers in my kitchen office area.  Pretty much everything I listen to is off of my phone and this adapter made it super easy.  The connectivity is great (does not cut out constantly) and the sound quality  is excellent.  If you have a Bose and stream your music, listen to podcasts, etc. This is a reasonably priced, quality option.

I use the Tao Bluetooth Transmitter/Receiver to clarify the sound from my Samsung TV by transmitting the audio to my Bose Soundwear neckpiece speaker.  The device works well, there is a very slight delay (barely noticeable)... I can enjoy TV again.  I bought two, because I didn't want to be without it when it would need to be charged... I learned it can be left plugged in for power, for continuous use.  Glad I have two so I have a backup.  It also makes my C. Crane Skywave radio a bluetooth radio so can walk around without taking the radio with me.  Bonus is I don't bother my neighbors with high sound coming from my unit... also easy to install, did it myself.  Thank you, Hearing Impaired Old Lady

This little product really works well. I use it with a pair of bluetooth headphones when watching TV late at night as to not keep my family awake. Pairs up each time just fine. One key I found was to turn this unit on first, then turn the headphones on. Pairs up faster that way for some reason.

I recently bought a new vehicle, a 2011 Nissan Rogue SL, which has Bluetooth capabilities, but only for hands free calling.  Since it has an AUX jack for audio in the center console I was able to use this in order to pair my phone with it so I can listen to my MP3s in the car.  Works great!

This product does what it says. I've mainly used the transmitter to connect to my bluetooth wireless earbuds. The transmitter plugs into the controller for my room speakers which are used for the TV as well as streaming audio.  It sends crystal clear audio to my earbuds. I can walk around the house, even other rooms and receive good reception. Initial pairing is a bit tricky, but connects reliably after paired. It perfectly met the need I had.
So far  so good, I can walk around and  listen to my  TV from  anywhere in the house.

We purchased the transmitter to save on audio tours. We used to use splitters but would find ourselves walking further apart and having our earbuds be pulled out of our ear. The Bluetooth transmitter made things significantly easier on audio tours, no issues with connecting or sound, and easy to use.

This little guy absolutely got the bill. There is definitely latency, so using it for live, or synced, video it’s not a great option. For simple audio streaming it’s great. Better than 4 hours run time on a charge.I had minor difficulties getting it to sync initially, but after a couple power cycles, it has been flawless.

I am a frequent business traveler and also an Apple Airpod user and would find myself on airliners with their entertainment system and no way to utilize them. Utilizing the Transmitter/Receiver I have been able to use the airlines system for enjoying wireless free entertainment with my Airpods. Pairing to the Airpods was a cinch and I have had no issues in getting them going whenever needed. Battery will last quite a few flights and is able to be charged right from those systems (Delta & American) if you need to in a pinch.

I first purchased product to connect a non-bluetooth turntable to a bluetooth speaker and it worked great...since then I have brought into my car to use with my existing non-bluetooth stereo to connect wirelessly to my iphone to play music from Spotify, my own downloads or even Sirius stations...also works great...for an inexpensive gadget I'm very pleased with performance so far...

Worked the evening received with Bose noise cancelling headphones. Then not at all the next day. Tried with different TV's, turned off other bluetooth devices. Paired successfully each time to headphones but did not transmit audio. Used the different connections, RC and jack. No success.

My audio center is located in the front of my house.  I have a large sunroom on the back of the house with wired speakers I installed 20 yrs ago.  To get a Bluetooth signal from my audio gear to my sunroom it was TaoTronics to the rescue.  I can keep my tablet in the kitchen about 15 feet from the sunroom and have my music apps playing without interruption.  I love it!

I bought this about 6 months ago and it was freaking AWESOME! I was so glad to not have a 25' cord to my headphones. After pairing it with my phone and my computer a few times however, it completely stopped pairing with my headphones. I tried everything. It just will NO LONGER pair with my headphones. I use the MPOW bluetooth headphones. If anyone has any suggestions on repairing that would be awesome.

I am very pleased with this item. Wifey and I take a laptop on vacation.  We can know watch movies and play music, without bothering anyone.  My first test with a DVD video played with VLC and this device had no latency. I have an extensive music collection on a 256 GB USB drive that I play with Media Monkey portable. With this setup, I can now slow grove on the Beach
Does exactly what it's supposed to do--no apparent lag or mismatch with picture when watching TV or movies, and the range (at least 15-20  feet) is solid.  I would buy it again.

So I have a RoKu enable TV, but it will only pair RoKu Speakers via Bluetooth (btw – this sucks, but ok) so I picked this up to pair with my Mini Jambox speakers and Roku TV.I had to clear any previous Bluetooth pairing on the Jambox speakers, but once I did, they connected to the transmitter in just seconds.

I have been looking for ways to have both my wife and I watch movies on a plane using bluetooth and now I've found it.  This little thing is simple to use and it paired with both sets of cheap over-the-ear bluetooth headphones right away.  I can't tell you about sound quality because neither set of headphones I own is of high quality.  However, you don't have to pay a lot to get decent sound these days.

This was quite easy to setup. Although it can function (chargeable)  without power I don't see the benefit since it needs an audio source, perhaps that is just my setup. It has a very small foot print with very good range. Truly, the only gripe I have about this , which prevents 5 stars, is that the volume is very loud in my headset. I use the LG SB series bluetooth and I am unable to adjust. Maybe your experience will differ. I did recommend this same item to a family member.
It is awesome so far the best range that i have tested, but it is not what i need.Even if is not what i need im leaving 5 starts because it is a good product.

The transmitter works great. The only problem I had with getting it to work was with my TV. This is an analog device and finding the right analog input along with the correct tv audio setup was the challenge for me. The TaoTronics is small but works well if you follow the directions carefully. Line of sight transmission to the bluetooth receiver is necessary.

This little gadget was exactly what I was looking for, and it did not disappoint. I use it on trips both on the plane to connect to entertainment systems, then at the destination when I might want to send audio to my bluetooth earphones or transmit from my phone to a speaker. I also use it for my Samsung Fire TV that sits above the treadmill in my garage, so I can watch TV/movies and still hear the audio while running (and not having to blast music).True Swiss army knife for bluetooth audio that works as advertised. Highly recommended.

I've never paired two non-computer connected bluetooth devices before but it worked quite well. I pulled up some music to test it out but I was instantly disappointed. :/ A house track with a sub-y intro kick sound more like b-boom b-boom b-boom b-boom instead of a perfectly synced sub.Pretty unfortunate. :/

I actually ordered two of the transmitters because I have two big screen tv's. My Hisense 58" tv's connections are through the headphone plug on the back of the tv's. The connection was seamless without a hitch. I followed the instructions and the connection was immediate...after a charge of the transmitters and the headphones.

I had been using an old pair of RF Headphones at work for many years to listen to an old TV in our shop.  They finally died and instead of buying another pair I decided to get this Bluetooth transmitter/receiver since the old TV does not have Bluetooth built in.  I really like how small it is.  I just paired one of my BT Wireless Headphones to it and plugged it into the headphone jack on the tv.  The pairing was SO easy!  It worked exactly as the instructions explained it.  I turned it on and voila!  There was my TV audio again.  Sounds great and the latency is very low.  I also love the fact that you can charge it while you use it.So easy and so useful!  I would definitely recommend this product!

Took several tries and almost gave up, but finally got two Bose wireless speakers connected.  Once speakers were connected all worked well.  Directions that came with the device are just okay. Needed to find the instructions for the device online (YouTube) to gain a better understanding of how to connect correctly.  That's why fours stars instead of five.

I didn't know it had volume control, I'll have to check this out, but the transmission is fine and the airpods reconnect whenever the tv goes back on. The airpods beep and then 8 seconds later, I get sound. It's not 8 seconds behind, but I've noticed thats how long it takes to connect.

I hooked this bad boy up to my Bose speakers in my living room. Whenever I want to play music now, I don't have to physically connect to anything. I just hit "play" on spotify, put the phone back in my pocket and go on doing what I need to do while listening to music. It's also helpful for parties as I don't have to leave a conversation to adjust music volume and or change songs. It's also so small that you don't even notice it's there.  Battery life is very decent. I usually plug it into the usb charger every so often. You can also use it while its charging. I'd definitely recommend it hands down.

Works great. Sound was quite loud. I haven’t figured out how to adjust the volume. It seems like whatever the TV sound is when you plug it in is the sound that you’re going to get it doesn’t allow you to control it up or down. I’m sure it has something to do with the TV but I haven’t figured it out yet.

I use it in my kitchen so I can hear the TV while cooking because the vent hood over my stove is like a jet engine. Sometimes it has some latency. I wish there was a way to only connect one speaker instead of auto connecting both connections. It often tries to connect to another bluetooth speaker I have in the room above it, and I have to go up to turn that one off when it connects. It does the job, though. I'm happy enough with it, and I'm not tripping over an aux cord anymore.

Works pretty good the few times I tried it. Don't know how much I will use but it does work as advertised. The only bad thing I can say is that it is a little inconvenient to recharge due to the TV being pushed back against the wall. Have not tried other uses so far only the audio out from TV.
Endless pros.-Unbelievably small device that connects easily to any electronic with a headphone jack and no Bluetooth.

Finally upgraded my headphones to blue tooth & the TV didn't support them. Got this & it worked perfectly with my existing audio aux adapter. Pairing can be tricky. You will need to start the process at the same time as your headphones. If it doesn't pair after a little while double click the power button to try again. It needs to be close. Can't do it from across the room (at least with my headphones).

Perfect!  This turned our TV into a smart TV!  We inserted it into our TV and paired it with a bluetooth speaker!  Now our TV isn't blasting through out the house so we can hear it!  I can carry the speaker to wherever I'm working and now I don't disrupt our household!  Highly recommend!

New Updated Review:I got in touch with customer service and they have some of the best customer service. They helped me with my problem and sent me a new receiver that works so much better than the original. They made sure I was taken care of and I really appreciate their help. The new one sent does not fade at all and the quality of sound is superb. You can defintely trust you’ll be satisfied with this company. Thank you again!

This is a nice little gadget. I purchased it hoping to connect my Zune (stop laughing) to my Kenwood car stereo via Bluetooth. The only issue was, I could not get it to pair at all. It acted like it was going to, and it showed up in my paired items list, but it would never actually connect. Returned it for this reason. It did not work for what I wanted. Would work great in other applications though.

I have this plugged into my TV audio out so that I can listen with bluetooth headphones. There's very little latency so there are no oddities such as hearing dialog after seeing lips move or seeing a car crash and after two seconds hearing the sound of the crash! It's pretty much instantaneous, so I'm happy with this product. It's small and it sound clear.

Very small unit.  Works well.  I like the reported ten hour battery life.  I have used this on a long 5 hr flight with no battery issue, but cannot confirm actual battery life.  It is nice to know that it can be used while charging.  That could prove very handy on an overseas flight.

Works in Bluetooth receive mode going to an aux device, but couldn't get it to work in aux to Bluetooth send.It just wouldn't connect to a bluetooth receiver. Unfortunately, the main purpose I got this for was to bypass a defective AUX jack in my car. So without bluetooth send, it is worthless for me.

Had this product for 2 weeks using my Bose headphones. Had this set up so the USB port that would charge the device with the TV. No luck. Then tried charging it with an outlet and still no luck. This item is a piece of crap and don’t waste you money on this.

Bought this mainly to use as a receiver in my car. To hook up Bluetooth to my phone, as my car audio system only has an Aux hookup, and no Bluetooth connectivity. While my phone no longer has a headphone jack in it.With the provided (short) cables, It easily hooks up to the ports in my center console storage, for both power and Aux. Its small enough that it barely takes up any space. And instantly hooks up to my phone once paired the first time, when switching to receiver.

Maybe just me but I got a lot of static in all ear buds or headphones I’ve used on my pc and using my beats wirelesslyUpdate, the seller reached out to me to help resolve some issues that could affect latency and any lag experience.  Great concern twards customer service and resolving any issues.

I use this as a receiver in the car because my phone doesn't have a headphone jack but I mostly use it for my iPod classic so it can connect to my AirPods. Granted, the volume is a bit low but honestly its better than having to put your ears exposed to loud music for long periods of time.

Easy to install, easy to use, perfect!! Now I can sleep while my husband watches TV. It does connect with any Bluetooth headset, he has beats earbuds and it works perfectly. Just as FYI when you pair it, it takes a bit longer than when you pair your headset with a cellphone just be patient. Also the TV will still have volume, just mute the TV and you are all set.
Great Bluetooth transmitter. It can transmit to 2 Bluetooth receivers at one time play audio together which is great for the Oculus Quest.

I used this adapter to connect my Bluetooth headset to the entertainment system on an airplane.  I set up the connection between the adapter and my headphone ahead of my flight so that I wasn't in a rush.  There were no issues pairing with my Sony head set.  The battery life is longer than my headset, so I just charge them both at the same time.There is a slight delay in audio, but I consider it acceptable for use while on the plane. Most of my time was spent listening to music instead of watching videos, so I didn't have any issues with the delay.

I use these to transmit the audio from the inflight entertainment systems to my Bose bluetooth headphones.  Using the wire to connect my headphones to the system leaves the wire dangling and catching on the tray table.  The TaoTronics dongle allows me to do without the wire.  There is no lag between the picture and sound and I can even get up and walk around and the bluetooth connection will not break.

I've used this both to transmit and receive Bluetooth.  My TV sound system has a headphone jack, but it's on the other side of the room. With this gizmo i can use my favorite Bluetooth headphones and nobody cares.  As a receiver, i have used it with a nice wired pair of headphones.  Works fine but doesn't seem like an option for me to use very often.Build quaity is good. Looks like it will last for along time.

Bought this transmitter to pair with my TaoTronics Bluetooth 5.0 earsbuds. They paired easily and sound great but I can't control the volume level from the earbuds to the TV or control the volume with the TV controller. Thus the 1 star for volume control. Update - found out my older smart tv is not compatible with the transmitter to control the volume.

The product headline has a significant falsehood - this is not even close to low latency. In fact, I would estimate the latency to be about 1/3 to 1/2 second delay. I bought this product to transmit from my electric keyboard to a bluetooth receiver (headphones or speaker). After getting it charged up and paired, I eagerly tried playing, and was shocked at the significant delay between when I press a key on the keyboard and when the sound comes out almost a half second later. It's completely unusable.If you were trying to connect the audio portion of a video to a bluetooth speaker, you should expect the audio and video to be out of sync.

I purchased this to connect with my Bose Sound Bar in my RV.  After charging it and connecting it to a portable CD player It was ready for use.  It powered up and paired in seconds, couldn't have been any easier.  The sound quality has been very good.  It's small and compact and will tuck away without taking up much space.  I can't speak for battery life yet but have been using it for two hours.  So far I give a high recommend.

I have an original ipod. I use this device to connect to my wireless headphones (TaoTronics BH07) as well as my Oontz Angle 3 Portable bluetooth speaker. The connection is great and it works up to the 110ft claimed as long as you do not have major obstructions in the way. Great when skiing and my I pod is in my jacket or backpack. Quickly and easily connects to multiple types of devices. I haven't yet tried to connect my sons wireless headphones while mine are connected, we'll try this weekend on the slopes. would by this again if I needed it for a second device.

If you have a nintendo switch this product works great for the price and you can get a super cheap peace of plastic that holds it behind the switch.There are better options that have come out after I bought this but thwy cost a fair bit more, except this also works for a huge variety of products. (Basically any device that doesn't have bluetooth and also has an auxiliary port will become bluetooth enabled) you can also use it to conect multiple bluetooth enabled devices to one another and any device with an auxiliary port to sync the sound output for an awesome yet easy set up party.

I can't fall asleep without the TV wish I could but my husband can't sleep with the TV so I needed something to allow me to watch TV and not disturb him at the same time and this device allows me to use a bluetooth speaker at my bedside no problem and there is no lag so the words match up with the screen which is perfect!

I need this for my TV to transmit Bluetooth to my headphones when neighbors get too noisy. This has a longer battery life than any other transmitters I used, it has a good quality, and importantly, it connects automatically to my headphones and the connection is stable throughout.

This little device is so useful! When I watch TV/movies, I really don't like to be interrupted and I don't like to keep increasing the volume of the TV.  This solves all those issues.  I can watch my 30-minutes of TV in complete peace - even if there are kids and people screaming around me.  Pairs very easy to my Beats and the battery lasts (so far) relatively long - the battery outlasts my headset battery. Highly recommend this product.

Very pleased with this little unit. Only use transmit to send the tv sound to wireless earbuds while using my treadmill. Joined with my AirPods flawlessly and quickly, and I get rich, clear tv sound. Also joins 2 headset so my wife and I can watch tv together at night and not bother anyone with sound. Recommend it without reservation.

Our TV was not Bluetooth.  This adapter enabled my husband to pair it to his hearing aids and now he can hear the programming without disturbing the neighborhood.  Easily attached,  Excellent device and very inexpensive.  Major plus -- my ears get a rest.

Wanted what they promised. The ability to use two headphones. Both would hook up but the static was awful and within a few moments one headset would stop working. Also, when I tried to register the product on their website I immediately got hit by a virus. One that told me Microsoft wanted me to call them to fix a code that was wrong. Totally froze my computer. Easy to fix but what a pain.

I wanted to set up background music in separate room from where my stereo system is set up.  The connection was easy peasy but the results are worthless.
